“ [I]73-catherine hardly know . [I]73-catherine never much thought about it . Something between both , [I]73-catherine think . Brown — not fair , and — and not very dark . ”[73-catherine]

“ Very well , [Catherine]73-catherine . That is exactly [he]2335-a man . [I]73-catherine have not forgot [your]73-catherine description of [Mr. Tilney—‘a]115-mr. tilney—‘a brown skin , with dark eyes , and rather dark hair . ’ Well , [my]73-catherine taste is different . “ Betray [you]73-catherine ! what do [you]73-catherine mean ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Nay , do not distress [me]73-catherine . [I]73-catherine believe [I]73-catherine have said too much . Let [us]2338-us drop the subject . ”[73-catherine]

[Catherine]73-catherine , in some amazement , complied , and after remaining a few moments silent , was on the point of reverting to what interested [her]513-her at that time rather more than anything else in [the world]191-the world , [Laurentina]110-laurentina ’s skeleton , when [[her]513-her friend]305-her friend prevented [her]513-her , by saying , “ For heaven ’s sake ! Let [us]2338-us move away from this end of [the room]301-the room . [They]2340-two odious young men will hardly follow [us]2338-us there . ”[305-her friend]

Away [they]516-they walked to the book ; and while [Isabella]108-isabella examined the names , it was [Catherine]73-catherine ’s employment to watch the proceedings of [these alarming young men]517-these alarming young men .

“ [They]2340-two odious young men are not coming this way , are [they]2340-two odious young men ? In a few moments [Catherine]73-catherine , with unaffected pleasure , assured [her]108-isabella that [she]108-isabella need not be longer uneasy , as [the gentlemen]2192-the gentlemen had just left [the pump - room]357-the pump - room .

“ And which way are [they]2340-two odious young men gone ? ”[108-isabella] said [Isabella]108-isabella , turning hastily round . “ [One]2201-one was [a very good - looking young man]2343-a very good - looking young man . ”[108-isabella]

“ [They]2340-two odious young men went towards [the church - yard]2344-the church - yard . ”[73-catherine]

“ But if [we]2346-we only wait a few minutes , there will be no danger of [our]2346-we seeing [them]2340-two odious young men at all . ”[108-isabella]

“ [I]73-catherine shall not pay [them]2340-two odious young men any such compliment , [I]73-catherine assure [you]73-catherine . [I]73-catherine have no notion of treating [men]2253-men with such respect . _ That _ is the way to spoil [them]2340-two odious young men . ”[73-catherine]

[Catherine]73-catherine had nothing to oppose against such reasoning ; and therefore , to show the independence of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , and [her]95-miss thorpe resolution of humbling [the sex]520-the sex , [they]521-they set off immediately as fast as [they]521-they could walk , in pursuit of [the two young men]351-the two young men .

CHAPTER 7

Half a minute conducted [them]521-they through [the pump - yard]523-the pump - yard to the archway , opposite [Union Passage]19-union passage ; but here [they]521-they were stopped . [Everybody acquainted with]524-everybody acquainted with [Bath]5-bath may remember the difficulties of crossing [Cheap Street]20-cheap street at this point ; [it]525-it is indeed [a street of so impertinent a nature]526-a street of so impertinent a nature , so unfortunately connected with the great [London]11-london and [Oxford roads]527-oxford roads , and [the principal inn of [the city]529-the city]528-the principal inn of the city , that a day never passes in which parties of [ladies]2246-ladies , however important [their]521-they business , whether in quest of pastry , [millinery]531-millinery , or even ( as in the present case ) of [young men]532-young men , are not detained on one side or other by [carriages]533-carriages , [horsemen]534-horsemen , or [carts]535-carts . This evil had been felt and lamented , at least three times a day , by [Isabella]108-isabella since [[her]108-isabella residence in [Bath]5-bath]536-her residence in bath ; and [she]108-isabella was now fated to feel and lament it once more , for at the very moment of coming opposite to [Union Passage]19-union passage , and within view of [the two gentlemen who were proceeding through [the crowds]538-the crowds , and threading the gutters of [that interesting alley]539-that interesting alley]537-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of that interesting alley , [they]537-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of that interesting alley were prevented crossing by the approach of a gig , driven along on bad pavement by [a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of [himself]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse , [[his]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse companion]541-his companion , and [his]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse horse]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse .

“ Oh , these odious gigs ! ”[108-isabella] said [Isabella]108-isabella , looking up . “ How [I]108-isabella detest [them]537-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of that interesting alley . ”[108-isabella] But this detestation , though so just , was of short duration , for [she]108-isabella looked again and exclaimed , “ Delightful ! [mr . Morland]73-catherine and [[my]108-isabella brother]2349-my brother ! ”[108-isabella]

“ Good heaven ! ’ Tis [James]103-james ! ”[73-catherine] was uttered at the same moment by [Catherine]73-catherine ; and , on catching [the young men]542-the young men ’s eyes , the horse was immediately checked with a violence which almost threw [him]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse on [his]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse haunches , and [the servant]543-the servant having now scampered up , [the gentlemen]2192-the gentlemen jumped out , and the equipage was delivered to [his]540-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse care .

[Catherine]73-catherine , by whom this meeting was wholly unexpected , received [[her]108-isabella brother]2287-her brother with the liveliest pleasure ; and [he]2287-her brother , being of a very amiable disposition , and sincerely attached to [her]108-isabella , gave every proof on [his]2287-her brother side of equal satisfaction , which [he]2287-her brother could have leisure to do , while the bright eyes of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe were incessantly challenging [his]2287-her brother notice ; and to [her]108-isabella [his]2287-her brother devoirs were speedily paid , with a mixture of joy and embarrassment which might have informed [Catherine]73-catherine , had [she]108-isabella been more expert in the development of [other people]225-other people ’s feelings , and less simply engrossed by [her]108-isabella own , that [[her]108-isabella brother]2287-her brother thought [[her]108-isabella friend]305-her friend quite as pretty as [she]108-isabella could do [herself]108-isabella .

[John Thorpe]97-john , who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses , soon joined [them]549-them , and from [him]2287-her brother [she]108-isabella directly received the amends which were [her]108-isabella due ; for while [he]2287-her brother slightly and carelessly touched the hand of [Isabella]108-isabella , on [her]108-isabella [he]2287-her brother bestowed a whole scrape and half a short bow . [He]2287-her brother was [a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form]550-a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form , seemed fearful of being too handsome unless [he]2287-her brother wore the dress of [a groom]551-a groom , and too much like [a gentleman]384-a gentleman unless [he]2287-her brother were easy where [he]2287-her brother ought to be civil , and impudent where [he]2287-her brother might be allowed to be easy . [He]2287-her brother took out [his]2287-her brother watch : “ How long do [you]108-isabella think [we]2350-we have been running it from [Tetbury]21-tetbury , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ? ”[2287-her brother]

“ [I]2287-her brother do not know the distance . ”[2287-her brother] [[Her]108-isabella brother]2287-her brother told [her]108-isabella that it was twenty - three miles .

“ _ Three_-and - twenty ! ”[95-miss thorpe] cried [Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , “ five - and - twenty if it is an inch . ”[95-miss thorpe] [Morland]84-miss morland remonstrated , pleaded the authority of road - books , [innkeepers]554-innkeepers , and [milestones]555-milestones ; but [[his]2287-her brother friend]556-his friend disregarded them all ; [he]2287-her brother had a surer test of distance . “ [I]2287-her brother know it must be five - and - twenty , ”[2287-her brother] said [he]2287-her brother , “ by the time [we]2350-we have been doing it . It is now half after one ; [we]2350-we drove out of [the inn - yard]2351-the inn - yard at [Tetbury]21-tetbury as the town clock struck eleven ; and [I]2287-her brother defy [any man in [England]2-england]2352-any man in england to make [my]2287-her brother horse go less than ten miles an hour in harness ; that makes it exactly twenty - five . ”[2287-her brother]

“ [You]84-miss morland have lost an hour , ”[84-miss morland] said [Morland]84-miss morland ; “ it was only ten o’clock when [we]2350-we came from [Tetbury]21-tetbury . ”[84-miss morland]

“ Ten o’clock ! it was eleven , upon [my]543-the servant soul ! [i]543-the servant counted every stroke . [This brother of yours]2353-this brother of yours would persuade [me]543-the servant out of [my]543-the servant senses , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ; do but look at [my]543-the servant horse ; did [you]84-miss morland ever see an animal so made for speed in [your]84-miss morland life ? ”[543-the servant] ( [The servant]543-the servant had just mounted [the carriage]558-the carriage and was driving off . ) “ Such true blood ! three hours and and a half indeed coming only three and twenty miles ! look at that creature , and suppose it possible if [you]84-miss morland can . ”[543-the servant]

“ [He]2353-this brother of yours _ does _ look very hot , to be sure . ”[84-miss morland]

“ Hot ! [he]2353-this brother of yours had not turned a hair till [we]2350-we came to [Walcot Church]22-walcot church ; but look at [his]2353-this brother of yours forehand ; look at [his]2353-this brother of yours loins ; only see how [he]2353-this brother of yours moves ; that horse _ can not _ go less than ten miles an hour : tie [his]2353-this brother of yours legs and [he]2353-this brother of yours will get on . What do [you]84-miss morland think of [my]543-the servant gig , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ? A neat one , is not it ? Well hung ; [town]2354-town - built ; [I]543-the servant have not had it a month . [It]2355-it was built for [a Christchurch man]2356-a christchurch man , [a friend of [mine]543-the servant]2357-a friend of mine , [a very good sort of fellow]2358-a very good sort of fellow ; [he]2356-a christchurch man ran [it]2355-it a few weeks , till , [I]543-the servant believe , it was convenient to have done with it . [I]543-the servant happened just then to be looking out for some light thing of the kind , though [I]543-the servant had pretty well determined on a curricle too ; but [I]543-the servant chanced to meet [him]2356-a christchurch man on [Magdalen Bridge]23-magdalen bridge , as [he]2356-a christchurch man was driving into [Oxford]10-oxford , last term : ‘ Ah ! thorpe , ’ said [he]2356-a christchurch man , ‘ do [you]543-the servant happen to want such a little thing as this ? It is a capital one of the kind , but [I]543-the servant am cursed tired of it . ’ ‘ Oh ! d — , ’ said [I]543-the servant ; ‘ [I]543-the servant am [[your]2356-a christchurch man man]2359-your man ; what do [you]2356-a christchurch man ask ? ’ And how much do [you]2356-a christchurch man think [he]2356-a christchurch man did , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ? ”[543-the servant]

“ [I]84-miss morland am sure [I]84-miss morland can not guess at all . ”[84-miss morland]

“ Curricle - hung , [you]2356-a christchurch man see ; seat , trunk , sword - case , splashing - board , lamps , silver moulding , all [you]2356-a christchurch man see complete ; the iron - work as good as new , or better . [He]2356-a christchurch man asked fifty guineas ; [I]543-the servant closed with [him]2356-a christchurch man directly , threw down the money , and [the carriage]558-the carriage was mine . ”[543-the servant]

“ And [I]73-catherine am sure , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , “ [I]73-catherine know so little of such things that [I]73-catherine can not judge whether it was cheap or dear . ”[73-catherine]

“ Neither one nor t’other ; [I]543-the servant might have got it for less , [I]543-the servant dare say ; but [I]543-the servant hate haggling , and poor [Freeman]117-freeman wanted cash . ”[543-the servant]

“ That was very good - natured of [you]543-the servant , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , quite pleased .

“ Oh ! d — — it , when one has the means of doing a kind thing by [a friend]446-a friend , [I]543-the servant hate to be pitiful . ”[543-the servant]

An inquiry now took place into the intended movements of [the young ladies]559-the young ladies ; and , on finding whither [they]559-the young ladies were going , it was decided that [the gentlemen]2192-the gentlemen should accompany [them]559-the young ladies to [[Edgar]116-edgar ’s Buildings]2345-edgar ’s buildings , and pay [their]2192-the gentlemen respects to [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe . [James]103-james and [Isabella]108-isabella led the way ; and so well satisfied was [the latter]562-the latter with [her]96-mrs. thorpe lot , so contentedly was [she]96-mrs. thorpe endeavouring to ensure a pleasant walk to [him]562-the latter who brought the double recommendation of being [[her]96-mrs. thorpe brother ’s friend]563-her brother ’s friend , and [[[her]96-mrs. thorpe friend]305-her friend ’s brother]565-her friend ’s brother , so pure and uncoquettish were [her]96-mrs. thorpe feelings , that , though [they]559-the young ladies overtook and passed [the two offending young men]566-the two offending young men in [Milsom Street]14-milsom street , [she]96-mrs. thorpe was so far from seeking to attract [their]566-the two offending young men notice , that [she]96-mrs. thorpe looked back at [them]566-the two offending young men only three times .

[John Thorpe]97-john kept of course with [Catherine]73-catherine , and , after a few minutes ’ silence , renewed the conversation about [his]97-john gig . “ [You]73-catherine will find , however , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , it would be reckoned a cheap thing by [some people]2362-some people , for [I]97-john might have sold it for ten guineas more the next day ; [Jackson]118-jackson , of [Oriel]24-oriel , bid [me]97-john sixty at once ; [Morland]84-miss morland was with [me]97-john at the time . ”[97-john]

“ Yes , ”[84-miss morland] said [Morland]84-miss morland , who overheard this ; “ but [you]73-catherine forget that [your]73-catherine horse was included . ”[84-miss morland]

“ [My]97-john horse ! oh , d — — it ! [i]97-john would not sell [my]97-john horse for a hundred . Are [you]73-catherine fond of [an open carriage]2363-an open carriage , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ? ”[97-john]

“ Yes , very ; [I]84-miss morland have hardly ever an opportunity of being in one ; but [I]84-miss morland am particularly fond of it . ”[84-miss morland]

“ [I]97-john am glad of it ; [I]97-john will drive [you]73-catherine out in [mine]97-john every day . ”[97-john]

“ Thank [you]73-catherine , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , in some distress , from a doubt of the propriety of accepting such an offer .

“ [I]97-john will drive [you]73-catherine up [Lansdown Hill]25-lansdown hill to - morrow . ”[97-john]

“ Thank [you]73-catherine ; but will not [your]73-catherine horse want rest ? ”[97-john]

“ Rest ! [he]2364-he has only come three and twenty miles to - day ; all nonsense ; nothing ruins horses so much as rest ; nothing knocks [them]2364-he up so soon . No , no ; [I]97-john shall exercise mine at the average of four hours every day while [I]97-john am here . ”[97-john]

“ Shall [you]73-catherine indeed ! ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine very seriously . “ That will be forty miles a day . ”[73-catherine]

“ Forty ! aye , fifty , for what [I]97-john care . Well , [I]97-john will drive [you]73-catherine up [Lansdown]26-lansdown to - morrow ; mind , [I]97-john am engaged . ”[97-john]

“ How delightful that will be ! ”[108-isabella] cried [Isabella]108-isabella , turning round . “ [[My]108-isabella dearest]2292-my dearest [Catherine]73-catherine , [I]108-isabella quite envy [you]73-catherine ; but [I]108-isabella am afraid , [brother]2366-brother , [you]73-catherine will not have room for a third . ”[108-isabella]

“ A third indeed ! no , no ; [I]97-john did not come to [Bath]5-bath to drive [[my]97-john sisters]2367-my sisters about ; that would be a good joke , faith ! [morland]73-catherine must take care of [you]73-catherine . ”[97-john]

This brought on a dialogue of civilities between [the other two]567-the other two ; but [Catherine]73-catherine heard neither the particulars nor the result . [[Her]568-her companion]569-her companion ’s discourse now sunk from its hitherto animated pitch to nothing more than a short decisive sentence of praise or condemnation on the face of [every woman [they]571-they met]570-every woman they met ; and [Catherine]73-catherine , after listening and agreeing as long as [she]568-her could , with all the civility and deference of [the youthful female mind]572-the youthful female mind , fearful of hazarding an opinion of its own in opposition to that of [a self - assured man]573-a self - assured man , especially where the beauty of [her]568-her own sex is concerned , ventured at length to vary the subject by a question which had been long uppermost in [her]568-her thoughts ; it was , “ Have [you]573-a self - assured man ever read [Udolpho]109-udolpho , [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ? ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ [Udolpho]109-udolpho ! oh , [Lord]2368-lord ! not [I]573-a self - assured man ; [I]573-a self - assured man never read novels ; [I]573-a self - assured man have something else to do . ”[573-a self - assured man]

[Catherine]73-catherine , humbled and ashamed , was going to apologize for [her]568-her question , but [he]573-a self - assured man prevented [her]568-her by saying , “ Novels are all so full of nonsense and stuff ; there has not been a tolerably decent one come out since [Tom Jones]120-tom jones , except [The Monk]121-the monk ; [I]573-a self - assured man read that t’other day ; but as for all the others , they are the stupidest things in creation . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ [I]573-a self - assured man think [you]73-catherine must like [Udolpho]109-udolpho , if [you]73-catherine were to read it ; it is so very interesting . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ Not [I]573-a self - assured man , faith ! no , if [I]573-a self - assured man read any , it shall be [Mrs. Radcliffe]122-mrs. radcliffe ’s ; [her]122-mrs. radcliffe novels are amusing enough ; they are worth reading ; some fun and nature in _ them _ . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ Udolpho was written by [Mrs. Radcliffe]122-mrs. radcliffe , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , with some hesitation , from the fear of mortifying [him]573-a self - assured man .

“ No , sure ; was it ? Aye , [I]573-a self - assured man remember , so it was ; [I]573-a self - assured man was thinking of that other stupid book , written by [that woman [they]2370-they make such a fuss about , [she]2369-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant who married [the French emigrant]2371-the french emigrant]2369-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ [I]573-a self - assured man suppose [you]573-a self - assured man mean [Camilla]107-camilla ? ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ Yes , that ’s the book ; such unnatural stuff ! [an old man playing at see - saw]2372-an old man playing at see - saw , [I]573-a self - assured man took up the first volume once and looked it over , but [I]573-a self - assured man soon found it would not do ; indeed [I]573-a self - assured man guessed what sort of stuff it must be before [I]573-a self - assured man saw it : as soon as [I]573-a self - assured man heard [she]122-mrs. radcliffe had married [an emigrant]2373-an emigrant , [I]573-a self - assured man was sure [I]573-a self - assured man should never be able to get through it . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ [I]573-a self - assured man have never read it . ”[573-a self - assured man]

“ [You]73-catherine had no loss , [I]573-a self - assured man assure [you]73-catherine ; it is the horridest nonsense [you]73-catherine can imagine ; there is nothing in [the world]191-the world in it but [an old man]2375-an old man ’s playing at see - saw and learning Latin ; upon [my]573-a self - assured man soul there is not . ”[573-a self - assured man]

This critique , the justness of which was unfortunately lost on poor [Catherine]73-catherine , brought [them]574-them to the door of [[Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe ’s lodgings]575-mrs. thorpe ’s lodgings , and the feelings of [the discerning and unprejudiced reader of [Camilla]107-camilla]576-the discerning and unprejudiced reader of camilla gave way to the feelings of [the dutiful and affectionate son]577-the dutiful and affectionate son , as [they]574-them met [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe , who had descried [them]574-them from above , in [the passage]578-the passage . “ Ah , [Mother]123-mother ! How do [you]96-mrs. thorpe do ? ”[579-he] said [he]579-he , giving [her]96-mrs. thorpe a hearty shake of the hand . “ Where did [you]96-mrs. thorpe get that quiz of a hat ? It makes [you]96-mrs. thorpe look like [an old witch]2376-an old witch . Here is [Morland]73-catherine and [I]579-he come to stay a few days with [you]96-mrs. thorpe , so [you]96-mrs. thorpe must look out for a couple of good beds somewhere near . ”[579-he] And this address seemed to satisfy all the fondest wishes of [the mother]424-the mother ’s heart , for [she]96-mrs. thorpe received [him]579-he with the most delighted and exulting affection . On [[his]579-he two younger sisters]581-his two younger sisters [he]579-he then bestowed an equal portion of [his]579-he fraternal tenderness , for [he]579-he asked each of [them]581-his two younger sisters how [they]581-his two younger sisters did , and observed that [they]581-his two younger sisters both looked very ugly .

These manners did not please [Catherine]73-catherine ; but [he]579-he was [[James]103-james ’s friend]582-james ’s friend and [[Isabella]108-isabella ’s brother]583-isabella ’s brother ; and [her]96-mrs. thorpe judgment was further bought off by [Isabella]108-isabella ’s assuring [her]96-mrs. thorpe , when [they]584-they withdrew to see the new hat , that [John]97-john thought [her]96-mrs. thorpe [the most charming girl in [the world]191-the world]585-the most charming girl in the world , and by [John]97-john ’s engaging [her]96-mrs. thorpe before [they]584-they parted to dance with [him]97-john that evening . Had [she]96-mrs. thorpe been older or vainer , such attacks might have done little ; but , where youth and diffidence are united , it requires uncommon steadiness of reason to resist the attraction of being called [the most charming girl in [the world]191-the world]585-the most charming girl in the world , and of being so very early engaged as [a partner]2186-a partner ; and the consequence was that , when [the two Morlands]590-the two morlands , after sitting an hour with [the Thorpes]102-the thorpes , set off to walk together to [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s , and [James]103-james , as the door was closed on [them]584-they , said , “ Well , [Catherine]73-catherine , how do [you]73-catherine like [[my]103-james friend]2377-my friend [Thorpe]97-john ? ”[103-james] instead of answering , as [she]96-mrs. thorpe probably would have done , had there been no friendship and no flattery in the case , “ [I]96-mrs. thorpe do not like [him]97-john at all , ”[96-mrs. thorpe] [she]96-mrs. thorpe directly replied , “ [I]96-mrs. thorpe like [him]97-john very much ; [he]97-john seems very agreeable . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ [He]97-john is as good - natured [a fellow as ever lived]2378-a fellow as ever lived ; a little of a rattle ; but that will recommend [him]97-john to [your]73-catherine sex , [I]96-mrs. thorpe believe : and how do [you]73-catherine like [the rest of [the family]454-the family]2379-the rest of the family ? ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Very , very much indeed : [Isabella]108-isabella particularly . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ [I]96-mrs. thorpe am very glad to hear [you]73-catherine say so ; [she]108-isabella is just [the kind of young woman [I]96-mrs. thorpe could wish to see [you]73-catherine attached to]2381-the kind of young woman i could wish to see you attached to ; [she]108-isabella has so much good sense , and is so thoroughly unaffected and amiable ; [I]96-mrs. thorpe always wanted [you]73-catherine to know [her]108-isabella ; and [she]108-isabella seems very fond of [you]73-catherine . [She]108-isabella said the highest things in [your]73-catherine praise that could possibly be ; and the praise of [such a girl as [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe]2382-such a girl as miss thorpe even [you]73-catherine , [Catherine]73-catherine , ”[96-mrs. thorpe] taking [her]591-i hand with affection , “ may be proud of . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Indeed [I]591-i am , ”[591-i] [she]591-i replied ; “ [I]591-i love [her]108-isabella exceedingly , and am delighted to find that [you]73-catherine like [her]108-isabella too . [You]73-catherine hardly mentioned anything of [her]108-isabella when [you]73-catherine wrote to [me]591-i after [your]73-catherine visit [there]2232-there . ”[591-i]

“ Because [I]96-mrs. thorpe thought [I]96-mrs. thorpe should soon see [you]73-catherine [myself]96-mrs. thorpe . [I]96-mrs. thorpe hope [you]73-catherine will be a great deal together while [you]73-catherine are in [Bath]5-bath . [She]108-isabella is [a most amiable girl]2384-a most amiable girl ; such a superior understanding ! how fond all [the family]454-the family are of [her]108-isabella ; [she]108-isabella is evidently [the general favourite]2386-the general favourite ; and how much [she]108-isabella must be admired in such a place as this — is not [she]108-isabella ? ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Yes , very much indeed , [I]591-i fancy ; [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen thinks [her]108-isabella [the prettiest girl in [Bath]5-bath]2387-the prettiest girl in bath . ”[591-i]

“ [I]96-mrs. thorpe dare say [he]83-mr. allen does ; and [I]96-mrs. thorpe do not know [any man who is [a better judge of beauty]2389-a better judge of beauty than [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen]2388-any man who is a better judge of beauty than mr. allen . [I]96-mrs. thorpe need not ask [you]2390-you whether [you]2390-you are happy here , [[my]96-mrs. thorpe dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine ; with such a companion and friend as [Isabella Thorpe]101-isabella , it would be impossible for [you]2390-you to be otherwise ; and [the Allens]104-the allens , [I]96-mrs. thorpe am sure , are very kind to [you]2390-you ? ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Yes , very kind ; [I]591-i never was so happy before ; and now [you]2390-you are come it will be more delightful than ever ; how good it is of [you]2390-you to come so far on purpose to see _ [me]591-i _ . ”[591-i]

[James]103-james accepted this tribute of gratitude , and qualified [his]103-james conscience for accepting it too , by saying with perfect sincerity , “ Indeed , [Catherine]73-catherine , [I]103-james love [you]2390-you dearly . ”[103-james]

Inquiries and communications concerning [brothers]592-brothers and [sisters]410-sisters , the situation of some , the growth of the rest , and other family matters now passed between [them]594-them , and continued , with only one small digression on [James]103-james ’s part , in praise of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , till [they]594-them reached [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , where [he]103-james was welcomed with great kindness by [Mr.]595-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , invited by [the former]596-the former to dine with [them]594-them , and summoned by [the latter]562-the latter to guess the price and weigh the merits of a new muff and tippet . A pre - engagement in [[Edgar]116-edgar ’s Buildings]2345-edgar ’s buildings prevented [his]103-james accepting the invitation of [one friend]599-one friend , and obliged [him]103-james to hurry away as soon as [he]103-james had satisfied the demands of [the other]412-the other . The time of [the two parties]601-the two parties uniting in [the Octagon Room]602-the octagon room being correctly adjusted , [Catherine]73-catherine was then left to the luxury of a raised , restless , and frightened imagination over the pages of [Udolpho]109-udolpho , lost from all worldly concerns of dressing and dinner , incapable of soothing [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ’s fears on the delay of [an expected dressmaker]603-an expected dressmaker , and having only one minute in sixty to bestow even on the reflection of [her]604-her own felicity , in being already engaged for the evening .

CHAPTER 8

In spite of [Udolpho]109-udolpho and [the dressmaker]605-the dressmaker , however , [the party from [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street]606-the party from pulteney street reached [the Upper Rooms]296-the upper rooms in very good time . [The Thorpes]102-the thorpes and [James Morland]103-james were there only two minutes before [them]102-the thorpes ; and [Isabella]101-isabella having gone through the usual ceremonial of meeting [[her]101-isabella friend]305-her friend with the most smiling and affectionate haste , of admiring the set of [her]101-isabella gown , and envying the curl of [her]101-isabella hair , [they]601-the two parties followed [[their]601-the two parties chaperons]609-their chaperons , arm in arm , into [the ballroom]300-the ballroom , whispering to [each other]330-each other whenever a thought occurred , and supplying the place of many ideas by a squeeze of the hand or a smile of affection .

The dancing began within a few minutes after [they]601-the two parties were seated ; and [James]103-james , who had been engaged quite as long as [[his]103-james sister]2288-his sister , was very importunate with [Isabella]101-isabella to stand up ; but [John]97-john was gone into [the card - room]303-the card - room to speak to [a friend]446-a friend , and nothing , [she]446-a friend declared , should induce [her]446-a friend to join the set before [[her]446-a friend dear]475-her dear [Catherine]73-catherine could join it too . “ [I]446-a friend assure [you]73-catherine , ”[446-a friend] said [she]446-a friend , “ [I]446-a friend would not stand up without [[your]73-catherine dear sister]2392-your dear sister for [all the world]2393-all the world ; for if [I]446-a friend did [we]616-they should certainly be separated the whole evening . ”[446-a friend] [Catherine]73-catherine accepted this kindness with gratitude , and [they]616-they continued as [they]616-they were for three minutes longer , when [Isabella]101-isabella , who had been talking to [James]103-james on the other side of [her]446-a friend , turned again to [[his]103-james sister]2288-his sister and whispered , “ [[My]101-isabella dear creature]2394-my dear creature , [I]101-isabella am afraid [I]101-isabella must leave [you]2394-my dear creature , [[your]2394-my dear creature brother]2395-your brother is so amazingly impatient to begin ; [I]101-isabella know [you]2394-my dear creature will not mind [my]101-isabella going away , and [I]101-isabella dare say [John]97-john will be back in a moment , and then [you]2394-my dear creature may easily find [me]101-isabella out . ”[101-isabella] [Catherine]73-catherine , though a little disappointed , had too much good nature to make any opposition , and [the others]2286-the others rising up , [Isabella]101-isabella had only time to press [[her]101-isabella friend]305-her friend ’s hand and say , “ Good - bye , [[my]2286-the others dear love]2396-my dear love , ”[2286-the others] before [they]620-they hurried off . [The younger Miss Thorpes]102-the thorpes being also dancing , [Catherine]73-catherine was left to the mercy of [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , between whom [she]621-her now remained . [She]621-her could not help being vexed at the non - appearance of [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , for [she]621-her not only longed to be dancing , but was likewise aware that , as the real dignity of [her]621-her situation could not be known , [she]621-her was sharing with the scores of [other young ladies]622-other young ladies still sitting down all the discredit of wanting [a partner]2186-a partner . To be disgraced in the eye of [the world]191-the world , to wear the appearance of infamy while [her]621-her heart is all purity , [her]621-her actions all innocence , and the misconduct of another the true source of [her]621-her debasement , is one of those circumstances which peculiarly belong to [the heroine]625-the heroine ’s life , and [her]621-her fortitude under it what particularly dignifies [her]621-her character . [Catherine]73-catherine had fortitude too ; [she]621-her suffered , but no murmur passed [her]621-her lips .

From this state of humiliation , [she]621-her was roused , at the end of ten minutes , to a pleasanter feeling , by seeing , not [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , but [Mr. Tilney]92-henry , within three yards of the place where [they]626-they sat ; [he]92-henry seemed to be moving that way , but [he]92-henry did not see [her]621-her , and therefore the smile and the blush , which [his]92-henry sudden reappearance raised in [Catherine]73-catherine , passed away without sullying [her]621-her heroic importance . [He]92-henry looked as handsome and as lively as ever , and was talking with interest to [a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman]627-a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman , who leant on [his]92-henry arm , and whom [Catherine]73-catherine immediately guessed to be [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister ; thus unthinkingly throwing away a fair opportunity of considering [him]92-henry lost to [her]621-her forever , by being married already . But guided only by what was simple and probable , it had never entered [her]621-her head that [Mr. Tilney]92-henry could be married ; [he]92-henry had not behaved , [he]92-henry had not talked , like [the married men to whom [she]621-her had been used]629-the married men to whom she had been used ; [he]92-henry had never mentioned [a wife]630-a wife , and [he]92-henry had acknowledged [a sister]631-a sister . From these circumstances sprang the instant conclusion of [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister ’s now being by [his]92-henry side ; and therefore , instead of turning of a deathlike paleness and falling in a fit on [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ’s bosom , [Catherine]73-catherine sat erect , in the perfect use of [her]621-her senses , and with cheeks only a little redder than usual .

[Mr. Tilney]92-henry and [[his]92-henry companion]541-his companion , who continued , though slowly , to approach , were immediately preceded by [a lady]634-a lady , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe]635-an acquaintance of mrs. thorpe ; and [this lady]636-this lady stopping to speak to [her]621-her , [they]637-they , as belonging to [her]621-her , stopped likewise , and [Catherine]73-catherine , catching [Mr. Tilney]92-henry ’s eye , instantly received from [him]92-henry the smiling tribute of recognition . [She]621-her returned it with pleasure , and then advancing still nearer , [he]92-henry spoke both to [her]621-her and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , by whom [he]92-henry was very civilly acknowledged . “ [I]92-henry am very happy to see [you]86-mrs. allen again , [sir]2221-sir , indeed ; [I]92-henry was afraid [you]86-mrs. allen had left [Bath]5-bath . ”[92-henry] [He]92-henry thanked [her]621-her for [her]621-her fears , and said that [he]92-henry had quitted [it]638-it for a week , on the very morning after [his]92-henry having had the pleasure of seeing [her]621-her .

“ Well , [sir]2221-sir , and [I]86-mrs. allen dare say [you]2221-sir are not sorry to be back again , for it is just the place for [young people]2399-young people — and indeed for [everybody else]2400-everybody else too . [I]86-mrs. allen tell [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen , when [he]83-mr. allen talks of being sick of [it]638-it , that [I]86-mrs. allen am sure [he]83-mr. allen should not complain , for it is so very agreeable [a place]2401-a place , that it is much better to be [here]280-here than at [home]2403-home at this dull time of year . [I]86-mrs. allen tell [him]83-mr. allen [he]83-mr. allen is quite in luck to be sent [here]280-here for [his]83-mr. allen health . ”[86-mrs. allen]

“ And [I]96-mrs. thorpe hope , [madam]2214-madam , that [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen will be obliged to like [the place]2220-the place , from finding [it]2220-the place of service to [him]83-mr. allen . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Thank [you]96-mrs. thorpe , [sir]2221-sir . [I]86-mrs. allen have no doubt that [he]83-mr. allen will . [A neighbour of [ours]639-they]2408-a neighbour of ours , [Dr. Skinner]124-dr. skinner , was here for [his]124-dr. skinner health last winter , and came away quite stout . ”[86-mrs. allen]

“ That circumstance must give great encouragement . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Yes , [sir]2221-sir — and [Dr. Skinner]124-dr. skinner and [[his]124-dr. skinner family]429-his family were here three months ; so [I]86-mrs. allen tell [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen [he]83-mr. allen must not be in a hurry to get away . ”[86-mrs. allen]

Here [they]639-they were interrupted by a request from [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe to [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , that [she]96-mrs. thorpe would move a little to accommodate [Mrs. Hughes]125-mrs. hughes and [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney with seats , as [they]639-they had agreed to join [[their]639-they party]640-their party . This was accordingly done , [Mr. Tilney]92-henry still continuing standing before [them]639-they ; and after a few minutes ’ consideration , [he]92-henry asked [Catherine]73-catherine to dance with [him]92-henry . This compliment , delightful as it was , produced severe mortification to [the lady]378-the lady ; and in giving [her]378-the lady denial , [she]378-the lady expressed [her]378-the lady sorrow on the occasion so very much as if [she]378-the lady really felt it , that had [Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe , who joined [her]378-the lady just afterwards , been half a minute earlier , [he]92-henry might have thought [her]378-the lady sufferings rather too acute . The very easy manner in which [he]92-henry then told [her]378-the lady that [he]92-henry had kept [her]378-the lady waiting did not by any means reconcile [her]378-the lady more to [her]378-the lady lot ; nor did the particulars which [he]92-henry entered into while [they]639-they were standing up , of the horses and dogs of [the friend whom [he]92-henry had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between [them]639-they]642-the friend whom he had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between them , interest [her]378-the lady so much as to prevent [her]378-the lady looking very often towards that part of [the room where [she]378-the lady had left [Mr. Tilney]92-henry]643-the room where she had left mr. tilney . Of [her]378-the lady dear Isabella , to whom [she]378-the lady particularly longed to point out [that gentleman]644-that gentleman , [she]378-the lady could see nothing . [They]645-they were in different sets . [She]378-the lady was separated from all [her]378-the lady party , and away from all [her]378-the lady acquaintance ; one mortification succeeded another , and from the whole [she]378-the lady deduced this useful lesson , that to go previously engaged to a ball does not necessarily increase either the dignity or enjoyment of [a young lady]241-a young lady . From such a moralizing strain as this , [she]378-the lady was suddenly roused by a touch on the shoulder , and turning round , perceived [Mrs. Hughes]125-mrs. hughes directly behind [her]378-the lady , attended by [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney and [a gentleman]384-a gentleman . “ [I]378-the lady beg [your]644-that gentleman pardon , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , ”[378-the lady] said [she]378-the lady , “ for this liberty — but [I]378-the lady can not anyhow get to [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , and [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe said [she]96-mrs. thorpe was sure [you]644-that gentleman would not have the least objection to letting in [this young lady]2411-this young lady by [you]644-that gentleman . ”[378-the lady] [Mrs. Hughes]125-mrs. hughes could not have applied to any creature in [the room]301-the room more happy to oblige [her]378-the lady than [Catherine]73-catherine . [The young ladies]559-the young ladies were introduced to [each other]330-each other , [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney expressing a proper sense of such goodness , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland with the real delicacy of a generous mind making light of the obligation ; and [Mrs. Hughes]125-mrs. hughes , satisfied with having so respectably settled [[her]125-mrs. hughes young charge]483-her young charge , returned to [her]125-mrs. hughes party .

[Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney had a good figure , a pretty face , and a very agreeable countenance ; and [her]125-mrs. hughes air , though it had not all the decided pretension , the resolute stylishness of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s , had more real elegance . [Her]125-mrs. hughes manners showed good sense and good breeding ; they were neither shy nor affectedly open ; and [she]125-mrs. hughes seemed capable of being young , attractive , and at a ball without wanting to fix the attention of [every man near [her]125-mrs. hughes]652-every man near her , and without exaggerated feelings of ecstatic delight or inconceivable vexation on every little trifling occurrence . [Catherine]73-catherine , interested at once by [her]125-mrs. hughes appearance and [her]125-mrs. hughes relationship to [Mr. Tilney]92-henry , was desirous of being acquainted with [her]125-mrs. hughes , and readily talked therefore whenever [she]125-mrs. hughes could think of anything to say , and had courage and leisure for saying it . But the hindrance thrown in the way of a very speedy intimacy , by the frequent want of one or more of these requisites , prevented [their]653-their doing more than going through the first rudiments of [an acquaintance]654-an acquaintance , by informing [themselves]653-their how well the other liked [Bath]5-bath , how much [she]125-mrs. hughes admired [[its]5-bath buildings]655-its buildings and [surrounding country]656-surrounding country , whether [she]125-mrs. hughes drew , or played , or sang , and whether [she]125-mrs. hughes was fond of riding on horseback .

The two dances were scarcely concluded before [Catherine]73-catherine found [her]125-mrs. hughes arm gently seized by [her]125-mrs. hughes faithful Isabella , who in great spirits exclaimed , “ At last [I]125-mrs. hughes have got [you]73-catherine . [[My]125-mrs. hughes dearest]2292-my dearest creature , [I]125-mrs. hughes have been looking for [you]73-catherine this hour . What could induce [you]73-catherine to come into this set , when [you]73-catherine knew [I]125-mrs. hughes was in the other ? [I]125-mrs. hughes have been quite wretched without [you]73-catherine . ”[125-mrs. hughes]

“ [[My]103-james dear]2185-my dear [Isabella]101-isabella , how was it possible for [me]103-james to get at [you]73-catherine ? [I]103-james could not even see where [you]73-catherine were . ”[103-james]

“ So [I]125-mrs. hughes told [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother all the time — but [he]2395-your brother would not believe [me]125-mrs. hughes . Do go and see for [her]101-isabella , [Mr. Morland]103-james , said [I]125-mrs. hughes — but all in vain — [he]2395-your brother would not stir an inch . Was not it so , [Mr. Morland]103-james ? But [[you]73-catherine men]2415-you men are all so immoderately lazy ! [i]125-mrs. hughes have been scolding [him]2395-your brother to such a degree , [[my]125-mrs. hughes dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , [you]73-catherine would be quite amazed . [You]73-catherine know [I]125-mrs. hughes never stand upon ceremony with [such people]2417-such people . ”[125-mrs. hughes]

“ Look at [that young lady with the white beads round [her]2418-that young lady with the white beads round her head head]2418-that young lady with the white beads round her head , ”[73-catherine] whispered [Catherine]73-catherine , detaching [[her]657-her friend]305-her friend from [James]103-james . “ It is [[Mr. Tilney]92-henry ’s sister]2419-mr. tilney ’s sister . ”[73-catherine]

“ Oh ! heavens ! [you]125-mrs. hughes do n’t say so ! let [me]125-mrs. hughes look at [her]2418-that young lady with the white beads round her head this moment . What [a delightful girl]2420-a delightful girl ! [i]125-mrs. hughes never saw anything half so beautiful ! but where is [[her]2418-that young lady with the white beads round her head all - conquering brother]2421-her all - conquering brother ? Is [he]2421-her all - conquering brother in [the room]301-the room ? Point [him]2421-her all - conquering brother out to [me]125-mrs. hughes this instant , if [he]2421-her all - conquering brother is . [I]125-mrs. hughes die to see [him]2421-her all - conquering brother . [Mr. Morland]103-james , [you]103-james are not to listen . [We]2423-we are not talking about [you]103-james . ”[125-mrs. hughes]

“ But what is all this whispering about ? What is going on ? ”[73-catherine]

“ There now , [I]125-mrs. hughes knew how it would be . [[You]103-james men]2415-you men have such restless curiosity ! talk of the curiosity of [women]2251-women , indeed ! ’ Tis nothing . But be satisfied , for [you]103-james are not to know anything at all of the matter . ”[125-mrs. hughes]

“ And is that likely to satisfy [me]73-catherine , do [you]103-james think ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Well , [I]125-mrs. hughes declare [I]125-mrs. hughes never knew anything like [you]103-james . What can it signify to [you]103-james , what [we]2423-we are talking of . Perhaps [we]2423-we are talking about [you]103-james ; therefore [I]125-mrs. hughes would advise [you]103-james not to listen , or [you]103-james may happen to hear something not very agreeable . ”[125-mrs. hughes]

In this commonplace chatter , which lasted some time , the original subject seemed entirely forgotten ; and though [Catherine]73-catherine was very well pleased to have it dropped for a while , [she]659-me could not avoid a little suspicion at the total suspension of all [Isabella]101-isabella ’s impatient desire to see [Mr. Tilney]92-henry . When [the orchestra]660-the orchestra struck up a fresh dance , [James]103-james would have led [[his]103-james fair partner]661-his fair partner away , but [she]659-me resisted . “ [I]659-me tell [you]103-james , [Mr. Morland]103-james , ”[659-me] [she]659-me cried , “ [I]659-me would not do such a thing for all [the world]191-the world . How can [you]103-james be so teasing ; only conceive , [[my]659-me dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , what [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother wants [me]659-me to do . [He]2395-your brother wants [me]659-me to dance with [him]2395-your brother again , though [I]659-me tell [him]2395-your brother that it is a most improper thing , and entirely against the rules . It would make [us]2429-us the talk of [the place]2220-the place , if [we]2429-us were not to change [partners]2431-partners . ”[659-me]

“ Upon [my]103-james honour , ”[103-james] said [James]103-james , “ in these public assemblies , it is as often done as not . ”[103-james]

“ Nonsense , how can [you]103-james say so ? But when [[you]103-james [men]2253-men]2415-you men have a point to carry , [you]103-james never stick at anything . [My]659-me sweet [Catherine]73-catherine , do support [me]659-me ; persuade [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother how impossible it is . Tell [him]2395-your brother that it would quite shock [you]73-catherine to see [me]659-me do such a thing ; now would not it ? ”[659-me]

“ No , not at all ; but if [you]73-catherine think it wrong , [you]73-catherine had much better change . ”[103-james]

“ There , ”[101-isabella] cried [Isabella]101-isabella , “ [you]73-catherine hear what [[your]73-catherine sister]2261-your sister says , and yet [you]73-catherine will not mind [her]2261-your sister . Well , remember that it is not [my]101-isabella fault , if [we]662-we set all [the old ladies]2436-the old ladies in [Bath]5-bath in a bustle . Come along , [[my]101-isabella dearest]2292-my dearest [Catherine]73-catherine , for heaven ’s sake , and stand by [me]101-isabella . ”[101-isabella] And off [they]662-we went , to regain [their]662-we former place . [John Thorpe]97-john , in the meanwhile , had walked away ; and [Catherine]73-catherine , ever willing to give [Mr. Tilney]92-henry an opportunity of repeating the agreeable request which had already flattered [her]663-her once , made [her]663-her way to [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen and [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe as fast as [she]663-her could , in the hope of finding [him]97-john still with [them]662-we — a hope which , when it proved to be fruitless , [she]663-her felt to have been highly unreasonable . “ Well , [[my]96-mrs. thorpe dear]2185-my dear , ”[96-mrs. thorpe] said [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe , impatient for praise of [[her]96-mrs. thorpe son]664-her son , “ [I]96-mrs. thorpe hope [you]2185-my dear have had [an agreeable partner]2439-an agreeable partner . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Very agreeable , [madam]2214-madam . ”[663-her]

“ [I]96-mrs. thorpe am glad of it . [John]97-john has charming spirits , has not [he]97-john ? ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Did [you]2185-my dear meet [Mr. Tilney]92-henry , [[my]86-mrs. allen dear]2185-my dear ? ”[86-mrs. allen] said [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen .

“ No , where is [he]97-john ? ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ [He]97-john was with [us]2442-us just now , and said [he]97-john was so tired of lounging about , that [he]97-john was resolved to go and dance ; so [I]96-mrs. thorpe thought perhaps [he]97-john would ask [you]73-catherine , if [he]97-john met with [you]73-catherine . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

“ Where can [he]97-john be ? ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , looking round ; but [she]665-she had not looked round long before [she]665-she saw [him]666-him leading [a young lady]241-a young lady to the dance .

“ Ah ! [he]97-john has got [a partner]2186-a partner ; [I]86-mrs. allen wish [he]97-john had asked _ [you]73-catherine _ , ”[86-mrs. allen] said [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ; and after a short silence , [she]241-a young lady added , “ [he]97-john is [a very agreeable young man]2240-a very agreeable young man . ”[241-a young lady]

“ Indeed [he]97-john is , [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , ”[96-mrs. thorpe] said [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe , smiling complacently ; “ [I]96-mrs. thorpe must say it , though [I]96-mrs. thorpe _ am _ [[his]97-john mother]2445-his mother , that there is not [a more agreeable young man in [the world]191-the world]2446-a more agreeable young man in the world . ”[96-mrs. thorpe]

This inapplicable answer might have been too much for the comprehension of many ; but it did not puzzle [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , for after only a moment ’s consideration , [she]241-a young lady said , in a whisper to [Catherine]73-catherine , “ [I]241-a young lady dare say [she]96-mrs. thorpe thought [I]241-a young lady was speaking of [[her]96-mrs. thorpe son]664-her son . ”[241-a young lady]

[Catherine]73-catherine was disappointed and vexed . [She]668-you seemed to have missed by so little the very object [she]668-you had had in view ; and this persuasion did not incline [her]668-you to a very gracious reply , when [John Thorpe]97-john came up to [her]668-you soon afterwards and said , “ Well , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , [I]97-john suppose [you]668-you and [I]97-john are to stand up and jig it together again . ”[97-john]

“ Oh , no ; [I]97-john am much obliged to [you]668-you , [our]2449-our two dances are over ; and , besides , [I]97-john am tired , and do not mean to dance any more . ”[97-john]

“ Do not [you]668-you ? Then let [us]2449-our walk about and quiz [people]320-people .
