[I]819-she must go back to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney . ”[819-she] But [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe only laughed , smacked [his]119-mr. thorpe whip , encouraged [his]119-mr. thorpe horse , made odd noises , and drove on ; and [Catherine]73-catherine , angry and vexed as [she]819-she was , having no power of getting away , was obliged to give up the point and submit . [Her]819-she reproaches , however , were not spared . “ How could [you]119-mr. thorpe deceive [me]119-mr. thorpe so , [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ? How could [you]119-mr. thorpe say that [you]119-mr. thorpe saw [them]2676-them driving up [the Lansdown Road]39-the lansdown road ? [I]119-mr. thorpe would not have had it happen so for [the world]191-the world . [They]2676-them must think it so strange , so rude of [me]119-mr. thorpe ! to go by [them]2676-them , too , without saying a word ! [you]119-mr. thorpe do not know how vexed [I]119-mr. thorpe am ; [I]119-mr. thorpe shall have no pleasure at [Clifton]35-clifton , nor in anything else . [I]119-mr. thorpe had rather , ten thousand times rather , get out now , and walk back to [them]2676-them . How could [you]119-mr. thorpe say [you]119-mr. thorpe saw [them]2676-them driving out in [a phaeton]2678-a phaeton ? ”[119-mr. thorpe] [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe defended [himself]119-mr. thorpe very stoutly , declared [he]119-mr. thorpe had never seen [two men]829-two men so much alike in [his]119-mr. thorpe life , and would hardly give up the point of its having been [Tilney]90-miss tilney [himself]90-miss tilney .

[Their]829-two men drive , even when this subject was over , was not likely to be very agreeable . [Catherine]73-catherine ’s complaisance was no longer what it had been in [their]829-two men former airing . [She]830-she listened reluctantly , and [her]830-she replies were short . [Blaize Castle]37-blaize castle remained [her]830-she only comfort ; towards _ that _ , [she]830-she still looked at intervals with pleasure ; though rather than be disappointed of the promised walk , and especially rather than be thought ill of by [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys , [she]830-she would willingly have given up all the happiness which [its]37-blaize castle walls could supply — the happiness of a progress through [a long suite of lofty rooms]831-a long suite of lofty rooms , exhibiting the remains of magnificent furniture , though now for many years deserted — the happiness of being stopped in [their]829-two men way along [narrow , winding vaults]832-narrow , winding vaults , by a low , grated door ; or even of having [their]829-two men lamp , [their]829-two men only lamp , extinguished by a sudden gust of wind , and of being left in total darkness . In the meanwhile , [they]829-two men proceeded on [their]829-two men journey without any mischance , and were within view of [the town of Keynsham]833-the town of keynsham , when a halloo from [Morland]73-catherine , who was behind [them]829-two men , made [[his]73-catherine friend]556-his friend pull up , to know what was the matter . [The others]2286-the others then came close enough for conversation , and [Morland]73-catherine said , “ [We]829-two men had better go back , [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ; it is too late to go on to - day ; [[your]119-mr. thorpe sister]2261-your sister thinks so as well as [I.]73-catherine [We]829-two men have been exactly an hour coming from [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , very little more than seven miles ; and , [I]73-catherine suppose , [we]829-two men have at least eight more to go . It will never do . [We]829-two men set out a great deal too late . [We]829-two men had much better put it off till another day , and turn round . ”[73-catherine]

“ It is all one to [me]119-mr. thorpe , ”[119-mr. thorpe] replied [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe rather angrily ; and instantly turning [his]119-mr. thorpe horse , [they]829-two men were on [their]829-two men way back to [Bath]5-bath .

“ If [[your]119-mr. thorpe brother]2395-your brother had not got such a d — — beast to drive , ”[119-mr. thorpe] said [he]119-mr. thorpe soon afterwards , “ [we]829-two men might have done it very well . [My]119-mr. thorpe horse would have trotted to [Clifton]35-clifton within the hour , if left to [himself]2395-your brother , and [I]119-mr. thorpe have almost broke [my]119-mr. thorpe arm with pulling [him]2395-your brother in to [that cursed broken - winded jade]2681-that cursed broken - winded jade ’s pace . [Morland]73-catherine is [a fool]2682-a fool for not keeping a horse and gig of [his]73-catherine own . ”[119-mr. thorpe]

“ No , [he]73-catherine is not , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine warmly , “ for [I]73-catherine am sure [he]73-catherine could not afford it . ”[73-catherine]

“ And why can not [he]73-catherine afford it ? ”[119-mr. thorpe]

“ Because [he]73-catherine has not money enough . ”[73-catherine]

“ And whose fault is that ? ”[119-mr. thorpe]

“ [Nobody]2205-nobody ’s , that [I]119-mr. thorpe know of . ”[119-mr. thorpe] [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe then said something in the loud , incoherent way to which [he]119-mr. thorpe had often recourse , about its being a d — — thing to be miserly ; and that if [people who rolled in money]836-people who rolled in money could not afford things , [he]119-mr. thorpe did not know who could , which [Catherine]73-catherine did not even endeavour to understand . Disappointed of what was to have been the consolation for [her]837-her first disappointment , [she]837-her was less and less disposed either to be agreeable [herself]837-her or to find [[her]837-her companion]569-her companion so ; and [they]839-they returned to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street without [her]837-her speaking twenty words .

As [she]837-her entered [the house]211-the house , [the footman]841-the footman told [her]837-her that [a gentleman and lady]842-a gentleman and lady had called and inquired for [her]837-her a few minutes after [her]837-her setting off ; that , when [he]841-the footman told [them]842-a gentleman and lady [she]837-her was gone out with [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , [the lady]378-the lady had asked whether any message had been left for [her]837-her ; and on [his]841-the footman saying no , had felt for a card , but said [she]837-her had none about [her]837-her , and went away . Pondering over these heart - rending tidings , [Catherine]73-catherine walked slowly [upstairs]443-upstairs . At the head of [them]842-a gentleman and lady [she]837-her was met by [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen , who , on hearing the reason of [their]842-a gentleman and lady speedy return , said , “ [I]83-mr. allen am glad [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother had so much sense ; [I]83-mr. allen am glad [you]73-catherine are come back . It was a strange , wild scheme . ”[83-mr. allen]

[They]842-a gentleman and lady all spent the evening together at [[Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ’s]845-thorpe ’s . [Catherine]73-catherine was disturbed and out of spirits ; but [Isabella]101-isabella seemed to find a pool of commerce , in the fate of which [she]101-isabella shared , by private partnership with [Morland]73-catherine , a very good equivalent for the quiet and country air of [an inn at [Clifton]35-clifton]846-an inn at clifton . [Her]101-isabella satisfaction , too , in not being at [the Lower Rooms]362-the lower rooms was spoken more than once . “ How [I]101-isabella pity [the poor creatures that are going there]2685-the poor creatures that are going there ! how glad [I]101-isabella am that [I]101-isabella am not amongst [them]2685-the poor creatures that are going there ! [i]101-isabella wonder whether it will be a full ball or not ! [they]2685-the poor creatures that are going there have not begun dancing yet . [I]101-isabella would not be there for all [the world]191-the world . It is so delightful to have an evening now and then to [oneself]2687-oneself . [I]101-isabella dare say it will not be a very good ball . [I]101-isabella know [the Mitchells]141-the mitchells will not be [there]2232-there . [I]101-isabella am sure [I]101-isabella pity [everybody that is]2689-everybody that is . But [I]101-isabella dare say , [Mr. Morland]103-james , [you]103-james long to be at [it]2232-there , do not [you]103-james ? [I]101-isabella am sure [you]103-james do . Well , pray do not let [anybody here]2690-anybody here be a restraint on [you]103-james . [I]101-isabella dare say [we]2691-we could do very well without [you]103-james ; but [[you]103-james men]2415-you men think [yourselves]103-james of such consequence . ”[101-isabella]

[Catherine]73-catherine could almost have accused [Isabella]101-isabella of being wanting in tenderness towards [herself]101-isabella and [her]101-isabella sorrows , so very little did [they]848-they appear to dwell on [her]101-isabella mind , and so very inadequate was the comfort [she]101-isabella offered . “ Do not be so dull , [[my]101-isabella dearest]2292-my dearest creature , ”[101-isabella] [she]101-isabella whispered . “ [You]103-james will quite break [my]101-isabella heart . It was amazingly shocking , to be sure ; but [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys were entirely to blame . Why were not [they]132-the tilneys more punctual ? It was dirty , indeed , but what did that signify ? [I]101-isabella am sure [John]97-john and [I]101-isabella should not have minded it . [I]101-isabella never mind going through anything , where [a friend]446-a friend is concerned ; that is [my]101-isabella disposition , and [John]97-john is just the same ; [he]97-john has amazing strong feelings . Good heavens ! what a delightful hand [you]103-james have got ! [kings]2695-kings , [I]101-isabella vow ! [i]101-isabella never was so happy in [my]101-isabella life ! [i]101-isabella would fifty times rather [you]103-james should have them than [myself]101-isabella . ”[101-isabella]

And now [I]0-i may dismiss [[my]0-i heroine]779-my heroine to the sleepless couch , which is [[the true heroine]850-the true heroine ’s portion]851-the true heroine ’s portion ; to a pillow strewed with thorns and wet with tears . And lucky may [she]779-my heroine think [herself]779-my heroine , if [she]779-my heroine get another good night ’s rest in the course of the next three months .

CHAPTER 12

“ [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine the next morning , “ will there be any harm in [my]73-catherine calling on [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney to - day ? [I]73-catherine shall not be easy till [I]73-catherine have explained everything . ”[73-catherine]

“ Go , by all means , [[my]73-catherine dear]2185-my dear ; only put on a white gown ; [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney always wears white . ”[73-catherine]

[Catherine]73-catherine cheerfully complied , and being properly equipped , was more impatient than ever to be at [the pump - room]357-the pump - room , that [she]779-my heroine might inform [herself]779-my heroine of [[General Tilney]138-general tilney ’s lodgings]853-general tilney ’s lodgings , for though [she]779-my heroine believed they were in [Milsom Street]14-milsom street , [she]779-my heroine was not certain of [the house]211-the house , and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ’s wavering convictions only made it more doubtful . To [Milsom Street]855-milsom street [she]779-my heroine was directed , and having made [herself]779-my heroine perfect in the number , hastened away with eager steps and a beating heart to pay [her]779-my heroine visit , explain [her]779-my heroine conduct , and be forgiven ; tripping lightly through [the church - yard]2344-the church - yard , and resolutely turning away [her]779-my heroine eyes , that [she]779-my heroine might not be obliged to see [[her]779-my heroine beloved [Isabella]101-isabella and [[her]101-isabella dear family]858-her dear family , who , [she]779-my heroine had reason to believe , were in [a shop hard by]859-a shop hard by]857-her beloved isabella and her dear family , who , she had reason to believe , were in a shop hard by . [She]779-my heroine reached [the house]211-the house without any impediment , looked at the number , knocked at the door , and inquired for [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney . [The man]2581-the man believed [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney to be at [home]2403-home , but was not quite certain . Would [she]779-my heroine be pleased to send up [her]779-my heroine name ? [She]779-my heroine gave [her]779-my heroine card . In a few minutes [the servant]543-the servant returned , and with a look which did not quite confirm [his]543-the servant words , said [he]543-the servant had been mistaken , for that [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney was walked out . [Catherine]73-catherine , with a blush of mortification , left [the house]211-the house . [She]779-my heroine felt almost persuaded that [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney _ was _ at [home]2403-home , and too much offended to admit [her]779-my heroine ; and as [she]779-my heroine retired down [the street]444-the street , could not withhold one glance at the drawing - room windows , in expectation of seeing [her]779-my heroine [there]2232-there , but [no one]359-no one appeared at them . At the bottom of [the street]444-the street , however , [she]779-my heroine looked back again , and then , not at a window , but issuing from the door , [she]779-my heroine saw [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney [herself]90-miss tilney . [She]779-my heroine was followed by [a gentleman]384-a gentleman , whom [Catherine]73-catherine believed to be [[her]779-my heroine father]182-her father , and [they]872-they turned up towards [[Edgar]116-edgar ’s Buildings]2345-edgar ’s buildings . [Catherine]73-catherine , in deep mortification , proceeded on [her]779-my heroine way . [She]779-my heroine could almost be angry [herself]779-my heroine at such angry incivility ; but [she]779-my heroine checked the resentful sensation ; [she]779-my heroine remembered [her]779-my heroine own ignorance . [She]779-my heroine knew not how such an offence as [hers]779-my heroine might be classed by the laws of worldly politeness , to what a degree of unforgivingness it might with propriety lead , nor to what rigours of rudeness in return it might justly make [her]779-my heroine amenable .

Dejected and humbled , [she]779-my heroine had even some thoughts of not going with [the others]2286-the others to [the theatre]2218-the theatre that night ; but it must be confessed that [they]876-they were not of long continuance , for [she]779-my heroine soon recollected , in the first place , that [she]779-my heroine was without any excuse for staying at [home]2403-home ; and , in the second , that it was a play [she]779-my heroine wanted very much to see . To [the theatre]2218-the theatre accordingly [they]876-they all went ; no [Tilneys]132-the tilneys appeared to plague or please [her]779-my heroine ; [she]779-my heroine feared that , amongst the many perfections of [the family]454-the family , a fondness for plays was not to be ranked ; but perhaps it was because [they]876-they were habituated to the finer performances of the [London]11-london stage , which [she]779-my heroine knew , on [Isabella]101-isabella ’s authority , rendered everything else of the kind “ quite horrid . ”[779-my heroine] [She]779-my heroine was not deceived in [her]779-my heroine own expectation of pleasure ; the comedy so well suspended [her]779-my heroine care that [no one]359-no one , observing [her]779-my heroine during the first four acts , would have supposed [she]779-my heroine had any wretchedness about [her]779-my heroine . On the beginning of the fifth , however , the sudden view of [Mr. Henry Tilney]92-henry and [[his]92-henry father]881-his father , joining a party in the opposite box , recalled [her]779-my heroine to anxiety and distress . [The stage]882-the stage could no longer excite genuine merriment — no longer keep [her]779-my heroine whole attention . Every other look upon an average was directed towards the opposite box ; and , for the space of two entire scenes , did [she]779-my heroine thus watch [Henry Tilney]92-henry , without being once able to catch [his]92-henry eye . No longer could [he]92-henry be suspected of indifference for a play ; [his]92-henry notice was never withdrawn from the stage during two whole scenes . At length , however , [he]92-henry did look towards [her]779-my heroine , and [he]92-henry bowed — but such a bow ! no smile , [no continued]883-no continued observance attended it ; [his]92-henry eyes were immediately returned to [their]884-their former direction . [Catherine]73-catherine was restlessly miserable ; [she]779-my heroine could almost have run round to the box in which [he]92-henry sat and forced [him]92-henry to hear [her]779-my heroine explanation . Feelings rather natural than heroic possessed [her]779-my heroine ; instead of considering [her]779-my heroine own dignity injured by this ready condemnation — instead of proudly resolving , in conscious innocence , to show [her]779-my heroine resentment towards [him]92-henry who could harbour a doubt of it , to leave to [him]92-henry all the trouble of seeking an explanation , and to enlighten [him]92-henry on the past only by avoiding [his]92-henry sight , or flirting with [somebody else]2549-somebody else — [she]779-my heroine took to [herself]779-my heroine all the shame of misconduct , or at least of its appearance , and was only eager for an opportunity of explaining its cause .

The play concluded — the curtain fell — [Henry Tilney]92-henry was no longer to be seen where [he]92-henry had hitherto sat , but [[his]92-henry father]881-his father remained , and perhaps [he]92-henry might be now coming round to [[their]887-their box]888-their box . [She]779-my heroine was right ; in a few minutes [he]92-henry appeared , and , making [his]92-henry way through the then thinning rows , spoke with like calm politeness to [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen and [[her]779-my heroine friend]305-her friend . Not with such calmness was [he]92-henry answered by [the latter]562-the latter : “ Oh ! [mr . Tilney]90-miss tilney , [I]92-henry have been quite wild to speak to [you]90-miss tilney , and make [my]92-henry apologies . [You]90-miss tilney must have thought [me]92-henry so rude ; but indeed it was not [my]92-henry own fault , was it , [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ? Did not [they]887-their tell [me]92-henry that [Mr. Tilney]92-henry and [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister were gone out in [a phaeton]2678-a phaeton together ? And then what could [I]92-henry do ? But [I]92-henry had ten thousand times rather have been with [you]90-miss tilney ; now had not [I]92-henry , [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ? ”[92-henry]

“ [[My]86-mrs. allen dear]2185-my dear , [you]2185-my dear tumble [my]86-mrs. allen gown , ”[86-mrs. allen] was [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ’s reply .

[Her]891-her assurance , however , standing sole as it did , was not thrown away ; it brought a more cordial , more natural smile into [his]892-his countenance , and [he]892-his replied in a tone which retained only a little affected reserve : “ [We]887-their were much obliged to [you]2185-my dear at any rate for wishing [us]887-their a pleasant walk after [our]887-their passing [you]2185-my dear in [Argyle Street]44-argyle street : [you]2185-my dear were so kind as to look back on purpose . ”[892-his]

“ But indeed [I]92-henry did not wish [you]90-miss tilney a pleasant walk ; [I]92-henry never thought of such a thing ; but [I]92-henry begged [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe so earnestly to stop ; [I]92-henry called out to [him]119-mr. thorpe as soon as ever [I]92-henry saw [you]90-miss tilney ; now , [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , did not — Oh ! [you]90-miss tilney were not there ; but indeed [I]92-henry did ; and , if [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe would only have stopped , [I]92-henry would have jumped out and run after [you]90-miss tilney . ”[92-henry]

Is there a Henry in [the world]191-the world who could be insensible to such a declaration ? [Henry Tilney]92-henry at least was not . With a yet sweeter smile , [he]92-henry said everything that need be said of [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister ’s concern , regret , and dependence on [Catherine]73-catherine ’s honour . “ Oh , do not say [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney was not angry , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine , “ because [I]73-catherine know [she]2288-his sister was ; for [she]2288-his sister would not see [me]73-catherine this morning when [I]73-catherine called ; [I]73-catherine saw [her]2288-his sister walk out of [the house]211-the house the next minute after [my]73-catherine leaving [it]211-the house ; [I]73-catherine was hurt , but [I]73-catherine was not affronted . Perhaps [you]92-henry did not know [I]73-catherine had been [there]2232-there . ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]92-henry was not within at the time ; but [I]92-henry heard of it from [Eleanor]142-eleanor , and [she]2288-his sister has been wishing ever since to see [you]73-catherine , to explain the reason of such incivility ; but perhaps [I]92-henry can do it as well . It was nothing more than that [[my]92-henry father]2538-my father — [they]2703-they were just preparing to walk out , and [he]2538-my father being hurried for time , and not caring to have it put off — made a point of [her]2288-his sister being denied . That was all , [I]92-henry do assure [you]73-catherine . [She]2288-his sister was very much vexed , and meant to make [her]2288-his sister apology as soon as possible . ”[92-henry]

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s mind was greatly eased by this information , yet a something of solicitude remained , from which sprang the following question , thoroughly artless in itself , though rather distressing to [the gentleman]382-the gentleman : “ But , [Mr. Tilney]92-henry , why were _ [you]92-henry _ less generous than [[your]92-henry sister]2261-your sister ? If [she]2288-his sister felt such confidence in [my]92-henry good intentions , and could suppose it to be only a mistake , why should _ [you]92-henry _ be so ready to take offence ? ”[92-henry]

“ [Me]382-the gentleman ! [i]382-the gentleman take offence ! ”[382-the gentleman]

“ Nay , [I]92-henry am sure by [your]92-henry look , when [you]92-henry came into the box , [you]92-henry were angry . ”[92-henry]

“ [I]382-the gentleman angry ! [i]382-the gentleman could have no right . ”[382-the gentleman]

“ Well , [nobody]2205-nobody would have thought [you]92-henry had no right who saw [your]92-henry face . ”[382-the gentleman] [He]382-the gentleman replied by asking [her]896-she to make room for [him]382-the gentleman , and talking of the play .

[He]382-the gentleman remained with [them]897-them some time , and was only too agreeable for [Catherine]73-catherine to be contented when [he]382-the gentleman went away . Before [they]897-them parted , however , it was agreed that the projected walk should be taken as soon as possible ; and , setting aside the misery of [his]382-the gentleman quitting [[their]897-them box]888-their box , [she]896-she was , upon the whole , left [one of the happiest creatures in [the world]191-the world]899-one of the happiest creatures in the world .

While talking to [each other]330-each other , [she]896-she had observed with some surprise that [John Thorpe]97-john , who was never in the same part of [the house]211-the house for ten minutes together , was engaged in conversation with [General Tilney]138-general tilney ; and [she]896-she felt something more than surprise when [she]896-she thought [she]896-she could perceive [herself]896-she the object of [their]897-them attention and discourse . What could [they]897-them have to say of [her]896-she ? [She]896-she feared [General Tilney]138-general tilney did not like [her]896-she appearance : [she]896-she found it was implied in [his]138-general tilney preventing [her]896-she admittance to [[his]138-general tilney daughter]2509-his daughter , rather than postpone [his]138-general tilney own walk a few minutes . “ How came [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe to know [[your]569-her companion father]2706-your father ? ”[896-she] was [her]896-she anxious inquiry , as [she]896-she pointed [them]897-them out to [[her]896-she companion]569-her companion . [He]569-her companion knew nothing about it ; but [[his]569-her companion father]881-his father , like [every military man]906-every military man , had a very large acquaintance .

When the entertainment was over , [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe came to assist [them]897-them in getting out . [Catherine]73-catherine was the immediate object of [his]119-mr. thorpe gallantry ; and , while [they]897-them waited in [the lobby]2545-the lobby for a chair , [he]119-mr. thorpe prevented the inquiry which had travelled from [her]896-she heart almost to the tip of [her]896-she tongue , by asking , in a consequential manner , whether [she]896-she had seen [him]119-mr. thorpe talking with [General Tilney]138-general tilney : “ [He]119-mr. thorpe is [a fine old fellow]2707-a fine old fellow , upon [my]138-general tilney soul ! stout , active — looks as young as [[his]119-mr. thorpe son]2708-his son . [I]138-general tilney have a great regard for [him]119-mr. thorpe , [I]138-general tilney assure [you]896-she : [a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived]2709-a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived . ”[138-general tilney]

“ But how came [you]138-general tilney to know [him]119-mr. thorpe ? ”[908-his]

“ Know [him]119-mr. thorpe ! there are [few people much about [town]2354-town that [I]138-general tilney do not know]2710-few people much about town that i do not know . [I]138-general tilney have met [him]119-mr. thorpe forever at [the Bedford]45-the bedford ; and [I]138-general tilney knew [his]119-mr. thorpe face again to - day the moment [he]119-mr. thorpe came into [the billiard - room]2712-the billiard - room . One of [the best players [we]2714-we have]2713-the best players we have , by the by ; and [we]2714-we had a little touch together , though [I]138-general tilney was almost afraid of [him]119-mr. thorpe at first : the odds were five to four against [me]138-general tilney ; and , if [I]138-general tilney had not made one of the cleanest strokes that perhaps ever was made in [this world]2715-this world — [I]138-general tilney took [his]119-mr. thorpe ball exactly — but [I]138-general tilney could not make [you]2716-you understand it without a table ; however , [I]138-general tilney _ did _ beat [him]119-mr. thorpe . [A very fine fellow]2717-a very fine fellow ; as rich as [a Jew]2465-a jew . [I]138-general tilney should like to dine with [him]119-mr. thorpe ; [I]138-general tilney dare say [he]119-mr. thorpe gives famous dinners . But what do [you]2716-you think [we]2714-we have been talking of ? [You]2716-you . Yes , by heavens ! and [the General]800-the general thinks [you]2716-you [the finest girl in [Bath]5-bath]2720-the finest girl in bath . ”[138-general tilney]

“ Oh ! nonsense ! how can [you]2716-you say so ? ”[908-his]

“ And what do [you]2716-you think [I]138-general tilney said?”—lowering[138-general tilney] [his]908-his voice—“well done , [General]2721-general , said [I]908-his ; [I]908-his am quite of [your]2716-you mind . ”[908-his]

Here [Catherine]73-catherine , who was much less gratified by [his]908-his admiration than by [General Tilney]138-general tilney ’s , was not sorry to be called away by [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen . [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , however , would see [her]909-her to [her]909-her chair , and , till [she]909-her entered it , continued the same kind of delicate flattery , in spite of [her]909-her entreating [him]908-his to have done .

That [General Tilney]138-general tilney , instead of disliking , should admire [her]909-her , was very delightful ; and [she]909-her joyfully thought that there was not one of [the family whom [she]909-her need now fear to meet]910-the family whom she need now fear to meet . The evening had done more , much more , for [her]909-her than could have been expected .

CHAPTER 13

Monday , Tuesday , Wednesday , Thursday , Friday , and Saturday have now passed in review before [the reader]255-the reader ; the events of each day , its hopes and fears , mortifications and pleasures , have been separately stated , and the pangs of Sunday only now remain to be described , and close the week . The Clifton scheme had been deferred , not relinquished , and on the afternoon ’s Crescent of this day , it was brought forward again . In a private consultation between [Isabella]101-isabella and [James]103-james , the former of whom had particularly set [her]101-isabella heart upon going , and [the latter]562-the latter no less anxiously placed [his]562-the latter upon pleasing [her]909-her , it was agreed that , provided the weather were fair , the party should take place on the following morning ; and [they]913-they were to set off very early , in order to be at [home]2403-home in good time . The affair thus determined , and [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ’s approbation secured , [Catherine]73-catherine only remained to be apprised of it . [She]909-her had left [them]913-they for a few minutes to speak to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney . In that interval the plan was completed , and as soon as [she]909-her came again , [her]909-her agreement was demanded ; but instead of the gay acquiescence expected by [Isabella]101-isabella , [Catherine]73-catherine looked grave , was very sorry , but could not go . The engagement which ought to have kept [her]909-her from joining in the former attempt would make it impossible for [her]909-her to accompany [them]913-they now . [She]909-her had that moment settled with [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney to take [their]913-they proposed walk to - morrow ; it was quite determined , and [she]909-her would not , upon any account , retract . But that [she]909-her _ must _ and _ should _ retract , was instantly the eager cry of both [the Thorpes]915-the thorpes ; [they]913-they must go to [Clifton]35-clifton to - morrow , [they]913-they would not go without [her]101-isabella , it would be nothing to put off a mere walk for one day longer , and [they]913-they would not hear of a refusal . [Catherine]73-catherine was distressed , but not subdued . “ Do not urge [me]73-catherine , [Isabella]101-isabella . [I]73-catherine am engaged to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney . [I]73-catherine can not go . ”[73-catherine] This availed nothing . The same arguments assailed [her]909-her again ; [she]909-her must go , [she]909-her should go , and [they]913-they would not hear of a refusal . “ It would be so easy to tell [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney that [you]101-isabella had just been reminded of a prior engagement , and must only beg to put off the walk till Tuesday . ”[913-they]

“ No , it would not be easy . [I]101-isabella could not do it . There has been no prior engagement . ”[101-isabella] But [Isabella]101-isabella became only more and more urgent , calling on [her]101-isabella in the most affectionate manner , addressing [her]101-isabella by the most endearing names . [She]101-isabella was sure [her]101-isabella dearest , sweetest [Catherine]73-catherine would not seriously refuse such a trifling request to [a friend who loved [her]909-her so dearly]916-a friend who loved her so dearly . [She]101-isabella knew [her]101-isabella beloved [Catherine]73-catherine to have so feeling a heart , so sweet a temper , to be so easily persuaded by those [she]101-isabella loved . But all in vain ; [Catherine]73-catherine felt [herself]73-catherine to be in the right , and though pained by such tender , such flattering supplication , could not allow it to influence [her]909-her . [Isabella]101-isabella then tried another method . [She]101-isabella reproached [her]101-isabella with having more affection for [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , though [she]101-isabella had known [her]101-isabella so little a while , than for [[her]101-isabella best and oldest friends]917-her best and oldest friends , with being grown cold and indifferent , in short , towards [herself]101-isabella . “ [I]101-isabella can not help being jealous , [Catherine]73-catherine , when [I]101-isabella see [myself]101-isabella slighted for [strangers]2722-strangers , [I]101-isabella , who love [you]73-catherine so excessively ! when once [my]101-isabella affections are placed , it is not in the power of anything to change them . But [I]101-isabella believe [my]101-isabella feelings are stronger than [anybody]192-anybody ’s ; [I]101-isabella am sure they are too strong for [my]101-isabella own peace ; and to see [myself]101-isabella supplanted in [your]73-catherine friendship by [strangers]2722-strangers does cut [me]101-isabella to the quick , [I]101-isabella own . [These Tilneys]132-the tilneys seem to swallow up everything else . ”[101-isabella]

[Catherine]73-catherine thought this reproach equally strange and unkind . Was it the part of [a friend]446-a friend thus to expose [her]446-a friend feelings to the notice of [others]376-others ? [Isabella]101-isabella appeared to [her]446-a friend ungenerous and selfish , regardless of everything but [her]101-isabella own gratification . These painful ideas crossed [her]101-isabella mind , though [she]101-isabella said nothing . [Isabella]101-isabella , in the meanwhile , had applied [her]101-isabella handkerchief to [her]101-isabella eyes ; and [Morland]73-catherine , miserable at such a sight , could not help saying , “ Nay , [Catherine]73-catherine . [I]73-catherine think [you]73-catherine can not stand out any longer now . The sacrifice is not much ; and to oblige [such a friend]2725-such a friend — [I]73-catherine shall think [you]73-catherine quite unkind , if [you]73-catherine still refuse . ”[73-catherine]

This was the first time of [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother ’s openly siding against [her]101-isabella , and anxious to avoid [his]2287-her brother displeasure , [she]101-isabella proposed a compromise . If [they]921-they would only put off [their]921-they scheme till Tuesday , which [they]921-they might easily do , as it depended only on [themselves]921-they , [she]101-isabella could go with [them]921-they , and [everybody]318-everybody might then be satisfied . But “ No , no , no ! ”[101-isabella] was the immediate answer ; “ that could not be , for [Thorpe]101-isabella did not know that [he]2287-her brother might not go to [town]2354-town on Tuesday . ”[101-isabella] [Catherine]73-catherine was sorry , but could do no more ; and a short silence ensued , which was broken by [Isabella]101-isabella , who in a voice of cold resentment said , “ Very well , then there is an end of the party . If [Catherine]73-catherine does not go , [I]101-isabella can not . [I]101-isabella can not be [the only woman]2727-the only woman . [I]101-isabella would not , upon any account in [the world]191-the world , do so improper a thing . ”[101-isabella]

“ [Catherine]73-catherine , [you]73-catherine must go , ”[103-james] said [James]103-james .

“ But why can not [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe drive [one of [[his]119-mr. thorpe other sisters]2730-his other sisters]2729-one of his other sisters ? [I]101-isabella dare say either of [them]2730-his other sisters would like to go . ”[101-isabella]

“ Thank [ye]73-catherine , ”[119-mr. thorpe] cried [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , “ but [I]119-mr. thorpe did not come to [Bath]5-bath to drive [[my]119-mr. thorpe sisters]2367-my sisters about , and look like [a fool]2682-a fool . No , if [you]73-catherine do not go , d — — [me]119-mr. thorpe if [I]119-mr. thorpe do . [I]119-mr. thorpe only go for the sake of driving [you]73-catherine . ”[119-mr. thorpe]

“ That is a compliment which gives [me]923-i no pleasure . ”[923-i] But [her]923-i words were lost on [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe , who had turned abruptly away .

[The three others]924-the three others still continued together , walking in a most uncomfortable manner to poor [Catherine]73-catherine ; sometimes not a word was said , sometimes [she]923-i was again attacked with supplications or reproaches , and [her]923-i arm was still linked within [Isabella]101-isabella ’s , though [their]924-the three others hearts were at war . At one moment [she]923-i was softened , at another irritated ; always distressed , but always steady .

“ [I]103-james did not think [you]923-i had been so obstinate , [Catherine]73-catherine , ”[103-james] said [James]103-james ; “ [you]923-i were not used to be so hard to persuade ; [you]923-i once were [the kindest , best - tempered of [[my]103-james sisters]2367-my sisters]2733-the kindest , best - tempered of my sisters . ”[103-james]

“ [I]923-i hope [I]923-i am not less so now , ”[923-i] [she]923-i replied , very feelingly ; “ but indeed [I]923-i can not go . If [I]923-i am wrong , [I]923-i am doing what [I]923-i believe to be right . ”[923-i]

“ [I]101-isabella suspect , ”[101-isabella] said [Isabella]101-isabella , in a low voice , “ there is no great struggle . ”[101-isabella]

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s heart swelled ; [she]923-i drew away [her]923-i arm , and [Isabella]101-isabella made no opposition . Thus passed a long ten minutes , till [they]925-we were again joined by [Thorpe]101-isabella , who , coming to [them]925-we with a gayer look , said , “ Well , [I]101-isabella have settled the matter , and now [we]925-we may all go to - morrow with a safe conscience . [I]101-isabella have been to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , and made [your]925-we excuses . ”[101-isabella]

“ [You]101-isabella have not ! ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine .

“ [I]101-isabella have , upon [my]101-isabella soul . Left [her]101-isabella this moment . Told [her]101-isabella [you]101-isabella had sent [me]101-isabella to say that , having just recollected a prior engagement of going to [Clifton]35-clifton with [us]925-we to - morrow , [you]101-isabella could not have the pleasure of walking with [her]101-isabella till [Tuesday]143-tuesday . [She]101-isabella said very well , [Tuesday]143-tuesday was just as convenient to [her]101-isabella ; so there is an end of all [our]925-we difficulties . A pretty good thought of [mine]101-isabella — hey ? ”[101-isabella]

[Isabella]101-isabella ’s countenance was once more all smiles and good humour , and [James]103-james too looked happy again .

“ A most heavenly thought indeed ! now , [my]101-isabella sweet [Catherine]73-catherine , all [our]925-we distresses are over ; [you]73-catherine are honourably acquitted , and [we]925-we shall have a most delightful party . ”[101-isabella]

“ This will not do , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine ; “ [I]73-catherine can not submit to this . [I]73-catherine must run after [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney directly and set [her]101-isabella right . ”[73-catherine]

[Isabella]101-isabella , however , caught hold of one hand , [Thorpe]101-isabella of the other , and remonstrances poured in from [all three]926-all three . [Even James]103-james was quite angry . When everything was settled , when [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney [herself]90-miss tilney said that Tuesday would suit [her]101-isabella as well , it was quite ridiculous , quite absurd , to make any further objection .

“ [I]90-miss tilney do not care . [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe had no business to invent any such message . If [I]90-miss tilney had thought it right to put it off , [I]90-miss tilney could have spoken to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney [myself]90-miss tilney . This is only doing it in a ruder way ; and how do [I]90-miss tilney know that [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe has — [He]119-mr. thorpe may be mistaken again perhaps ; [he]119-mr. thorpe led [me]90-miss tilney into one act of rudeness by [his]119-mr. thorpe mistake on Friday . Let [me]90-miss tilney go , [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ; [Isabella]101-isabella , do not hold [me]90-miss tilney . ”[90-miss tilney]

[Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe told [her]101-isabella it would be in vain to go after [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys ; [they]132-the tilneys were turning the corner into [Brock Street]46-brock street , when [he]119-mr. thorpe had overtaken [them]132-the tilneys , and were at [home]2403-home by this time .

“ Then [I]73-catherine will go after [them]132-the tilneys , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine ; “ wherever [they]132-the tilneys are [I]73-catherine will go after [them]132-the tilneys . It does not signify talking . If [I]73-catherine could not be persuaded into doing what [I]73-catherine thought wrong , [I]73-catherine never will be tricked into it . ”[73-catherine] And with these words [she]101-isabella broke away and hurried off . [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe would have darted after [her]101-isabella , but [Morland]73-catherine withheld [him]119-mr. thorpe . “ Let [her]101-isabella go , let [her]101-isabella go , if [she]101-isabella will go . ”[73-catherine]

“ [She]101-isabella is as obstinate as — ”[119-mr. thorpe]

[Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe never finished the simile , for it could hardly have been a proper one .

[Away]144-away walked [Catherine]73-catherine in great agitation , as fast as [the crowd]298-the crowd would permit [her]101-isabella , fearful of being pursued , yet determined to persevere . As [she]101-isabella walked , [she]101-isabella reflected on what had passed . It was painful to [her]101-isabella to disappoint and displease [them]929-them , particularly to displease [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother ; but [she]101-isabella could not repent [her]101-isabella resistance . Setting [her]101-isabella own inclination apart , to have failed a second time in [her]101-isabella engagement to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , to have retracted a promise voluntarily made only five minutes before , and on a false pretence too , must have been wrong . [She]101-isabella had not been withstanding [them]929-them on selfish principles alone , [she]101-isabella had not consulted merely [her]101-isabella own gratification ; _ that _ might have been ensured in some degree by the excursion itself , by seeing [Blaize Castle]37-blaize castle ; no , [she]101-isabella had attended to what was due to [others]376-others , and to [her]101-isabella own character in [their]376-others opinion . [Her]101-isabella conviction of being right , however , was not enough to restore [her]101-isabella composure ; till [she]101-isabella had spoken to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney [she]101-isabella could not be at ease ; and quickening [her]101-isabella pace when [she]101-isabella got clear of [the Crescent]13-the crescent , [she]101-isabella almost ran over the remaining ground till [she]101-isabella gained the top of [Milsom Street]14-milsom street . So rapid had been [her]101-isabella movements that in spite of [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys ’ advantage in the outset , [they]132-the tilneys were but just turning into [[their]132-the tilneys lodgings]932-their lodgings as [she]101-isabella came within view of [them]132-the tilneys ; and [the servant]543-the servant still remaining at the open door , [she]101-isabella used only the ceremony of saying that [she]101-isabella must speak with [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney that moment , and hurrying by [him]90-miss tilney proceeded [upstairs]443-upstairs . Then , opening the first door before [her]101-isabella , which happened to be the right , [she]101-isabella immediately found [herself]101-isabella in [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room with [General Tilney]138-general tilney , [[his]138-general tilney son]2708-his son , and [daughter]937-daughter . [Her]101-isabella explanation , defective only in being — from [her]101-isabella irritation of nerves and shortness of breath — no explanation at all , was instantly given . “ [I]101-isabella am come in a great hurry — It was all a mistake — [I]101-isabella never promised to go — [I]101-isabella told [them]2735-them from the first [I]101-isabella could not go.—I ran away in a great hurry to explain it.—I did not care what [you]2736-you thought of me.—I would not stay for [the servant]543-the servant . ”[101-isabella]

The business , however , though not perfectly elucidated by this speech , soon ceased to be a puzzle . [Catherine]73-catherine found that [John Thorpe]97-john _ had _ given the message ; and [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney had no scruple in owning [herself]90-miss tilney greatly surprised by it . But whether [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother had still exceeded [her]101-isabella in resentment , [Catherine]73-catherine , though [she]101-isabella instinctively addressed [herself]101-isabella as much to [one]2201-one as to [the other]412-the other in [her]101-isabella vindication , had no means of knowing . Whatever might have been felt before [her]101-isabella arrival , [her]101-isabella eager declarations immediately made every look and sentence as friendly as [she]101-isabella could desire .

The affair thus happily settled , [she]101-isabella was introduced by [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney to [[her]101-isabella father]182-her father , and received by [him]182-her father with such ready , such solicitous politeness as recalled [Thorpe]97-john ’s information to [her]101-isabella mind , and made [her]101-isabella think with pleasure that [he]97-john might be sometimes depended on . To such anxious attention was [the General]800-the general ’s civility carried , that not aware of [her]101-isabella extraordinary swiftness in entering [the house]211-the house , [he]182-her father was quite angry with [the servant whose neglect had reduced [her]101-isabella to open the door of [the apartment]945-the apartment [herself]101-isabella]944-the servant whose neglect had reduced her to open the door of the apartment herself . “ What did [William]100-william mean by it ? [He]100-william should make a point of inquiring into the matter . ”[182-her father] And if [Catherine]73-catherine had not most warmly asserted [his]97-john innocence , it seemed likely that [William]100-william would lose the favour of [[his]100-william master]2464-his master forever , if not [his]100-william place , by [her]101-isabella rapidity .

After sitting with [them]947-they a quarter of an hour , [she]101-isabella rose to take leave , and was then most agreeably surprised by [General Tilney]138-general tilney ’s asking [her]101-isabella if [she]182-her father would do [[his]182-her father daughter]2509-his daughter the honour of dining and spending the rest of the day with [her]101-isabella . [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney added [her]101-isabella own wishes . [Catherine]73-catherine was greatly obliged ; but it was quite out of [her]101-isabella power . [Mr.]949-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen would expect [her]101-isabella back every moment . [The General]800-the general declared [he]800-the general could say no more ; the claims of [Mr.]951-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen were not to be superseded ; but on some other day [he]800-the general trusted , when longer notice could be given , [they]947-they would not refuse to spare [her]101-isabella to [[her]101-isabella friend]305-her friend . “ Oh , no ; [Catherine]73-catherine was sure [they]947-they would not have the least objection , and [she]101-isabella should have great pleasure in coming . ”[800-the general] [The General]800-the general attended [her]101-isabella [himself]800-the general to [the street]444-the street - door , saying everything gallant as [they]955-they went [downstairs]693-downstairs , admiring the elasticity of [her]101-isabella walk , which corresponded exactly with the spirit of [her]101-isabella dancing , and making [her]101-isabella one of the most graceful bows [she]101-isabella had ever beheld , when [they]955-they parted .

[Catherine]73-catherine , delighted by all that had passed , proceeded gaily to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , walking , as [she]101-isabella concluded , with great elasticity , though [she]101-isabella had never thought of it before . [She]101-isabella reached [home]2403-home without seeing anything more of [the offended party]958-the offended party ; and now that [she]101-isabella had been triumphant throughout , had carried [her]101-isabella point , and was secure of [her]101-isabella walk , [she]101-isabella began ( as the flutter of [her]101-isabella spirits subsided ) to doubt whether [she]101-isabella had been perfectly right . A sacrifice was always noble ; and if [she]101-isabella had given way to [their]955-they entreaties , [she]101-isabella should have been spared the distressing idea of [a friend]446-a friend displeased , [a brother]767-a brother angry , and a scheme of great happiness to both destroyed , perhaps through [her]101-isabella means . To ease [her]101-isabella mind , and ascertain by the opinion of [an unprejudiced person]961-an unprejudiced person what [her]101-isabella own conduct had really been , [she]101-isabella took occasion to mention before [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen the half - settled scheme of [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother and [the Thorpes]915-the thorpes for the following day . [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen caught at it directly . “ Well , ”[83-mr. allen] said [he]83-mr. allen , “ and do [you]101-isabella think of going too ? ”[83-mr. allen]

“ No ; [I]101-isabella had just engaged [myself]101-isabella to walk with [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney before [they]955-they told [me]101-isabella of it ; and therefore [you]101-isabella know [I]101-isabella could not go with [them]955-they , could [I]101-isabella ? ”[101-isabella]

“ No , certainly not ; and [I]83-mr. allen am glad [you]101-isabella do not think of it . These schemes are not at all the thing . [Young men]532-young men and women driving about [the country]219-the country in [open carriages]2740-open carriages ! now and then it is very well ; but going to [inns]2741-inns and [public places]2742-public places together ! it is not right ; and [I]83-mr. allen wonder [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe should allow it . [I]83-mr. allen am glad [you]101-isabella do not think of going ; [I]83-mr. allen am sure [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland would not be pleased . [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , are not [you]101-isabella of [my]83-mr. allen way of thinking ? Do not [you]101-isabella think these kind of projects objectionable ? ”[83-mr. allen]

“ Yes , very much so indeed . [Open carriages]2740-open carriages are nasty things . A clean gown is not five minutes ’ wear in them . [You]101-isabella are splashed getting in and getting out ; and the wind takes [your]101-isabella hair and [your]101-isabella bonnet in every direction . [I]101-isabella hate [an open carriage]2363-an open carriage [myself]101-isabella . ”[101-isabella]

“ [I]83-mr. allen know [you]101-isabella do ; but that is not the question . Do not [you]101-isabella think it has an odd appearance , if [young ladies]262-young ladies are frequently driven about in [them]2740-open carriages by [young men]532-young men , to whom [they]262-young ladies are not even related ? ”[83-mr. allen]

“ Yes , [[my]101-isabella dear]2185-my dear , a very odd appearance indeed . [I]101-isabella can not bear to see it . ”[101-isabella]

“ [Dear madam]2748-dear madam , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine , “ then why did not [you]2748-dear madam tell [me]73-catherine so before ? [I]73-catherine am sure if [I]73-catherine had known it to be improper , [I]73-catherine would not have gone with [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe at all ; but [I]73-catherine always hoped [you]2748-dear madam would tell [me]73-catherine , if [you]2748-dear madam thought [I]73-catherine was doing wrong . ”[73-catherine]

“ And so [I]101-isabella should , [[my]101-isabella dear]2185-my dear , [you]2748-dear madam may depend on it ; for as [I]101-isabella told [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland at parting , [I]101-isabella would always do the best for [you]2748-dear madam in [my]101-isabella power . But one must not be over particular . [Young people]2399-young people _ will _ be [young people]2399-young people , as [[your]2748-dear madam good mother]2752-your good mother says [herself]2752-your good mother . [You]2748-dear madam know [I]101-isabella wanted [you]2748-dear madam , when [we]2753-we first came , not to buy that sprigged muslin , but [you]2748-dear madam would . [Young people]2399-young people do not like to be always thwarted . ”[101-isabella]

“ But this was something of real consequence ; and [I]73-catherine do not think [you]2748-dear madam would have found [me]73-catherine hard to persuade . ”[73-catherine]

“ As far as it has gone hitherto , there is no harm done , ”[83-mr. allen] said [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ; “ and [I]83-mr. allen would only advise [you]2748-dear madam , [[my]83-mr. allen dear]2185-my dear , not to go out with [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe any more . ”[83-mr. allen]

“ That is just what [I]337-his wife was going to say , ”[337-his wife] added [[his]83-mr. allen wife]337-his wife .

[Catherine]73-catherine , relieved for [herself]73-catherine , felt uneasy for [Isabella]101-isabella , and after a moment ’s thought , asked [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen whether it would not be both proper and kind in [her]101-isabella to write to [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , and explain the indecorum of which [she]101-isabella must be as insensible as [herself]101-isabella ; for [she]101-isabella considered that [Isabella]101-isabella might otherwise perhaps be going to [Clifton]35-clifton the next day , in spite of what had passed . [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen , however , discouraged [her]101-isabella from doing any such thing . “ [You]2748-dear madam had better leave [her]101-isabella alone , [[my]83-mr. allen dear]2185-my dear ; [she]101-isabella is old enough to know what [she]101-isabella is about , and if not , has [a mother]2757-a mother to advise [her]101-isabella . [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe is too indulgent beyond a doubt ; but , however , [you]2748-dear madam had better not interfere . [She]96-mrs. thorpe and [[your]2748-dear madam brother]2395-your brother choose to go , and [you]2748-dear madam will be only getting ill will . ”[83-mr. allen]

[Catherine]73-catherine submitted , and though sorry to think that [Isabella]101-isabella should be doing wrong , felt greatly relieved by [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s approbation of [her]101-isabella own conduct , and truly rejoiced to be preserved by [his]83-mr. allen advice from the danger of falling into such an error [herself]101-isabella . [Her]101-isabella escape from being one of [the party to [Clifton]35-clifton]965-the party to clifton was now an escape indeed ; for what would [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys have thought of [her]101-isabella , if [she]101-isabella had broken [her]101-isabella promise to [them]132-the tilneys in order to do what was wrong in itself , if [she]101-isabella had been guilty of one breach of propriety , only to enable [her]101-isabella to be guilty of another ?

CHAPTER 14

The next morning was fair , and [Catherine]73-catherine almost expected another attack from [the assembled party]966-the assembled party . With [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen to support [her]101-isabella , [she]101-isabella felt no dread of the event : but [she]101-isabella would gladly be spared a contest , where victory itself was painful , and was heartily rejoiced therefore at neither seeing nor hearing anything of [them]966-the assembled party . [The Tilneys]132-the tilneys called for [her]101-isabella at the appointed time ; and no new difficulty arising , no sudden recollection , no unexpected summons , no impertinent intrusion to disconcert [their]966-the assembled party measures , [[my]0-i heroine]779-my heroine was most unnaturally able to fulfil [her]101-isabella engagement , though it was made with [the hero]278-the hero [himself]278-the hero . [They]966-the assembled party determined on walking round [Beechen Cliff]47-beechen cliff , [that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice render [it]47-beechen cliff so striking an object from almost every opening in [Bath]5-bath]969-that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice render it so striking an object from almost every opening in bath .

“ [I]73-catherine never look at it , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , as [they]966-the assembled party walked along [the side of [the river]971-the river]970-the side of the river , “ without thinking of [the south of [France]48-france]2759-the south of france . ”[73-catherine]

“ [You]92-henry have been abroad then ? ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , a little surprised .

“ Oh ! no , [I]73-catherine only mean what [I]73-catherine have read about . It always puts [me]73-catherine in mind of [the country that [Emily]145-emily and [[her]145-emily father]182-her father travelled through]2760-the country that emily and her father travelled through , in [The Mysteries of [Udolpho]109-udolpho]2762-the mysteries of udolpho . But [you]92-henry never read novels , [I]73-catherine dare say ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Why not ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Because [they]2763-they are not clever enough for [you]92-henry — [gentlemen]2249-gentlemen read better books . ”[73-catherine]

“ [The person]2765-the person , be it [gentleman]2766-gentleman or [lady , who has not pleasure in a good novel]2767-lady , who has not pleasure in a good novel , must be intolerably stupid . [I]73-catherine have read all [Mrs. Radcliffe]122-mrs. radcliffe ’s works , and most of them with great pleasure . The Mysteries of [Udolpho]109-udolpho , when [I]73-catherine had once begun it , [I]73-catherine could not lay down again ; [I]73-catherine remember finishing it in two days — [my]73-catherine hair standing on end the whole time . ”[73-catherine]

“ Yes , ”[90-miss tilney] added [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , “ and [I]90-miss tilney remember that [you]92-henry undertook to read it aloud to [me]90-miss tilney , and that when [I]90-miss tilney was called away for only five minutes to answer a note , instead of waiting for [me]90-miss tilney , [you]92-henry took the volume into [the Hermitage Walk]49-the hermitage walk , and [I]90-miss tilney was obliged to stay till [you]92-henry had finished it . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ Thank [you]92-henry , [Eleanor]142-eleanor — a most honourable testimony . [You]92-henry see , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , the injustice of [your]92-henry suspicions . Here was [I]73-catherine , in [my]73-catherine eagerness to get on , refusing to wait only five minutes for [[my]73-catherine sister]2258-my sister , breaking the promise [I]73-catherine had made of reading it aloud , and keeping [her]2258-my sister in suspense at a most interesting part , by running away with the volume , which , [you]92-henry are to observe , was [her]2258-my sister own , particularly [her]2258-my sister own . [I]73-catherine am proud when [I]73-catherine reflect on it , and [I]73-catherine think it must establish [me]73-catherine in [your]92-henry good opinion . ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]90-miss tilney am very glad to hear it indeed , and now [I]90-miss tilney shall never be ashamed of liking [Udolpho]109-udolpho [myself]90-miss tilney . But [I]90-miss tilney really thought before , [young men]532-young men despised novels amazingly . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ It is _ amazingly ; _ it may well suggest _ amazement _ if [they]532-young men do — for [they]532-young men read nearly as many as [women]2251-women . [I]73-catherine [myself]73-catherine have read hundreds and hundreds . Do not imagine that [you]92-henry can cope with [me]73-catherine in a knowledge of [Julias]146-julias and [Louisas]147-louisas . If [we]2771-we proceed to particulars , and engage in the never - ceasing inquiry of ‘ Have [you]92-henry read this ? ’ and ‘ Have [you]92-henry read that ? ’ [I]73-catherine shall soon leave [you]92-henry as far behind [me]73-catherine as — what shall [I]73-catherine say?—I want an appropriate simile.—as far as [[your]92-henry friend]2772-your friend [Emily]145-emily [herself]145-emily left poor Valancourt when [she]145-emily went with [[her]145-emily aunt]2773-her aunt into [Italy]50-italy . Consider how many years [I]73-catherine have had the start of [you]92-henry . [I]73-catherine had entered on [my]73-catherine studies at [Oxford]10-oxford , while [you]92-henry were [a good little girl]2774-a good little girl working [your]92-henry sampler at [home]2403-home ! ”[73-catherine]

“ Not very good , [I]90-miss tilney am afraid . But now really , do not [you]92-henry think [Udolpho]109-udolpho the nicest book in [the world]191-the world ? ”[90-miss tilney]

“ The nicest — by which [I]73-catherine suppose [you]92-henry mean the neatest . That must depend upon the binding . ”[73-catherine]

“ [Henry]92-henry , ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , “ [you]92-henry are very impertinent . [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , [he]2777-he is treating [you]92-henry exactly as [he]2777-he does [[his]2777-he sister]2288-his sister . [He]2777-he is forever finding fault with [me]90-miss tilney , for some incorrectness of language , and now [he]2777-he is taking the same liberty with [you]92-henry . The word ‘ nicest , ’ as [you]92-henry used it , did not suit [him]2777-he ; and [you]92-henry had better change it as soon as [you]92-henry can , or [we]2779-we shall be overpowered with [Johnson]148-johnson and [Blair]149-blair all the rest of the way . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [I]73-catherine am sure , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine , “ [I]73-catherine did not mean to say anything wrong ; but it _ is _ a nice book , and why should not [I]73-catherine call it so ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Very true , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , “ and this is a very nice day , and [we]2779-we are taking a very nice walk , and [you]92-henry are [two very nice young ladies]2780-two very nice young ladies . Oh ! it is a very nice word indeed ! it does for everything . Originally perhaps it was applied only to express neatness , propriety , delicacy , or refinement — [people]320-people were nice in [their]320-people dress , in [their]320-people sentiments , or [their]320-people choice . But now every commendation on every subject is comprised in that one word . ”[92-henry]

“ While , in fact , ”[2288-his sister] cried [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister , “ it ought only to be applied to [you]92-henry , without any commendation at all . [You]92-henry are more nice than wise . Come , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , let [us]2779-we leave [him]92-henry to meditate over [our]2779-we faults in the utmost propriety of diction , while [we]2779-we praise [Udolpho]109-udolpho in whatever terms [we]2779-we like best . It is a most interesting work . [You]92-henry are fond of that kind of reading ? ”[2288-his sister]

“ To say the truth , [I]73-catherine do not much like any other . ”[73-catherine]

“ Indeed ! ”[2288-his sister]

“ That is , [I]73-catherine can read poetry and plays , and things of that sort , and do not dislike travels . But history , real solemn history , [I]73-catherine can not be interested in . Can [you]92-henry ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Yes , [I]2288-his sister am fond of history . ”[2288-his sister]

“ [I]73-catherine wish [I]73-catherine were too . [I]73-catherine read it a little as a duty , but it tells [me]73-catherine nothing that does not either vex or weary [me]73-catherine . The quarrels of [popes]2782-popes and [kings]2695-kings , with wars or pestilences , in every page ; [the men]2308-the men all so good for nothing , and hardly [any women]2785-any women at all — it is very tiresome : and yet [I]73-catherine often think it odd that it should be so dull , for a great deal of it must be invention . The speeches that are put into [the heroes]2786-the heroes ’ mouths , [their]2786-the heroes thoughts and designs — the chief of all this must be invention , and invention is what delights [me]73-catherine in other books . ”[73-catherine]

“ [Historians]2787-historians , [you]92-henry think , ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , “ are not happy in [their]2787-historians flights of fancy . [They]2787-historians display imagination without raising interest . [I]90-miss tilney am fond of history — and am very well contented to take the false with the true . In the principal facts [they]2787-historians have sources of intelligence in former histories and records , which may be as much depended on , [I]90-miss tilney conclude , as anything that does not actually pass under one ’s own observation ; and as for the little embellishments [you]92-henry speak of , they are embellishments , and [I]90-miss tilney like them as such . If a speech be well drawn up , [I]90-miss tilney read it with pleasure , by whomsoever it may be made — and probably with much greater , if the production of [Mr. Hume]150-mr. hume or [Mr. Robertson]151-mr. robertson , than if the genuine words of [Caractacus]152-caractacus , [Agricola]153-agricola , or [Alfred the Great]154-alfred the great . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [You]92-henry are fond of history ! and so are [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen and [[my]73-catherine father]2538-my father ; and [I]73-catherine have [two brothers who do not dislike it]2789-two brothers who do not dislike it . So many instances within [[my]73-catherine small circle of [friends]2791-friends]2790-my small circle of friends is remarkable ! at this rate , [I]73-catherine shall not pity [the writers of history]2792-the writers of history any longer . If [people]320-people like to read [their]320-people books , it is all very well , but to be at so much trouble in filling great volumes , which , as [I]73-catherine used to think , [nobody]2205-nobody would willingly ever look into , to be labouring only for the torment of [little boys]2795-little boys and [girls]2796-girls , always struck [me]73-catherine as a hard fate ; and though [I]73-catherine know it is all very right and necessary , [I]73-catherine have often wondered at [the person]2765-the person ’s courage that could sit down on purpose to do it . ”[73-catherine]

“ That [little boys]2795-little boys and [girls]2796-girls should be tormented , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , “ is what [no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state]2800-no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state can deny ; but in behalf of [[our]2801-our most distinguished historians]2802-our most distinguished historians , [I]92-henry must observe that [they]2802-our most distinguished historians might well be offended at being supposed to have no higher aim , and that by [their]2802-our most distinguished historians method and style , [they]2802-our most distinguished historians are perfectly well qualified to torment [readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life]2803-readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life . [I]92-henry use the verb ‘ to torment , ’ as [I]92-henry observed to be [your]2804-you own method , instead of ‘ to instruct , ’ supposing [them]2802-our most distinguished historians to be now admitted as synonymous . ”[92-henry]

“ [You]2804-you think [me]73-catherine foolish to call instruction a torment , but if [you]2804-you had been as much used as [myself]73-catherine to hear [poor little children]2805-poor little children first learning [their]2805-poor little children letters and then learning to spell , if [you]2804-you had ever seen how stupid [they]2805-poor little children can be for a whole morning together , and how tired [[my]73-catherine poor mother]2806-my poor mother is at the end of it , as [I]73-catherine am in the habit of seeing almost every day of [my]73-catherine life at [home]2403-home , [you]2804-you would allow that to _ torment _ and to _ instruct _ might sometimes be used as synonymous words . ”[73-catherine]

“ Very probably . But [historians]2787-historians are not accountable for the difficulty of learning to read ; and even [you]2804-you [yourself]2804-you , [who do not altogether seem particularly friendly to very severe , very intense application]2809-who do not altogether seem particularly friendly to very severe , very intense application , may perhaps be brought to acknowledge that it is very well worth - while to be tormented for two or three years of [one]2201-one ’s life , for the sake of being able to read all the rest of it . Consider — if reading had not been taught , [Mrs. Radcliffe]122-mrs. radcliffe would have written in vain — or perhaps might not have written at all . ”[92-henry]

[Catherine]73-catherine assented — and a very warm panegyric from [her]973-she on [that lady]974-that lady ’s merits closed the subject . [The Tilneys]132-the tilneys were soon engaged in another on which [she]974-that lady had nothing to say . [They]132-the tilneys were viewing [the country]219-the country with the eyes of [persons accustomed to drawing]976-persons accustomed to drawing , and decided on its capability of being formed into pictures , with all the eagerness of real taste . Here [Catherine]73-catherine was quite lost . [She]973-she knew nothing of drawing — nothing of taste : and [she]973-she listened to [them]132-the tilneys with an attention which brought [her]973-she little profit , for [they]132-the tilneys talked in phrases which conveyed scarcely any idea to [her]973-she . The little which [she]973-she could understand , however , appeared to contradict the very few notions [she]973-she had entertained on the matter before . It seemed as if a good view were no longer to be taken from the top of [an high hill]977-an high hill , and that a clear blue sky was no longer a proof of a fine day . [She]973-she was heartily ashamed of [her]973-she ignorance . A misplaced shame . Where [people]320-people wish to attach , [they]320-people should always be ignorant . [To come with a well - informed mind]979-to come with a well - informed mind is to come with an inability of administering to the vanity of [others]376-others , which [a sensible person]981-a sensible person would always wish to avoid . [A woman]982-a woman especially , if [she]982-a woman have the misfortune of knowing anything , should conceal it as well as [she]982-a woman can .

The advantages of natural folly in [a beautiful girl]983-a beautiful girl have been already set forth by the capital pen of [a sister author]984-a sister author ; and to [her]982-a woman treatment of the subject [I]0-i will only add , in justice to [men]2253-men , that though to the larger and more trifling part of the sex , imbecility in [females]986-females is a great enhancement of [their]986-females personal charms , there is a portion of [them]986-females too reasonable and too well informed [themselves]986-females to desire anything more in [woman]773-woman than ignorance . But [Catherine]73-catherine did not know [her]973-she own advantages — did not know that [a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind]988-a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind , can not fail of attracting [a clever young man]989-a clever young man , unless circumstances are particularly untoward . In the present instance , [she]982-a woman confessed and lamented [her]982-a woman want of knowledge , declared that [she]982-a woman would give anything in [the world]191-the world to be able to draw ; and a lecture on the picturesque immediately followed , in which [his]989-a clever young man instructions were so clear that [she]982-a woman soon began to see beauty in everything admired by [him]989-a clever young man , and [her]982-a woman attention was so earnest that [he]989-a clever young man became perfectly satisfied of [her]982-a woman having a great deal of natural taste . [He]989-a clever young man talked of foregrounds , distances , and second distances — side - screens and perspectives — lights and shades ; and [Catherine]73-catherine was so hopeful [a scholar]991-a scholar that when [they]992-they gained [the top of [Beechen Cliff]47-beechen cliff]993-the top of beechen cliff , [she]973-she voluntarily rejected [the whole city of]994-the whole city of [Bath]5-bath as unworthy to make part of [a landscape]995-a landscape . Delighted with [her]982-a woman progress , and fearful of wearying [her]982-a woman with too much wisdom at once , [Henry]92-henry suffered the subject to decline , and by an easy transition from a piece of rocky fragment and the withered oak which [he]92-henry had placed near [its]996-its summit , to oaks in general , to [forests]997-forests , the enclosure of [them]997-forests , [waste lands]998-waste lands , crown lands and government , [he]92-henry shortly found [himself]92-henry arrived at politics ; and from politics , it was an easy step to silence . The general pause which succeeded [his]92-henry short disquisition on the state of [the nation]999-the nation was put an end to by [Catherine]73-catherine , who , in rather a solemn tone of voice , uttered these words , “ [I]73-catherine have heard that something very shocking indeed will soon come out in [London]11-london . ”[73-catherine]

[Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , to whom this was chiefly addressed , was startled , and hastily replied , “ Indeed ! and of what nature ? ”[90-miss tilney]

“ That [I]92-henry do not know , nor who is [the author]2811-the author . [I]92-henry have only heard that it is to be more horrible than anything [we]2812-we have met with yet . ”[92-henry]

“ Good heaven ! where could [you]92-henry hear of such a thing ? ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [A particular friend of mine]2303-a particular friend of mine had an account of it in a letter from [London]11-london yesterday . It is to be uncommonly dreadful . [I]92-henry shall expect murder and everything of the kind . ”[92-henry]

“ [You]92-henry speak with astonishing composure ! but [I]90-miss tilney hope [[your]92-henry friend]2772-your friend ’s accounts have been exaggerated ; and if such a design is known beforehand , proper measures will undoubtedly be taken by government to prevent its coming to effect . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ Government , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , endeavouring not to smile , “ neither desires nor dares to interfere in such matters . There must be murder ; and government cares not how much . ”[92-henry]

[The ladies]312-the ladies stared . [He]92-henry laughed , and added , “ Come , shall [I]92-henry make [you]312-the ladies understand [each other]330-each other , or leave [you]312-the ladies to puzzle out an explanation as [you]312-the ladies can ? No — [I]92-henry will be noble . [I]92-henry will prove [myself]92-henry [a man]2335-a man , no less by the generosity of [my]92-henry soul than the clearness of [my]92-henry head . [I]92-henry have no patience with such of [my]92-henry sex as disdain to let [themselves]312-the ladies sometimes down to the comprehension of [yours]312-the ladies . Perhaps the abilities of [women]2251-women are neither sound nor acute — neither vigorous nor keen . Perhaps [they]2251-women may want observation , discernment , judgment , fire , genius , and wit . ”[92-henry]

“ [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , do not mind what [he]92-henry says ; but have the goodness to satisfy [me]90-miss tilney as to this dreadful riot . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ Riot ! what riot ? ”[92-henry]

“ [[My]90-miss tilney dear]2185-my dear [Eleanor]142-eleanor , the riot is only in [your]142-eleanor own brain . The confusion there is scandalous . [Miss Morland]84-miss morland has been talking of nothing more dreadful than a new publication which is shortly to come out , in three duodecimo volumes , two hundred and seventy - six pages in each , with a frontispiece to the first , of two tombstones and a lantern — do [you]142-eleanor understand ? And [you]142-eleanor , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland — [[my]90-miss tilney stupid sister]2819-my stupid sister has mistaken all [your]142-eleanor clearest expressions . [You]142-eleanor talked of expected horrors in [London]11-london — and instead of instantly conceiving , as [any rational creature]2820-any rational creature would have done , that such words could relate only to a circulating library , [she]2819-my stupid sister immediately pictured to [herself]2819-my stupid sister a mob of [three thousand men]2821-three thousand men assembling in [St. George ’s Fields]51-st. george ’s fields , [the Bank]2822-the bank attacked , [the Tower]52-the tower threatened , [the streets of [London]11-london]2823-the streets of london flowing with blood , [a detachment of the Twelfth Light Dragoons]2824-a detachment of the twelfth light dragoons ( the hopes of [the nation]999-the nation ) called up from [Northampton]53-northampton to quell [the insurgents]2826-the insurgents , and [the gallant Captain Frederick Tilney]74-captain tilney , in the moment of charging at the head of [[his]74-captain tilney troop]2827-his troop , knocked off [his]74-captain tilney horse by a brickbat from an upper window . Forgive [her]2819-my stupid sister stupidity . The fears of [the sister]2828-the sister have added to the weakness of [the woman]2582-the woman ; but [she]2819-my stupid sister is by no means [a simpleton in general]2830-a simpleton in general . ”[90-miss tilney]

[Catherine]73-catherine looked grave . “ And now , [Henry]92-henry , ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , “ that [you]92-henry have made [us]2831-us understand [each other]330-each other , [you]92-henry may as well make [Miss Morland]84-miss morland understand [yourself]92-henry — unless [you]92-henry mean to have [her]84-miss morland think [you]92-henry intolerably rude to [[your]92-henry sister]2261-your sister , and a great brute in [your]92-henry opinion of [women in general]2834-women in general . [Miss Morland]84-miss morland is not used to [your]92-henry odd ways . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [I]90-miss tilney shall be most happy to make [her]84-miss morland better acquainted with [them]2834-women in general . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ No doubt ; but that is no explanation of the present . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ What am [I]90-miss tilney to do ? ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [You]92-henry know what [you]92-henry ought to do . Clear [your]92-henry character handsomely before [her]84-miss morland . Tell [her]84-miss morland that [you]92-henry think very highly of the understanding of [women]2251-women . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , [I]90-miss tilney think very highly of the understanding of [all the women in [the world]191-the world]2836-all the women in the world — especially of those — whoever [they]2836-all the women in the world may be — with whom [I]90-miss tilney happen to be in company . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ That is not enough . Be more serious . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , [no one]359-no one can think more highly of the understanding of [women]2251-women than [I]90-miss tilney do . In [my]90-miss tilney opinion , nature has given [them]2251-women so much that [they]2251-women never find it necessary to use more than half . ”[90-miss tilney]

“ [We]2840-we shall get nothing more serious from [him]92-henry now , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland . [He]92-henry is not in a sober mood . But [I]90-miss tilney do assure [you]73-catherine that [he]92-henry must be entirely misunderstood , if [he]92-henry can ever appear to say an unjust thing of [any woman]2841-any woman at all , or an unkind one of [me]90-miss tilney . ”[90-miss tilney]

It was no effort to [Catherine]73-catherine to believe that [Henry Tilney]92-henry could never be wrong . [His]92-henry manner might sometimes surprise , but [his]92-henry meaning must always be just : and what [she]1001-she did not understand , [she]1001-she was almost as ready to admire , as what [she]1001-she did .
