[He]74-captain tilney approached immediately , and took the seat to which [her]101-isabella movements invited [him]74-captain tilney . [His]74-captain tilney first address made [Catherine]73-catherine start . Though spoken low , [she]101-isabella could distinguish , “ What ! always to be watched , in person or by proxy ! ”[74-captain tilney]

“ Psha , nonsense ! ”[101-isabella] was [Isabella]101-isabella ’s answer in the same half whisper . “ Why do [you]74-captain tilney put such things into [my]101-isabella head ? If [I]101-isabella could believe it — [my]101-isabella spirit , [you]74-captain tilney know , is pretty independent . ”[101-isabella]

“ [I]74-captain tilney wish [your]74-captain tilney heart were independent . That would be enough for [me]74-captain tilney . ”[74-captain tilney]

“ [My]101-isabella heart , indeed ! what can [you]74-captain tilney have to do with hearts ? [[You]74-captain tilney men]2415-you men have none of [you]74-captain tilney any hearts . ”[101-isabella]

“ If [we]2415-you men have not hearts , [we]2415-you men have eyes ; and [they]3041-they give [us]2415-you men torment enough . ”[74-captain tilney]

“ Do [they]3041-they ? [I]101-isabella am sorry for it ; [I]101-isabella am sorry [they]3041-they find anything so disagreeable in [me]101-isabella . [I]101-isabella will look another way . [I]101-isabella hope this pleases [you]73-catherine ”[101-isabella] ( turning [her]1190-her back on [him]1191-him ) ; “ [I]101-isabella hope [your]73-catherine eyes are not tormented now . ”[101-isabella]

“ Never more so ; for the edge of a blooming cheek is still in view — at once too much and too little . ”[101-isabella]

[Catherine]73-catherine heard all this , and quite out of countenance , could listen no longer . Amazed that [Isabella]101-isabella could endure it , and jealous for [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother , [she]101-isabella rose up , and saying [she]101-isabella should join [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , proposed [their]1193-their walking . But for this [Isabella]101-isabella showed no inclination . [She]101-isabella was so amazingly tired , and it was so odious to parade about [the pump - room]357-the pump - room ; and if [she]101-isabella moved from [her]101-isabella seat [she]101-isabella should miss [[her]101-isabella sisters]1195-her sisters ; [she]101-isabella was expecting [[her]101-isabella sisters]1195-her sisters every moment ; so that [[her]101-isabella dearest]732-her dearest [Catherine]73-catherine must excuse [her]101-isabella , and must sit quietly down again . But [Catherine]73-catherine could be stubborn too ; and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen just then coming up to propose [their]1193-their returning [home]2403-home , [she]101-isabella joined [her]101-isabella and walked out of [the pump - room]357-the pump - room , leaving [Isabella]101-isabella still sitting with [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney . With much uneasiness did [she]101-isabella thus leave [them]1193-their . It seemed to [her]101-isabella that [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney was falling in love with [Isabella]101-isabella , and [Isabella]101-isabella unconsciously encouraging [him]74-captain tilney ; unconsciously it must be , for [Isabella]101-isabella ’s attachment to [James]103-james was as certain and well acknowledged as [her]101-isabella engagement . To doubt [her]101-isabella truth or good intentions was impossible ; and yet , during the whole of [their]1193-their conversation [her]101-isabella manner had been odd . [She]101-isabella wished [Isabella]101-isabella had talked more like [her]101-isabella usual self , and not so much about money , and had not looked so well pleased at the sight of [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney . How strange that [she]101-isabella should not perceive [his]74-captain tilney admiration ! [catherine]73-catherine longed to give [her]101-isabella a hint of it , to put [her]101-isabella on [her]101-isabella guard , and prevent all the pain which [her]101-isabella too lively behaviour might otherwise create both for [him]74-captain tilney and [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother .

The compliment of [John Thorpe]97-john ’s affection did not make amends for this thoughtlessness in [[his]97-john sister]2288-his sister . [She]101-isabella was almost as far from believing as from wishing it to be sincere ; for [she]101-isabella had not forgotten that [he]74-captain tilney could mistake , and [his]74-captain tilney assertion of the offer and of [her]101-isabella encouragement convinced [her]101-isabella that [his]74-captain tilney mistakes could sometimes be very egregious . In vanity , therefore , [she]101-isabella gained but little ; [her]101-isabella chief profit was in wonder . That [he]74-captain tilney should think it worth [his]74-captain tilney while to fancy [himself]74-captain tilney in love with [her]101-isabella was a matter of lively astonishment . [Isabella]101-isabella talked of [his]74-captain tilney attentions ; _ [she]101-isabella _ had never been sensible of any ; but [Isabella]101-isabella had said many things which [she]101-isabella hoped had been spoken in haste , and would never be said again ; and upon this [she]101-isabella was glad to rest altogether for present ease and comfort .

CHAPTER 19

A few days passed away , and [Catherine]73-catherine , though not allowing [herself]73-catherine to suspect [[her]101-isabella friend]305-her friend , could not help watching [her]101-isabella closely . The result of [her]101-isabella observations was not agreeable . [Isabella]101-isabella seemed [an altered creature]1203-an altered creature . When [she]101-isabella saw [her]101-isabella , indeed , surrounded only by [[their]1204-their immediate friends]1205-their immediate friends in [[Edgar]116-edgar ’s Buildings or [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street]1206-edgar ’s buildings or pulteney street , [her]101-isabella change of manners was so trifling that , had it gone no farther , it might have passed unnoticed . A something of languid indifference , or of that boasted absence of mind which [Catherine]73-catherine had never heard of before , would occasionally come across [her]101-isabella ; but had nothing worse appeared , _ that _ might only have spread a new grace and inspired a warmer interest . But when [Catherine]73-catherine saw [her]101-isabella in public , admitting [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney ’s attentions as readily as they were offered , and allowing [him]74-captain tilney almost an equal share with [James]103-james in [her]101-isabella notice and smiles , the alteration became too positive to be passed over . What could be meant by such unsteady conduct , what [[her]101-isabella friend]305-her friend could be at , was beyond [her]101-isabella comprehension . [Isabella]101-isabella could not be aware of the pain [she]101-isabella was inflicting ; but it was a degree of wilful thoughtlessness which [Catherine]73-catherine could not but resent . [James]103-james was [the sufferer]1208-the sufferer . [She]101-isabella saw [him]103-james grave and uneasy ; and however careless of [his]103-james present comfort [the woman]2582-the woman might be who had given [him]103-james [her]2582-the woman heart , to _ [her]2582-the woman _ it was always an object . For [poor Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney too [she]101-isabella was greatly concerned . Though [his]74-captain tilney looks did not please [her]101-isabella , [his]74-captain tilney name was a passport to [her]101-isabella goodwill , and [she]101-isabella thought with sincere compassion of [his]74-captain tilney approaching disappointment ; for , in spite of what [she]101-isabella had believed [herself]101-isabella to overhear in [the pump - room]357-the pump - room , [his]74-captain tilney behaviour was so incompatible with a knowledge of [Isabella]101-isabella ’s engagement that [she]101-isabella could not , upon reflection , imagine [him]74-captain tilney aware of it . [He]74-captain tilney might be jealous of [[her]101-isabella brother]2287-her brother as [a rival]1212-a rival , but if more had seemed implied , the fault must have been in [her]101-isabella misapprehension . [She]101-isabella wished , by a gentle remonstrance , to remind [Isabella]101-isabella of [her]101-isabella situation , and make [her]101-isabella aware of this double unkindness ; but for remonstrance , either opportunity or comprehension was always against [her]101-isabella . If able to suggest a hint , [Isabella]101-isabella could never understand it . In this distress , the intended departure of [the Tilney family]1213-the tilney family became [her]101-isabella chief consolation ; [their]1213-the tilney family journey into [Gloucestershire]9-gloucestershire was to take place within a few days , and [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney ’s removal would at least restore peace to every heart but [his]74-captain tilney own . But [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney had at present no intention of removing ; [he]74-captain tilney was not to be of [the party to [Northanger]60-northanger]1214-the party to northanger ; [he]74-captain tilney was to continue at [Bath]5-bath . When [Catherine]73-catherine knew this , [her]101-isabella resolution was directly made . [She]101-isabella spoke to [Henry Tilney]92-henry on the subject , regretting [[his]92-henry brother]1103-his brother ’s evident partiality for [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , and entreating [him]92-henry to make known [her]101-isabella prior engagement .

“ [[My]92-henry brother]2349-my brother does know it , ”[92-henry] was [Henry]92-henry ’s answer .

“ Does [he]2349-my brother ? Then why does [he]2349-my brother stay [here]280-here ? ”[92-henry]

[He]92-henry made no reply , and was beginning to talk of something else ; but [she]101-isabella eagerly continued , “ Why do not [you]92-henry persuade [him]2349-my brother to go away ? The longer [he]2349-my brother stays , the worse it will be for [him]2349-my brother at last . Pray advise [him]2349-my brother for [his]2349-my brother own sake , and for [everybody]318-everybody ’s sake , to leave [Bath]5-bath directly . Absence will in time make [him]2349-my brother comfortable again ; but [he]2349-my brother can have no hope here , and it is only staying to be miserable . ”[101-isabella]

[Henry]92-henry smiled and said , “ [I]92-henry am sure [[my]92-henry brother]2349-my brother would not wish to do that . ”[92-henry]

“ Then [you]92-henry will persuade [him]2349-my brother to go away ? ”[92-henry]

“ Persuasion is not at command ; but pardon [me]92-henry , if [I]92-henry can not even endeavour to persuade [him]2349-my brother . [I]92-henry have [myself]92-henry told [him]2349-my brother that [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe is engaged . [He]2349-my brother knows what [he]2349-my brother is about , and must be [[his]2349-my brother own master]3046-his own master . ”[92-henry]

“ No , [he]2349-my brother does not know what [he]2349-my brother is about , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine ; “ [he]2349-my brother does not know the pain [he]2349-my brother is giving [[my]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother . Not that [James]103-james has ever told [me]73-catherine so , but [I]73-catherine am sure [he]2349-my brother is very uncomfortable . ”[73-catherine]

“ And are [you]73-catherine sure it is [[my]92-henry brother]2349-my brother ’s doing ? ”[92-henry]

“ Yes , very sure . ”[73-catherine]

“ Is it [[my]92-henry brother]2349-my brother ’s attentions to [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , or [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s admission of [them]3050-them , that gives the pain ? ”[92-henry]

“ Is not it the same thing ? ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]92-henry think [Mr. Morland]103-james would acknowledge a difference . [No man]774-no man is offended by [another man]3052-another man ’s admiration of [the woman [he]774-no man loves]3053-the woman he loves ; it is [the woman only who can make it a torment]3054-the woman only who can make it a torment . ”[92-henry]

[Catherine]73-catherine blushed for [[her]1216-her friend]305-her friend , and said , “ [Isabella]101-isabella is wrong . But [I]73-catherine am sure [she]101-isabella can not mean to torment , for [she]101-isabella is very much attached to [[my]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother . [She]101-isabella has been in love with [him]2349-my brother ever since [they]3056-they first met , and while [[my]73-catherine father]2538-my father ’s consent was uncertain , [she]101-isabella fretted [herself]101-isabella almost into a fever . [You]73-catherine know [she]101-isabella must be attached to [him]2349-my brother . ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]73-catherine understand : [she]101-isabella is in love with [James]103-james , and flirts with [Frederick]74-captain tilney . ”[73-catherine]

“ Oh no , not flirts . [A woman in love with one man]3058-a woman in love with one man can not flirt with another . ”[73-catherine]

“ It is probable that [she]101-isabella will neither love so well , nor flirt so well , as [she]101-isabella might do either singly . [The gentlemen]2192-the gentlemen must each give up a little . ”[73-catherine]

After a short pause , [Catherine]73-catherine resumed with , “ Then [you]73-catherine do not believe [Isabella]101-isabella so very much attached to [[my]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother ? ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]73-catherine can have no opinion on that subject . ”[73-catherine]

“ But what can [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother mean ? If [he]2395-your brother knows [her]101-isabella engagement , what can [he]2395-your brother mean by [his]2395-your brother behaviour ? ”[73-catherine]

“ [You]73-catherine are [a very close questioner]3062-a very close questioner . ”[73-catherine]

“ Am [I]73-catherine ? [I]73-catherine only ask what [I]73-catherine want to be told . ”[73-catherine]

“ But do [you]73-catherine only ask what [I]73-catherine can be expected to tell ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Yes , [I]73-catherine think so ; for [you]73-catherine must know [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother ’s heart . ”[73-catherine]

“ [[My]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother ’s heart , as [you]73-catherine term it , on the present occasion , [I]73-catherine assure [you]73-catherine [I]73-catherine can only guess at . ”[73-catherine]

“ Well ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Well ! nay , if it is to be guesswork , let [us]3065-us all guess for [ourselves]3065-us . To be guided by second - hand conjecture is pitiful . [The premises]3066-the premises are before [you]73-catherine . [[My]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother is [a lively and perhaps sometimes a thoughtless young man]3068-a lively and perhaps sometimes a thoughtless young man ; [he]2349-my brother has had about a week ’s acquaintance with [[your]73-catherine friend]2772-your friend , and [he]2349-my brother has known [her]2772-your friend engagement almost as long as [he]2349-my brother has known [her]2772-your friend . ”[73-catherine]

“ Well , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , after some moments ’ consideration , “ _ [you]73-catherine _ may be able to guess at [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother ’s intentions from all this ; but [I]73-catherine am sure [I]73-catherine can not . But is not [[your]73-catherine father]2706-your father uncomfortable about it ? Does not [he]2706-your father want [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney to go away ? Sure , if [[your]73-catherine father]2706-your father were to speak to [him]2706-your father , [he]2706-your father would go . ”[73-catherine]

“ [[My]92-henry dear]2185-my dear [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , “ in this amiable solicitude for [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother ’s comfort , may [you]73-catherine not be a little mistaken ? Are [you]73-catherine not carried a little too far ? Would [he]74-captain tilney thank [you]73-catherine , either on [his]74-captain tilney own account or [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s , for supposing that [her]95-miss thorpe affection , or at least [her]95-miss thorpe good behaviour , is only to be secured by [her]95-miss thorpe seeing nothing of [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney ? Is [he]74-captain tilney safe only in solitude ? Or is [her]95-miss thorpe heart constant to [him]74-captain tilney only when unsolicited by [anyone else]2580-anyone else ? [He]74-captain tilney can not think this — and [you]73-catherine may be sure that [he]74-captain tilney would not have [you]73-catherine think it . [I]92-henry will not say , ‘ Do not be uneasy , ’ because [I]92-henry know that [you]73-catherine are so , at this moment ; but be as little uneasy as [you]73-catherine can . [You]73-catherine have no doubt of the mutual attachment of [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother and [[your]73-catherine friend]2772-your friend ; depend upon it , therefore , that real jealousy never can exist between [them]3078-them ; depend upon it that no disagreement between [them]3078-them can be of any duration . [Their]3078-them hearts are open to each other , as neither heart can be to [you]73-catherine ; [they]3078-them know exactly what is required and what can be borne ; and [you]73-catherine may be certain that [one]2201-one will never tease [the other]412-the other beyond what is known to be pleasant . ”[92-henry]

Perceiving [her]1218-her still to look doubtful and grave , [he]1219-he added , “ Though [Frederick]74-captain tilney does not leave [Bath]5-bath with [us]3081-us , [he]74-captain tilney will probably remain but a very short time , perhaps only a few days behind [us]3081-us . [His]74-captain tilney leave of absence will soon expire , and [he]74-captain tilney must return to [[his]74-captain tilney regiment]3082-his regiment . And what will then be [their]3078-them acquaintance ? [The mess - room]3083-the mess - room will drink [Isabella Thorpe]101-isabella for a fortnight , and [she]101-isabella will laugh with [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother over poor [Tilney]74-captain tilney ’s passion for a month . ”[1219-he]

[Catherine]73-catherine would contend no longer against comfort . [She]1218-her had resisted its approaches during the whole length of a speech , but it now carried [her]1218-her captive . [Henry Tilney]92-henry must know best . [She]1218-her blamed [herself]1218-her for the extent of [her]1218-her fears , and resolved never to think so seriously on the subject again .

[Her]1218-her resolution was supported by [Isabella]101-isabella ’s behaviour in [their]1220-their parting interview . [The Thorpes]102-the thorpes spent the last evening of [Catherine]73-catherine ’s stay in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , and nothing passed between [the lovers]1221-the lovers to excite [her]1218-her uneasiness , or make [her]1218-her quit [them]1221-the lovers in apprehension . [James]103-james was in excellent spirits , and [Isabella]101-isabella most engagingly placid . [Her]1218-her tenderness for [[her]1218-her friend]305-her friend seemed rather the first feeling of [her]1218-her heart ; but that at such a moment was allowable ; and once [she]1218-her gave [[her]1218-her lover]226-her lover a flat contradiction , and once [she]1218-her drew back [her]1218-her hand ; but [Catherine]73-catherine remembered [Henry]92-henry ’s instructions , and placed it all to judicious affection . The embraces , tears , and promises of the parting fair ones may be fancied .

CHAPTER 20

[Mr.]1224-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen were sorry to lose [[their]1225-their young friend]1226-their young friend , whose good humour and cheerfulness had made [her]1226-their young friend [a valuable companion]1227-a valuable companion , and in the promotion of whose enjoyment [their]1225-their own had been gently increased . [Her]1226-their young friend happiness in going with [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , however , prevented [their]1225-their wishing it otherwise ; and , as [they]1225-their were to remain only one more week in [Bath]2236-bath [themselves]1225-their , [her]1226-their young friend quitting [them]1225-their now would not long be felt . [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen attended [her]1226-their young friend to [Milsom Street]14-milsom street , where [she]1226-their young friend was to breakfast , and saw [her]1226-their young friend seated with the kindest welcome among [[her]1226-their young friend new friends]1229-her new friends ; but so great was [her]1226-their young friend agitation in finding [herself]1226-their young friend as [one of [the family]454-the family]1230-one of the family , and so fearful was [she]1226-their young friend of not doing exactly what was right , and of not being able to preserve [their]1225-their good opinion , that , in the embarrassment of the first five minutes , [she]1226-their young friend could almost have wished to return with [him]83-mr. allen to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street .

[Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s manners and [Henry]92-henry ’s smile soon did away some of [her]1226-their young friend unpleasant feelings ; but still [she]1226-their young friend was far from being at ease ; nor could the incessant attentions of [the General]800-the general [himself]800-the general entirely reassure [her]1226-their young friend . Nay , perverse as it seemed , [she]1226-their young friend doubted whether [she]1226-their young friend might not have felt less , had [she]1226-their young friend been less attended to . [His]800-the general anxiety for [her]1226-their young friend comfort — [his]800-the general continual solicitations that [she]1226-their young friend would eat , and [his]800-the general often - expressed fears of [her]1226-their young friend seeing nothing to [her]1226-their young friend taste — though never in [her]1226-their young friend life before had [she]1226-their young friend beheld half such variety on a breakfast - table — made it impossible for [her]1226-their young friend to forget for a moment that [she]1226-their young friend was [a visitor]1233-a visitor . [She]1226-their young friend felt utterly unworthy of such respect , and knew not how to reply to it . [Her]1226-their young friend tranquillity was not improved by [the General]800-the general ’s impatience for the appearance of [[his]800-the general eldest son]1235-his eldest son , nor by the displeasure [he]800-the general expressed at [his]800-the general laziness when [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney at last came down . [She]1226-their young friend was quite pained by the severity of [[his]1235-his eldest son father]881-his father ’s reproof , which seemed disproportionate to the offence ; and much was [her]1226-their young friend concern increased when [she]1226-their young friend found [herself]1226-their young friend the principal cause of the lecture , and that [his]800-the general tardiness was chiefly resented from being disrespectful to [her]1226-their young friend . This was placing [her]1226-their young friend in a very uncomfortable situation , and [she]1226-their young friend felt great compassion for [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney , without being able to hope for [his]800-the general goodwill .

[He]1235-his eldest son listened to [[his]1235-his eldest son father]881-his father in silence , and attempted not any defence , which confirmed [her]1226-their young friend in fearing that the inquietude of [his]1235-his eldest son mind , on [Isabella]101-isabella ’s account , might , by keeping [him]1235-his eldest son long sleepless , have been the real cause of [his]1235-his eldest son rising late . It was the first time of [her]1226-their young friend being decidedly in [his]1235-his eldest son company , and [she]1226-their young friend had hoped to be now able to form [her]1226-their young friend opinion of [him]1235-his eldest son ; but [she]1226-their young friend scarcely heard [his]1235-his eldest son voice while [[his]1235-his eldest son father]881-his father remained in [the room]301-the room ; and even afterwards , so much were [his]1235-his eldest son spirits affected , [she]1226-their young friend could distinguish nothing but these words , in a whisper to [Eleanor]142-eleanor , “ How glad [I]1226-their young friend shall be when [you]142-eleanor are all off . ”[1226-their young friend]

The bustle of going was not pleasant . The clock struck ten while the trunks were carrying down , and [the General]800-the general had fixed to be out of [Milsom Street]14-milsom street by that hour . [His]1235-his eldest son greatcoat , instead of being brought for [him]1235-his eldest son to put on directly , was spread out in the curricle in which [he]1235-his eldest son was to accompany [[his]1235-his eldest son son]2708-his son . The middle seat of the chaise was not drawn out , though there were [three people]1242-three people to go in [it]1243-it , and [[his]1235-his eldest son daughter ’s maid]1244-his daughter ’s maid had so crowded it with parcels that [Miss Morland]84-miss morland would not have room to sit ; and , so much was [he]1235-his eldest son influenced by this apprehension when [he]1235-his eldest son handed [her]84-miss morland in , that [she]84-miss morland had some difficulty in saving [her]84-miss morland own new writing - desk from being thrown out into [the street]444-the street . At last , however , the door was closed upon [the three females]1246-the three females , and [they]1246-the three females set off at the sober pace in which the handsome , highly fed four horses of [a gentleman]384-a gentleman usually perform a journey of thirty miles : such was the distance of [Northanger]60-northanger from [Bath]5-bath , to be now divided into two equal stages . [Catherine]73-catherine ’s spirits revived as [they]1246-the three females drove from the door ; for with [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney [she]84-miss morland felt no restraint ; and , with the interest of [a road entirely new to [her]84-miss morland]1248-a road entirely new to her , of [an abbey]1157-an abbey before , and [a curricle]1250-a curricle behind , [she]84-miss morland caught the last view of [Bath]5-bath without any regret , and met with every milestone before [she]84-miss morland expected it . The tediousness of a two hours ’ wait at [Petty France]61-petty france , in which there was nothing to be done but to eat without being hungry , and loiter about without anything to see , next followed — and [her]84-miss morland admiration of the style in which [they]1246-the three females travelled , of the fashionable chaise and four — postilions handsomely liveried , rising so regularly in [their]1246-the three females stirrups , and numerous outriders properly mounted , sunk a little under this consequent inconvenience . Had [[their]1246-the three females party]640-their party been perfectly agreeable , the delay would have been nothing ; but [General Tilney]138-general tilney , though so charming [a man]2335-a man , seemed always a check upon [[his]138-general tilney children]1094-his children ’s spirits , and scarcely anything was said but by [himself]138-general tilney ; the observation of which , with [his]138-general tilney discontent at whatever [the inn]1254-the inn afforded , and [his]138-general tilney angry impatience at [the waiters]1255-the waiters , made [Catherine]73-catherine grow every moment more in awe of [him]138-general tilney , and appeared to lengthen the two hours into four . At last , however , the order of release was given ; and much was [Catherine]73-catherine then surprised by [the General]800-the general ’s proposal of [her]800-the general taking [his]138-general tilney place in [[[his]138-general tilney son]2708-his son ’s curricle]1258-his son ’s curricle for the rest of [[the journey]1259-the journey]1259-the journey : “ the day was fine , and [he]138-general tilney was anxious for [her]800-the general seeing as much of [the country]219-the country as possible . ”[800-the general]

The remembrance of [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s opinion , respecting [young men]532-young men ’s open carriages , made [her]800-the general blush at the mention of such a plan , and [her]800-the general first thought was to decline it ; but [her]800-the general second was of greater deference for [General Tilney]138-general tilney ’s judgment ; [he]138-general tilney could not propose anything improper for [her]800-the general ; and , in the course of a few minutes , [she]800-the general found [herself]800-the general with [Henry]92-henry in [the curricle]1262-the curricle , as happy a being as ever existed . A very short trial convinced [her]800-the general that [a curricle]1250-a curricle was the prettiest equipage in [the world]191-the world ; the chaise and four wheeled off with some grandeur , to be sure , but it was a heavy and troublesome business , and [she]800-the general could not easily forget its having stopped two hours at [Petty France]61-petty france . Half the time would have been enough for [the curricle]1262-the curricle , and so nimbly were the light horses disposed to move , that , had not [the General]800-the general chosen to have [[his]800-the general own carriage]1267-his own carriage lead the way , [they]1268-they could have passed [it]1267-his own carriage with ease in half a minute . But the merit of [the curricle]1262-the curricle did not all belong to the horses ; [Henry]92-henry drove so well — so quietly — without making any disturbance , without parading to [her]800-the general , or swearing at [them]1268-they : so different from [the only gentleman - coachman whom it was in [her]800-the general power to compare [him]92-henry with]1270-the only gentleman - coachman whom it was in her power to compare him with ! and then [his]92-henry hat sat so well , and the innumerable capes of [his]92-henry greatcoat looked so becomingly important ! to be driven by [him]92-henry , next to being dancing with [him]92-henry , was certainly the greatest happiness in [the world]191-the world . In addition to every other delight , [she]800-the general had now that of listening to [her]800-the general own praise ; of being thanked at least , on [[his]92-henry sister]2288-his sister ’s account , for [her]2288-his sister kindness in thus becoming [[her]2288-his sister visitor]1060-her visitor ; of hearing it ranked as real friendship , and described as creating real gratitude . [[His]92-henry sister]2288-his sister , [he]92-henry said , was uncomfortably circumstanced — [she]2288-his sister had [no female companion]1275-no female companion — and , in the frequent absence of [[her]2288-his sister father]182-her father , was sometimes without [any companion]1277-any companion at all .

“ But how can that be ? ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine . “ Are not [you]92-henry with [her]2288-his sister ? ”[73-catherine]

“ [Northanger]60-northanger is not more than half [[my]92-henry home]3086-my home ; [I]92-henry have [an establishment at [[my]92-henry own house in [Woodston]62-woodston]3088-my own house in woodston]3087-an establishment at my own house in woodston , which is nearly twenty miles from [[my]92-henry father]2538-my father ’s , and some of [my]92-henry time is necessarily spent [there]2232-there . ”[92-henry]

“ How sorry [you]1278-you must be for that ! ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]92-henry am always sorry to leave [Eleanor]142-eleanor . ”[92-henry]

“ Yes ; but besides [your]1278-you affection for [her]2288-his sister , [you]1278-you must be so fond of [the abbey]3091-the abbey ! after being used to [such a home]3092-such a home as [the abbey]3091-the abbey , [an ordinary parsonage - house]3094-an ordinary parsonage - house must be very disagreeable . ”[73-catherine]

[He]1278-you smiled , and said , “ [You]1278-you have formed a very favourable idea of [the abbey]3091-the abbey . ”[1278-you]

“ To be sure , [I]92-henry have . Is not it [a fine old place]3096-a fine old place , just like what one reads about ? ”[92-henry]

“ And are [you]1278-you prepared to encounter all the horrors that [a building]3097-a building such as ‘ what one reads about ’ may produce ? Have [you]1278-you a stout heart ? Nerves fit for sliding panels and tapestry ? ”[1278-you]

“ Oh ! yes — [I]92-henry do not think [I]92-henry should be easily frightened , because there would be so many people in [the house]211-the house — and besides , [it]211-the house has never been uninhabited and left deserted for years , and then [the family]454-the family come back to [it]211-the house unawares , without giving any notice , as generally happens . ”[92-henry]

“ No , certainly . [We]454-the family shall not have to explore [our]454-the family way into [a hall]3100-a hall dimly lighted by the expiring embers of a wood fire — nor be obliged to spread [our]454-the family beds on the floor of [a room]3101-a room without windows , doors , or furniture . But [you]1278-you must be aware that when [a young lady]241-a young lady is ( by whatever means ) introduced into [a dwelling]3103-a dwelling of this kind , [she]241-a young lady is always lodged apart from [the rest of [the family]454-the family]2379-the rest of the family . While [they]454-the family snugly repair to [[their]454-the family own end of [the house]211-the house]3106-their own end of the house , [she]241-a young lady is formally conducted by [Dorothy]161-dorothy , [the ancient housekeeper]3108-the ancient housekeeper , up a different staircase , and along [many gloomy passages]3109-many gloomy passages , into [an apartment never used since [some cousin or kin]3111-some cousin or kin died in [it]3110-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it]3110-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before . Can [you]1278-you stand such a ceremony as this ? Will not [your]1278-you mind misgive [you]1278-you when [you]1278-you find [yourself]1278-you in [this gloomy chamber]3112-this gloomy chamber — too lofty and extensive for [you]1278-you , with only the feeble rays of a single lamp to take in [its]3112-this gloomy chamber size — [its]3112-this gloomy chamber walls hung with tapestry exhibiting figures as large as life , and the bed , of dark green stuff or purple velvet , presenting even a funereal appearance ? Will not [your]1278-you heart sink within [you]1278-you ? ”[1278-you]

“ Oh ! but this will not happen to [me]92-henry , [I]92-henry am sure . ”[92-henry]

“ How fearfully will [you]1278-you examine the furniture of [[your]1278-you apartment]3113-your apartment ! and what will [you]1278-you discern ? Not tables , toilettes , [wardrobes]3114-wardrobes , or drawers , but on one side perhaps the remains of a broken lute , on the other a ponderous chest which no efforts can open , and over the fireplace the portrait of [some handsome warrior]3115-some handsome warrior , whose features will so incomprehensibly strike [you]1278-you , that [you]1278-you will not be able to withdraw [your]1278-you eyes from it . [Dorothy]161-dorothy , meanwhile , no less struck by [your]1278-you appearance , gazes on [you]1278-you in great agitation , and drops a few unintelligible hints . To raise [your]1278-you spirits , moreover , [she]161-dorothy gives [you]1278-you reason to suppose that the part of [the abbey [you]1278-you inhabit]3116-the abbey you inhabit is undoubtedly haunted , and informs [you]1278-you that [you]1278-you will not have a single domestic within call . With this parting cordial [she]161-dorothy curtsies off — [you]1278-you listen to the sound of [her]161-dorothy receding footsteps as long as the last echo can reach [you]1278-you — and when , with fainting spirits , [you]1278-you attempt to fasten [your]1278-you door , [you]1278-you discover , with increased alarm , that it has no lock . ”[1278-you]

“ Oh ! [mr . Tilney]142-eleanor , how frightful ! this is just like a book ! but it can not really happen to [me]92-henry . [I]92-henry am sure [[your]142-eleanor housekeeper]3117-your housekeeper is not really [Dorothy]161-dorothy . Well , what then ? ”[92-henry]

“ Nothing further to alarm perhaps may occur the first night . After surmounting [your]1278-you _ unconquerable _ horror of the bed , [you]1278-you will retire to rest , and get a few hours ’ unquiet slumber . But on the second , or at farthest the _ third _ night after [your]1278-you arrival , [you]1278-you will probably have a violent storm . Peals of thunder so loud as to seem to shake the edifice to its foundation will roll round [the neighbouring mountains]3118-the neighbouring mountains — and during the frightful gusts of wind which accompany it , [you]1278-you will probably think [you]1278-you discern ( for [your]1278-you lamp is not extinguished ) one part of the hanging more violently agitated than the rest . Unable of course to repress [your]1278-you curiosity in so favourable a moment for indulging it , [you]1278-you will instantly arise , and throwing [your]1278-you dressing - gown around [you]1278-you , proceed to examine this mystery . After a very short search , [you]1278-you will discover a division in the tapestry so artfully constructed as to defy the minutest inspection , and on opening it , a door will immediately appear — which door , being only secured by massy bars and a padlock , [you]1278-you will , after a few efforts , succeed in opening — and , with [your]1278-you lamp in [your]1278-you hand , will pass through it into [a small vaulted room]3119-a small vaulted room . ”[1278-you]

“ No , indeed ; [I]92-henry should be too much frightened to do any such thing . ”[92-henry]

“ What ! not when [Dorothy]161-dorothy has given [you]1278-you to understand that there is a secret subterraneous communication between [[your]1278-you apartment]3113-your apartment and [the chapel of St. Anthony]3121-the chapel of st. anthony , scarcely two miles off . Could [you]1278-you shrink from so simple an adventure ? No , no , [you]1278-you will proceed into [this small vaulted room]3122-this small vaulted room , and through this into several others , without perceiving anything very remarkable in either . In one perhaps there may be a dagger , in another a few drops of blood , and in a third the remains of some instrument of torture ; but there being nothing in all this out of the common way , and [your]1278-you lamp being nearly exhausted , [you]1278-you will return towards [[your]1278-you own apartment]3123-your own apartment . In repassing through [the small vaulted room]3124-the small vaulted room , however , [your]1278-you eyes will be attracted towards a large , old - fashioned cabinet of ebony and gold , which , though narrowly examining the furniture before , [you]1278-you had passed unnoticed . Impelled by an irresistible presentiment , [you]1278-you will eagerly advance to [it]3119-a small vaulted room , unlock [its]3119-a small vaulted room folding doors , and search into every drawer — but for some time without discovering anything of importance — perhaps nothing but a considerable hoard of diamonds . At last , however , by touching a secret spring , an inner compartment will open — a roll of paper appears — [you]1278-you seize it — it contains many sheets of manuscript — [you]1278-you hasten with the precious treasure into [[your]1278-you own chamber]3125-your own chamber , but scarcely have [you]1278-you been able to decipher ‘ Oh [thou]3126-thou , whomsoever [thou]3126-thou mayst be , into whose hands these memoirs of [the wretched Matilda]3127-the wretched matilda may fall’—when [your]1278-you lamp suddenly expires in the socket , and leaves [you]1278-you in total darkness . ”[1278-you]

“ Oh , no , no ; do not say so . Well , go on . ”[92-henry]

But [Henry]92-henry was too much amused by the interest [he]92-henry had raised to be able to carry it farther ; [he]92-henry could no longer command solemnity either of subject or voice , and was obliged to entreat [her]1279-her to use [her]1279-her own fancy in the perusal of [Matilda]162-matilda ’s woes . [Catherine]73-catherine , recollecting [herself]73-catherine , grew ashamed of [her]1279-her eagerness , and began earnestly to assure [him]92-henry that [her]1279-her attention had been fixed without the smallest apprehension of really meeting with what [he]92-henry related . “ [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , [she]1279-her was sure , would never put [her]1279-her into such a chamber as [he]92-henry had described ! [she]1279-her was not at all afraid . ”[73-catherine]

As [they]1280-they drew near the end of [their]1280-they journey , [her]1279-her impatience for a sight of [the abbey]3091-the abbey — for some time suspended by [his]92-henry conversation on subjects very different — returned in full force , and every bend in [the road]2554-the road was expected with solemn awe to afford a glimpse of [its]3091-the abbey massy walls of grey stone , rising amidst a grove of ancient oaks , with the last beams of the sun playing in beautiful splendour on [its]3091-the abbey high Gothic windows . But so low did [the building]1283-the building stand , that [she]1279-her found [herself]1279-her passing through the great gates of [the lodge]1284-the lodge into [the very grounds of [Northanger]60-northanger]1285-the very grounds of northanger , without having discerned even an antique chimney .

[She]1279-her knew not that [she]1279-her had any right to be surprised , but there was a something in this mode of approach which [she]1279-her certainly had not expected . To pass between [lodges of a modern appearance]1286-lodges of a modern appearance , to find [herself]1279-her with such ease in [the very precincts of [the abbey]3091-the abbey]1287-the very precincts of the abbey , and driven so rapidly along [a smooth , level road of fine gravel]1289-a smooth , level road of fine gravel , without obstacle , alarm , or solemnity of any kind , struck [her]1279-her as odd and inconsistent . [She]1279-her was not long at leisure , however , for such considerations . A sudden scud of rain , driving full in [her]1279-her face , made it impossible for [her]1279-her to observe anything further , and fixed all [her]1279-her thoughts on the welfare of [her]1279-her new straw bonnet ; and [she]1279-her was actually under the abbey walls , was springing , with [Henry]92-henry ’s assistance , from [the carriage]558-the carriage , was beneath the shelter of [the old porch]1291-the old porch , and had even passed on to [the hall]1292-the hall , where [[her]1279-her friend]305-her friend and [the General]800-the general were waiting to welcome [her]1279-her , without feeling one awful foreboding of future misery to [herself]1279-her , or one moment ’s suspicion of any past scenes of horror being acted within the solemn edifice . The breeze had not seemed to waft the sighs of the murdered to [her]1279-her ; it had wafted nothing worse than a thick mizzling rain ; and having given a good shake to [her]1279-her habit , [she]1279-her was ready to be shown into [the common drawing - room]1295-the common drawing - room , and capable of considering where [she]1279-her was .

[An abbey]1157-an abbey ! yes , it was delightful to be really in [an abbey]1157-an abbey ! but [she]1279-her doubted , as [she]1279-her looked round [the room]301-the room , whether anything within [her]1279-her observation would have given [her]1279-her the consciousness . The furniture was in all the profusion and elegance of modern taste . The fireplace , where [she]1279-her had expected the ample width and ponderous carving of former times , was contracted to a Rumford , with slabs of plain though handsome marble , and ornaments over [it]1299-it of the prettiest English china . The windows , to which [she]1279-her looked with peculiar dependence , from having heard [the General]800-the general talk of [his]800-the general preserving [them]1301-them in [their]1301-them Gothic form with reverential care , were yet less what [her]1279-her fancy had portrayed . To be sure , the pointed arch was preserved — the form of them was Gothic — they might be even casements — but every pane was so large , so clear , so light ! to an imagination which had hoped for the smallest divisions , and the heaviest stone - work , for painted glass , dirt , and cobwebs , the difference was very distressing .

[The General]800-the general , perceiving how [her]1279-her eye was employed , began to talk of the smallness of [the room]301-the room and simplicity of the furniture , where everything , being for daily use , pretended only to comfort , etc . ; flattering [himself]800-the general , however , that there were [some apartments in [the Abbey]3091-the abbey]1304-some apartments in the abbey not unworthy [her]1279-her notice — and was proceeding to mention the costly gilding of one in particular , when , taking out [his]800-the general watch , [he]800-the general stopped short to pronounce it with surprise within twenty minutes of five ! this seemed the word of separation , and [Catherine]73-catherine found [herself]73-catherine hurried away by [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney in such a manner as convinced [her]1279-her that the strictest punctuality to the family hours would be expected at [Northanger]60-northanger .

Returning through [the large and lofty hall]1306-the large and lofty hall , [they]1307-they ascended [a broad staircase of shining oak]1308-a broad staircase of shining oak , which , after many flights and many landing - places , brought [them]1307-they upon a long , wide gallery . On one side [it]1309-it had a range of doors , and [it]1309-it was lighted on the other by windows which [Catherine]73-catherine had only time to discover looked into [a quadrangle]1310-a quadrangle , before [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney led the way into [a chamber]1311-a chamber , and scarcely staying to hope [she]1279-her would find [it]1311-a chamber comfortable , left [her]1279-her with an anxious entreaty that [she]1279-her would make as little alteration as possible in [her]1279-her dress .

CHAPTER 21

A moment ’s glance was enough to satisfy [Catherine]73-catherine that [[her]1279-her apartment]1312-her apartment was very unlike [the one which [Henry]92-henry had endeavoured to alarm [her]1279-her by the description of]1313-the one which henry had endeavoured to alarm her by the description of . [It]1312-her apartment was by no means unreasonably large , and contained neither tapestry nor velvet . The walls were papered , the floor was carpeted ; the windows were neither less perfect nor more dim than those of [the drawing - room below]1314-the drawing - room below ; the furniture , though not of the latest fashion , was handsome and comfortable , and the air of [the room]301-the room altogether far from uncheerful . [Her]1279-her heart instantaneously at ease on this point , [she]1279-her resolved to lose no time in particular examination of anything , as [she]1279-her greatly dreaded disobliging [the General]800-the general by any delay . [Her]1279-her habit therefore was thrown off with all possible haste , and [she]1279-her was preparing to unpin the linen package , which the chaise - seat had conveyed for [her]1279-her immediate accommodation , when [her]1279-her eye suddenly fell on a large high chest , standing back in a deep recess on one side of the fireplace . The sight of it made [her]1279-her start ; and , forgetting everything else , [she]1279-her stood gazing on it in motionless wonder , while these thoughts crossed [her]1279-her :

“ This is strange indeed ! [i]1279-her did not expect such a sight as this ! an immense heavy chest ! what can it hold ? Why should it be placed here ? Pushed back too , as if meant to be out of sight ! [i]1279-her will look into it — cost [me]1279-her what it may , [I]1279-her will look into it — and directly too — by daylight . If [I]1279-her stay till evening [my]1279-her candle may go out . ”[1279-her] [She]1279-her advanced and examined it closely : it was of cedar , curiously inlaid with some darker wood , and raised , about a foot from the ground , on a carved stand of the same . The lock was silver , though tarnished from age ; at each end were the imperfect remains of handles also of silver , broken perhaps prematurely by some strange violence ; and , on the centre of the lid , was a mysterious cipher , in the same metal . [Catherine]73-catherine bent over it intently , but without being able to distinguish anything with certainty . [She]1279-her could not , in whatever direction [she]1279-her took it , believe the last letter to be a _ T ; _ and yet that it should be anything else in [that house]1317-that house was a circumstance to raise no common degree of astonishment . If not originally theirs , by what strange events could it have fallen into [the Tilney family]1213-the tilney family ?

[Her]1279-her fearful curiosity was every moment growing greater ; and seizing , with trembling hands , the hasp of the lock , [she]1279-her resolved at all hazards to satisfy [herself]1279-her at least as to its contents . With difficulty , for something seemed to resist [her]1279-her efforts , [she]1279-her raised the lid a few inches ; but at that moment a sudden knocking at the door of [the room]301-the room made [her]1279-her , starting , quit [her]1279-her hold , and the lid closed with alarming violence . [This ill - timed intruder]1320-this ill - timed intruder was [[Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s maid]1321-miss tilney ’s maid , sent by [[her]1321-miss tilney ’s maid mistress]1322-her mistress to be of use to [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ; and though [Catherine]73-catherine immediately dismissed [her]1279-her , it recalled [her]1279-her to the sense of what [she]1279-her ought to be doing , and forced [her]1279-her , in spite of [her]1279-her anxious desire to penetrate this mystery , to proceed in [her]1279-her dressing without further delay . [Her]1279-her progress was not quick , for [her]1279-her thoughts and [her]1279-her eyes were still bent on the object so well calculated to interest and alarm ; and though [she]1279-her dared not waste a moment upon a second attempt , [she]1279-her could not remain many paces from the chest . At length , however , having slipped one arm into [her]1279-her gown , [her]1279-her toilette seemed so nearly finished that the impatience of [her]1279-her curiosity might safely be indulged . One moment surely might be spared ; and , so desperate should be the exertion of [her]1279-her strength , that , unless secured by supernatural means , the lid in one moment should be thrown back . With this spirit [she]1279-her sprang forward , and [her]1279-her confidence did not deceive [her]1279-her . [Her]1279-her resolute effort threw back the lid , and gave to [her]1279-her astonished eyes the view of a white cotton counterpane , properly folded , reposing at one end of the chest in undisputed possession !

[She]1279-her was gazing on it with the first blush of surprise when [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , anxious for [[her]1279-her friend]305-her friend ’s being ready , entered [the room]301-the room , and to the rising shame of having harboured for some minutes an absurd expectation , was then added the shame of being caught in so idle a search . “ That is a curious old chest , is not it ? ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , as [Catherine]73-catherine hastily closed it and turned away to the glass . “ It is impossible to say how many generations it has been [here]280-here . How it came to be first put in [this room]2242-this room [I]90-miss tilney know not , but [I]90-miss tilney have not had it moved , because [I]90-miss tilney thought it might sometimes be of use in holding hats and bonnets . The worst of it is that its weight makes it difficult to open . In that corner , however , it is at least out of the way . ”[90-miss tilney]

[Catherine]73-catherine had no leisure for speech , being at once blushing , tying [her]1279-her gown , and forming wise resolutions with the most violent dispatch . [Miss]1325-miss [Tilney]90-miss tilney gently hinted [her]1279-her fear of being late ; and in half a minute [they]1326-they ran [downstairs]693-downstairs together , in an alarm not wholly unfounded , for [General Tilney]138-general tilney was pacing [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room , [his]138-general tilney watch in [his]138-general tilney hand , and having , on the very instant of [their]1326-they entering , pulled the bell with violence , ordered “ Dinner to be on table _ directly ! _ ”[138-general tilney]

[Catherine]73-catherine trembled at the emphasis with which [he]138-general tilney spoke , and sat pale and breathless , in a most humble mood , concerned for [[his]138-general tilney children]1094-his children , and detesting old chests ; and [the General]800-the general , recovering [his]800-the general politeness as [he]800-the general looked at [her]1279-her , spent the rest of [his]800-the general time in scolding [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter for so foolishly hurrying [[her]1279-her fair friend]473-her fair friend , who was absolutely out of breath from haste , when there was not the least occasion for hurry in [the world]191-the world : but [Catherine]73-catherine could not at all get over the double distress of having involved [[her]1279-her friend]305-her friend in a lecture and been [a great simpleton]1335-a great simpleton [herself]73-catherine , till [they]1326-they were happily seated at the dinner - table , when [the General]800-the general ’s complacent smiles , and a good appetite of [her]1279-her own , restored [her]1279-her to peace . [The dining - parlour]1337-the dining - parlour was [a noble room , suitable in [its]1337-the dining - parlour dimensions to [a much larger drawing - room than the one in common use]1339-a much larger drawing - room than the one in common use , and fitted up in a style of luxury and expense which was almost lost on the unpractised eye of [Catherine]73-catherine , who saw little more than [its]1337-the dining - parlour spaciousness and the number of [[their]1326-they attendants]1340-their attendants]1338-a noble room , suitable in its dimensions to a much larger drawing - room than the one in common use , and fitted up in a style of luxury and expense which was almost lost on the unpractised eye of catherine , who saw little more than its spaciousness and the number of their attendants . Of [the former]596-the former , [she]1279-her spoke aloud [her]1279-her admiration ; and [the General]800-the general , with a very gracious countenance , acknowledged that [it]1337-the dining - parlour was by no means an ill - sized room , and further confessed that , though as careless on such subjects as [most people]1343-most people , [he]800-the general did look upon [a tolerably large eating - room]1344-a tolerably large eating - room as one of the necessaries of life ; [he]800-the general supposed , however , “ that [she]1279-her must have been used to [much better - sized apartments at [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s]3130-much better - sized apartments at mr. allen ’s ? ”[800-the general]

“ No , indeed , ”[73-catherine] was [Catherine]73-catherine ’s honest assurance ; “ [[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s dining - parlour]3131-mr. allen ’s dining - parlour was not more than half as large , ”[73-catherine] and [she]1279-her had never seen so large [a room]3101-a room as this in [her]1279-her life . [The General]800-the general ’s good humour increased . Why , as [he]800-the general _ had _ [such rooms]1347-such rooms , [he]800-the general thought it would be simple not to make use of [them]1347-such rooms ; but , upon [his]800-the general honour , [he]800-the general believed there might be more comfort in [rooms of only half [their]1347-such rooms size]1348-rooms of only half their size . [[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s house]439-mr. allen ’s house , [he]800-the general was sure , must be exactly of the true size for rational happiness .

The evening passed without any further disturbance , and , in the occasional absence of [General Tilney]138-general tilney , with much positive cheerfulness . It was only in [his]800-the general presence that [Catherine]73-catherine felt the smallest fatigue from [her]1279-her journey ; and even then , even in moments of languor or restraint , a sense of general happiness preponderated , and [she]1279-her could think of [[her]1279-her friends]809-her friends in [Bath]5-bath without one wish of being with [them]809-her friends .

The night was stormy ; the wind had been rising at intervals the whole afternoon ; and by the time the party broke up , it blew and rained violently . [Catherine]73-catherine , as [she]1279-her crossed [the hall]1292-the hall , listened to the tempest with sensations of awe ; and , when [she]1279-her heard it rage round a corner of [the ancient building]1180-the ancient building and close with sudden fury a distant door , felt for the first time that [she]1279-her was really in [an abbey]1157-an abbey . Yes , these were characteristic sounds ; they brought to [her]1279-her recollection a countless variety of dreadful situations and horrid scenes , which [such buildings]1354-such buildings had witnessed , and such storms ushered in ; and most heartily did [she]1279-her rejoice in the happier circumstances attending [her]1279-her entrance within walls so solemn ! _ [She]1279-her _ had nothing to dread from [midnight assassins]1355-midnight assassins or drunken gallants . [Henry]92-henry had certainly been only in jest in what [he]92-henry had told [her]1279-her that morning . In [a house so furnished]1356-a house so furnished , and so guarded , [she]1279-her could have nothing to explore or to suffer , and might go to [[her]1279-her bedroom]1357-her bedroom as securely as if [it]1357-her bedroom had been [[her]1279-her own chamber at [Fullerton]3-fullerton]1358-her own chamber at fullerton . Thus wisely fortifying [her]1279-her mind , as [she]1279-her proceeded [upstairs]443-upstairs , [she]1279-her was enabled , especially on perceiving that [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney slept only two doors from [her]1279-her , to enter [[her]1279-her room]1360-her room with a tolerably stout heart ; and [her]1279-her spirits were immediately assisted by the cheerful blaze of a wood fire . “ How much better is this , ”[1279-her] said [she]1279-her , as [she]1279-her walked to the fender—“how much better to find a fire ready lit , than to have to wait shivering in the cold till all [the family]454-the family are in bed , as [so many poor girls]3133-so many poor girls have been obliged to do , and then to have [a faithful old servant]3134-a faithful old servant frightening [one]2201-one by coming in with a faggot ! how glad [I]1279-her am that [Northanger]60-northanger is what it is ! if it had been like [some other places]3136-some other places , [I]1279-her do not know that , in such a night as this , [I]1279-her could have answered for [my]1279-her courage : but now , to be sure , there is nothing to alarm [one]2201-one . ”[1279-her]

[She]1279-her looked round [the room]301-the room . The window curtains seemed in motion . It could be nothing but the violence of the wind penetrating through the divisions of the shutters ; and [she]1279-her stepped boldly forward , carelessly humming a tune , to assure [herself]1279-her of its being so , peeped courageously behind each curtain , saw nothing on either low window seat to scare [her]1279-her , and on placing a hand against the shutter , felt the strongest conviction of the wind ’s force . A glance at the old chest , as [she]1279-her turned away from this examination , was not without its use ; [she]1279-her scorned the causeless fears of [an idle fancy]1362-an idle fancy , and began with a most happy indifference to prepare [herself]1279-her for bed . “ [She]1279-her should take [her]1279-her time ; [she]1279-her should not hurry [herself]1279-her ; [she]1279-her did not care if [she]1279-her were [the last person up in [the house]211-the house]3138-the last person up in the house . But [she]1279-her would not make up [her]1279-her fire ; _ that _ would seem cowardly , as if [she]1279-her wished for the protection of light after [she]1279-her were in bed . ”[1279-her] The fire therefore died away , and [Catherine]73-catherine , having spent the best part of an hour in [her]1279-her arrangements , was beginning to think of stepping into bed , when , on giving a parting glance round [the room]301-the room , [she]1279-her was struck by the appearance of a high , old - fashioned black cabinet , which , though in a situation conspicuous enough , had never caught [her]1279-her notice before . [Henry]92-henry ’s words , [his]92-henry description of the ebony cabinet which was to escape [her]1279-her observation at first , immediately rushed across [her]1279-her ; and though there could be nothing really in it , there was something whimsical , it was certainly a very remarkable coincidence ! [She]1279-her took [her]1279-her candle and looked closely at the cabinet . It was not absolutely ebony and gold ; but it was japan , black and yellow japan of the handsomest kind ; and as [she]1279-her held [her]1279-her candle , the yellow had very much the effect of gold . The key was in the door , and [she]1279-her had a strange fancy to look into it ; not , however , with the smallest expectation of finding anything , but it was so very odd , after what [Henry]92-henry had said . In short , [she]1279-her could not sleep till [she]1279-her had examined it . So , placing the candle with great caution on a chair , [she]1279-her seized the key with a very tremulous hand and tried to turn it ; but it resisted [her]1279-her utmost strength . Alarmed , but not discouraged , [she]1279-her tried it another way ; a bolt flew , and [she]1279-her believed [herself]1279-her successful ; but how strangely mysterious ! the door was still immovable . [She]1279-her paused a moment in breathless wonder . The wind roared down the chimney , the rain beat in torrents against the windows , and everything seemed to speak the awfulness of [her]1279-her situation . To retire to bed , however , unsatisfied on such a point , would be vain , since sleep must be impossible with the consciousness of a cabinet so mysteriously closed in [her]1279-her immediate vicinity . Again , therefore , [she]1279-her applied [herself]1279-her to the key , and after moving it in every possible way for some instants with the determined celerity of hope ’s last effort , the door suddenly yielded to [her]1279-her hand : [her]1279-her heart leaped with exultation at such a victory , and having thrown open each folding door , the second being secured only by bolts of less wonderful construction than the lock , though in that [her]1279-her eye could not discern anything unusual , a double range of small drawers appeared in view , with some larger drawers above and below them ; and in the centre , a small door , closed also with a lock and key , secured in all probability a cavity of importance .

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s heart beat quick , but [her]1279-her courage did not fail [her]1279-her . With a cheek flushed by hope , and an eye straining with curiosity , [her]1279-her fingers grasped the handle of a drawer and drew it forth . It was entirely empty . With less alarm and greater eagerness [she]1279-her seized a second , a third , a fourth ; each was equally empty . Not one was left unsearched , and in not one was anything found . Well read in the art of concealing [a treasure]1364-a treasure , the possibility of false linings to the drawers did not escape [her]1279-her , and [she]1279-her felt round each with anxious acuteness in vain . The place in the middle alone remained now unexplored ; and though [she]1279-her had “ never from the first had the smallest idea of finding anything in any part of the cabinet , and was not in the least disappointed at [her]1279-her ill success thus far , it would be foolish not to examine it thoroughly while [she]1279-her was about it . ”[1279-her] It was some time however before [she]1279-her could unfasten the door , the same difficulty occurring in the management of this inner lock as of the outer ; but at length it did open ; and not vain , as hitherto , was [her]1279-her search ; [her]1279-her quick eyes directly fell on a roll of paper pushed back into the further part of the cavity , apparently for concealment , and [her]1279-her feelings at that moment were indescribable . [Her]1279-her heart fluttered , [her]1279-her knees trembled , and [her]1279-her cheeks grew pale . [She]1279-her seized , with an unsteady hand , the precious manuscript , for half a glance sufficed to ascertain written characters ; and while [she]1279-her acknowledged with awful sensations this striking exemplification of what [Henry]92-henry had foretold , resolved instantly to peruse every line before [she]1279-her attempted to rest .

The dimness of the light [her]1279-her candle emitted made [her]1279-her turn to it with alarm ; but there was no danger of its sudden extinction ; it had yet some hours to burn ; and that [she]1279-her might not have any greater difficulty in distinguishing the writing than what its ancient date might occasion , [she]1279-her hastily snuffed it . Alas ! it was snuffed and extinguished in one . A lamp could not have expired with more awful effect . [Catherine]73-catherine , for a few moments , was motionless with horror . It was done completely ; not a remnant of light in the wick could give hope to the rekindling breath . Darkness impenetrable and immovable filled [the room]301-the room . A violent gust of wind , rising with sudden fury , added fresh horror to the moment . [Catherine]73-catherine trembled from head to foot . In the pause which succeeded , a sound like receding footsteps and the closing of a distant door struck on [her]1279-her affrighted ear . Human nature could support no more . A cold sweat stood on [her]1279-her forehead , the manuscript fell from [her]1279-her hand , and groping [her]1279-her way to the bed , [she]1279-her jumped hastily in , and sought some suspension of agony by creeping far underneath the clothes . To close [her]1279-her eyes in sleep that night , [she]1279-her felt must be entirely out of the question . With a curiosity so justly awakened , and feelings in every way so agitated , repose must be absolutely impossible . The storm too abroad so dreadful ! [she]1279-her had not been used to feel alarm from wind , but now every blast seemed fraught with awful intelligence . The manuscript so wonderfully found , so wonderfully accomplishing the morning ’s prediction , how was it to be accounted for ? What could it contain ? To whom could it relate ? By what means could it have been so long concealed ? And how singularly strange that it should fall to [her]1279-her lot to discover it ! till [she]1279-her had made [herself]1279-her mistress of its contents , however , [she]1279-her could have neither repose nor comfort ; and with the sun ’s first rays [she]1279-her was determined to peruse it . But many were the tedious hours which must yet intervene . [She]1279-her shuddered , tossed about in [her]1279-her bed , and envied every quiet sleeper . The storm still raged , and various were the noises , more terrific even than the wind , which struck at intervals on [her]1279-her startled ear . The very curtains of [her]1279-her bed seemed at one moment in motion , and at another the lock of [her]1279-her door was agitated , as if by the attempt of [somebody to enter]1366-somebody to enter . Hollow murmurs seemed to creep along [the gallery]1367-the gallery , and more than once [her]1279-her blood was chilled by the sound of distant moans . Hour after hour passed away , and the wearied [Catherine]73-catherine had heard three proclaimed by all the clocks in [the house]211-the house before the tempest subsided or [she]1279-her unknowingly fell fast asleep .

CHAPTER 22

[The housemaid]1369-the housemaid ’s folding back [her]1369-the housemaid window - shutters at eight o’clock the next day was the sound which first roused [Catherine]73-catherine ; and [she]1279-her opened [her]1279-her eyes , wondering that they could ever have been closed , on objects of cheerfulness ; [her]1369-the housemaid fire was already burning , and a bright morning had succeeded the tempest of the night . Instantaneously , with the consciousness of existence , returned [her]1279-her recollection of the manuscript ; and springing from the bed in the very moment of [the maid]1370-the maid ’s going away , [she]1279-her eagerly collected every scattered sheet which had burst from the roll on its falling to the ground , and flew back to enjoy the luxury of their perusal on [her]1279-her pillow . [She]1279-her now plainly saw that [she]1279-her must not expect a manuscript of equal length with the generality of what [she]1279-her had shuddered over in books , for the roll , seeming to consist entirely of small disjointed sheets , was altogether but of trifling size , and much less than [she]1279-her had supposed it to be at first .

[Her]1279-her greedy eye glanced rapidly over a page . [She]1279-her started at its import . Could it be possible , or did not [her]1279-her senses play [her]1279-her false ? An inventory of linen , in coarse and modern characters , seemed all that was before [her]1279-her ! if the evidence of sight might be trusted , [she]1279-her held a washing - bill in [her]1279-her hand . [She]1279-her seized another sheet , and saw the same articles with little variation ; a third , a fourth , and a fifth presented nothing new . Shirts , stockings , cravats , and waistcoats faced [her]1279-her in each . [Two others , penned by the same hand]1371-two others , penned by the same hand , marked an expenditure scarcely more interesting , in letters , hair - powder , shoe - string , and breeches - ball . And the larger sheet , which had enclosed the rest , seemed by its first cramp line , “ To poultice chestnut mare”—a[1371-two others , penned by the same hand] farrier ’s bill ! such was the collection of papers ( left perhaps , as [she]1279-her could then suppose , by the negligence of a servant in the place whence [she]1279-her had taken them ) which had filled [her]1279-her with expectation and alarm , and robbed [her]1279-her of half [her]1279-her night ’s rest ! [she]1279-her felt humbled to the dust . Could not the adventure of the chest have taught [her]1279-her wisdom ? A corner of it , catching [her]1279-her eye as [she]1279-her lay , seemed to rise up in judgment against [her]1279-her . Nothing could now be clearer than the absurdity of [her]1279-her recent fancies . To suppose that a manuscript of many generations back could have remained undiscovered in [a room such as that]1372-a room such as that , so modern , so habitable!—Or that [she]1279-her should be the first to possess the skill of unlocking a cabinet , the key of which was open to all !

How could [she]1279-her have so imposed on [herself]1279-her ? Heaven forbid that [Henry Tilney]92-henry should ever know [her]1279-her folly ! and it was in a great measure [his]92-henry own doing , for had not the cabinet appeared so exactly to agree with [his]92-henry description of [her]1279-her adventures , [she]1279-her should never have felt the smallest curiosity about it . This was the only comfort that occurred . Impatient to get rid of those hateful evidences of [her]1279-her folly , those detestable papers then scattered over the bed , [she]1279-her rose directly , and folding them up as nearly as possible in the same shape as before , returned them to [the same spot within the cabinet]1373-the same spot within the cabinet , with a very hearty wish that no untoward accident might ever bring them forward again , to disgrace [her]1279-her even with [herself]1279-her .

Why the locks should have been so difficult to open , however , was still something remarkable , for [she]1279-her could now manage them with perfect ease . In this there was surely something mysterious , and [she]1279-her indulged in the flattering suggestion for half a minute , till the possibility of the door ’s having been at first unlocked , and of being [herself]1279-her its fastener , darted into [her]1279-her head , and cost [her]1279-her another blush .

[She]1279-her got away as soon as [she]1279-her could from [a room in which [her]1279-her conduct produced such unpleasant reflections]1374-a room in which her conduct produced such unpleasant reflections , and found [her]1279-her way with all speed to [the breakfast - parlour]1375-the breakfast - parlour , as it had been pointed out to [her]1279-her by [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney the evening before . [Henry]92-henry was alone in [it]1375-the breakfast - parlour ; and [his]92-henry immediate hope of [her]1279-her having been undisturbed by the tempest , with an arch reference to the character of [the building]1283-the building [they]1377-they inhabited , was rather distressing . For [the world]191-the world would [she]1279-her not have [her]1279-her weakness suspected , and yet , unequal to an absolute falsehood , was constrained to acknowledge that the wind had kept [her]1279-her awake a little . “ But [we]1377-they have a charming morning after it , ”[1279-her] [she]1279-her added , desiring to get rid of the subject ; “ and storms and sleeplessness are nothing when they are over . What beautiful hyacinths ! [i]1279-her have just learnt to love a hyacinth . ”[1279-her]

“ And how might [you]1279-her learn ? By accident or argument ? ”[1279-her]

“ [[Your]1279-her sister]2261-your sister taught [me]1279-her ; [I]1279-her can not tell how . [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen used to take pains , year after year , to make [me]1279-her like them ; but [I]1279-her never could , till [I]1279-her saw [them]3141-them the other day in [Milsom Street]14-milsom street ; [I]1279-her am naturally indifferent about flowers . ”[1279-her]

“ But now [you]1279-her love a hyacinth . So much the better . [You]1279-her have gained a new source of enjoyment , and it is well to have as many holds upon happiness as possible . Besides , a taste for flowers is always desirable in [your]1279-her sex , as a means of getting [you]1279-her out of doors , and tempting [you]1279-her to more frequent exercise than [you]1279-her would otherwise take . And though the love of [a hyacinth]3142-a hyacinth may be rather domestic , who can tell , the sentiment once raised , but [you]1279-her may in time come to love a rose ? ”[1279-her]

“ But [I]1279-her do not want any such pursuit to get [me]1279-her out of doors . The pleasure of walking and breathing fresh air is enough for [me]1279-her , and in fine weather [I]1279-her am out more than half [my]1279-her time . [Mamma]137-mamma says [I]1279-her am never within . ”[1279-her]

“ At any rate , however , [I]1279-her am pleased that [you]1279-her have learnt to love [a hyacinth]3142-a hyacinth . The mere habit of learning to love is the thing ; and a teachableness of disposition in [a young lady]241-a young lady is a great blessing . Has [[my]1279-her sister]2258-my sister a pleasant mode of instruction ? ”[1279-her]

[Catherine]73-catherine was saved the embarrassment of attempting an answer by the entrance of [the General , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind]1379-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind , but whose gentle hint of sympathetic early rising did not advance [her]1379-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind composure .

The elegance of the breakfast set forced itself on [Catherine]73-catherine ’s notice when [they]1380-they were seated at table ; and , luckily , it had been [the General]800-the general ’s choice . [He]800-the general was enchanted by [her]1379-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind approbation of [his]800-the general taste , confessed it to be neat and simple , thought it right to encourage the manufacture of [his]800-the general country ; and for [his]800-the general part , to [his]800-the general uncritical palate , the tea was as well flavoured from the clay of [Staffordshire]63-staffordshire , as from that of [Dresden]163-dresden or [Sêve]164-sêve . But this was quite an old set , purchased two years ago . The manufacture was much improved since that time ; [he]800-the general had seen some beautiful specimens when last in [town]2354-town , and had [he]800-the general not been perfectly without vanity of that kind , might have been tempted to order a new set . [He]800-the general trusted , however , that an opportunity might ere long occur of selecting one — though not for [himself]800-the general . [Catherine]73-catherine was probably [the only one of [the party who did not understand [him]800-the general]1384-the party who did not understand him]1383-the only one of the party who did not understand him .

Shortly after breakfast [Henry]92-henry left [them]1385-them for [Woodston]62-woodston , where business required and would keep [him]800-the general two or three days . [They]1385-them all attended in [the hall]1292-the hall to see [him]800-the general mount [his]800-the general horse , and immediately on re - entering [the breakfast - room]1387-the breakfast - room , [Catherine]73-catherine walked to a window in the hope of catching another glimpse of [his]800-the general figure . “ This is a somewhat heavy call upon [[your]142-eleanor brother]2395-your brother ’s fortitude , ”[800-the general] observed [the General]800-the general to [Eleanor]142-eleanor . “ [Woodston]62-woodston will make but a sombre appearance to - day . ”[800-the general]

“ Is [it]62-woodston [a pretty place]3147-a pretty place ? ”[73-catherine] asked [Catherine]73-catherine .

“ What say [you]142-eleanor , [Eleanor]142-eleanor ? Speak [your]142-eleanor opinion , for [ladies]2246-ladies can best tell the taste of [ladies]2246-ladies in regard to places as well as [men]2253-men . [I]800-the general think it would be acknowledged by [the most impartial eye]3151-the most impartial eye to have many recommendations . [The house]211-the house stands among [fine meadows facing the south - east]3153-fine meadows facing the south - east , with an excellent [kitchen - garden in the same aspect]3154-kitchen - garden in the same aspect ; the walls surrounding which [I]800-the general built and stocked [myself]800-the general about ten years ago , for the benefit of [[my]800-the general son]3155-my son . It is a family living , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ; and [the property in [the place]2220-the place]3156-the property in the place being chiefly [my]800-the general own , [you]142-eleanor may believe [I]800-the general take care that it shall not be a bad one . Did [Henry]92-henry ’s income depend solely on this living , [he]92-henry would not be ill - provided for . Perhaps it may seem odd , that with [only two younger children]3158-only two younger children , [I]800-the general should think any profession necessary for [him]92-henry ; and certainly there are moments when [we]3159-we could all wish [him]92-henry disengaged from every tie of business . But though [I]800-the general may not exactly make converts of [[you]142-eleanor young ladies]3160-you young ladies , [I]800-the general am sure [[your]142-eleanor father]2706-your father , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , would agree with [me]800-the general in thinking it expedient to give [every young man]3162-every young man some employment . The money is nothing , it is not an object , but employment is the thing .
