Even [Frederick]74-captain tilney , [[my]800-the general eldest son]3163-my eldest son , [you]142-eleanor see , who will perhaps inherit as considerable a landed property as [any private man in [the county]3165-the county]3164-any private man in the county , has [his]74-captain tilney profession . ”[800-the general]

The imposing effect of this last argument was equal to [his]1389-his wishes . The silence of [the lady]378-the lady proved it to be unanswerable .

Something had been said the evening before of [her]378-the lady being shown over [the house]211-the house , and [he]1389-his now offered [himself]1389-his as [[her]378-the lady conductor]1392-her conductor ; and though [Catherine]73-catherine had hoped to explore [it]211-the house accompanied only by [[his]73-catherine daughter]2509-his daughter , it was a proposal of too much happiness in itself , under any circumstances , not to be gladly accepted ; for [she]2509-his daughter had been already eighteen hours in [the abbey]3091-the abbey , and had seen only [a few of [[its]3091-the abbey rooms]1396-its rooms]1395-a few of its rooms . The netting - box , just leisurely drawn forth , was closed with joyful haste , and [she]2509-his daughter was ready to attend [him]73-catherine in a moment . “ And when [they]3166-they had gone over [the house]211-the house , [he]73-catherine promised [himself]73-catherine moreover the pleasure of accompanying [her]2509-his daughter into [the shrubberies]3168-the shrubberies and [garden]3169-garden . ”[2509-his daughter] [She]2509-his daughter curtsied [her]2509-his daughter acquiescence . “ But perhaps it might be more agreeable to [her]2509-his daughter to make those [her]2509-his daughter first object . The weather was at present favourable , and at this time of year the uncertainty was very great of its continuing so . Which would [she]2509-his daughter prefer ? [He]73-catherine was equally at [her]2509-his daughter service . Which did [[his]73-catherine daughter]2509-his daughter think would most accord with [[her]2509-his daughter fair friend]473-her fair friend ’s wishes ? But [he]73-catherine thought [he]73-catherine could discern . Yes , [he]73-catherine certainly read in [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s eyes a judicious desire of making use of the present smiling weather . But when did [she]2509-his daughter judge amiss ? [The abbey]3091-the abbey would be always safe and dry . [He]73-catherine yielded implicitly , and would fetch [his]73-catherine hat and attend [them]1400-them in a moment . ”[1397-he] [He]1397-he left [the room]301-the room , and [Catherine]73-catherine , with a disappointed , anxious face , began to speak of [her]1399-her unwillingness that [he]1397-he should be taking [them]1400-them out of [doors]1401-doors against [his]1397-he own inclination , under a mistaken idea of pleasing [her]1399-her ; but [she]1399-her was stopped by [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s saying , with a little confusion , “ [I]90-miss tilney believe it will be wisest to take the morning while it is so fine ; and do not be uneasy on [[my]90-miss tilney father]2538-my father ’s account ; [he]1397-he always walks out at this time of day . ”[90-miss tilney]

[Catherine]73-catherine did not exactly know how this was to be understood . Why was [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney embarrassed ? Could there be any unwillingness on [the General]800-the general ’s side to show [her]1399-her over [the abbey]3091-the abbey ? The proposal was [his]1397-he own . And was not it odd that [he]1397-he should _ always _ take [his]1397-he walk so early ? Neither [[her]1399-her father]182-her father nor [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen did so . It was certainly very provoking . [She]1399-her was all impatience to see [the house]211-the house , and had scarcely any curiosity about [the grounds]1406-the grounds . If [Henry]92-henry had been with [them]1407-them indeed ! But now [she]1399-her should not know what was picturesque when [she]1399-her saw it . Such were [her]1399-her thoughts , but [she]1399-her kept them to [herself]1399-her , and put on [her]1399-her bonnet in patient discontent .

[She]1399-her was struck , however , beyond [her]1399-her expectation , by the grandeur of [the abbey]3091-the abbey , as [she]1399-her saw [it]3091-the abbey for the first time from [the lawn]1409-the lawn . [The whole building]1410-the whole building enclosed [a large court]1411-a large court ; and two sides of [the quadrangle]1412-the quadrangle , rich in Gothic ornaments , stood forward for admiration . [The remainder]339-the remainder was shut off by knolls of old trees , or [luxuriant plantations]1414-luxuriant plantations , and [the steep woody hills rising behind]1415-the steep woody hills rising behind , to give [it]3091-the abbey shelter , were beautiful even in the leafless month of March . [Catherine]73-catherine had seen nothing to compare with it ; and [her]1399-her feelings of delight were so strong , that without waiting for any better authority , [she]1399-her boldly burst forth in wonder and praise . [The General]800-the general listened with assenting gratitude ; and it seemed as if [his]800-the general own estimation of [Northanger]60-northanger had waited unfixed till that hour .

[The kitchen - garden]1417-the kitchen - garden was to be next admired , and [he]800-the general led the way to [it]1417-the kitchen - garden across [a small portion of [the park]1419-the park]1418-a small portion of the park .

The number of acres contained in [this garden]1420-this garden was such as [Catherine]73-catherine could not listen to without dismay , being more than double the extent of all [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s , as well as [[her]1399-her father]182-her father ’s , including [church - yard]1422-church - yard and [orchard]1423-orchard . The walls seemed countless in number , endless in length ; [a village of [hot - houses]1425-hot - houses]1424-a village of hot - houses seemed to arise among [them]1426-them , and [a whole parish]1427-a whole parish to be at work within [the enclosure]1428-the enclosure . [The General]800-the general was flattered by [her]1399-her looks of surprise , which told [him]800-the general almost as plainly , as [he]800-the general soon forced [her]1399-her to tell [him]800-the general in words , that [she]1399-her had never seen [any gardens]1430-any gardens at all equal to [them]1430-any gardens before ; and [he]800-the general then modestly owned that , “ without any ambition of that sort [himself]800-the general — without any solicitude about it — [he]800-the general did believe [them]1430-any gardens to be unrivalled in [the kingdom]2656-the kingdom . If [he]800-the general had a hobby - horse , it was _ that _ . [He]800-the general loved [a garden]197-a garden . Though careless enough in most matters of eating , [he]800-the general loved good fruit — or if [he]800-the general did not , [[his]800-the general friends]3176-his friends and [children]240-children did . There were great vexations , however , attending [such a garden as [his]800-the general]3178-such a garden as his . The utmost care could not always secure the most valuable fruits . [The pinery]3179-the pinery had yielded only one hundred in the last year . [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen , [he]83-mr. allen supposed , must feel these inconveniences as well as [himself]83-mr. allen . ”[800-the general]

“ No , not at all . [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen did not care about [the garden]3180-the garden , and never went into it . ”[800-the general]

With a triumphant smile of self - satisfaction , [the General]800-the general wished [he]800-the general could do the same , for [he]800-the general never entered [his]800-the general , without being vexed in some way or other , by its falling short of [his]800-the general plan .

“ How were [[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s succession - houses]3181-mr. allen ’s succession - houses worked ? ”[800-the general] describing the nature of [his]800-the general own as [they]1432-them entered [them]1433-them .

“ [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen had only [one small hot - house , which [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen had the use of for [her]1435-her plants]3182-one small hot - house , which mrs. allen had the use of for her plants in winter , and there was a fire in [it]3182-one small hot - house , which mrs. allen had the use of for her plants now and then . ”[800-the general]

“ [He]800-the general is [a happy man]3183-a happy man ! ”[800-the general] said [the General]800-the general , with a look of very happy contempt .

Having taken [her]1435-her into every division , and led [her]1435-her under every wall , till [she]1435-her was heartily weary of seeing and wondering , [he]800-the general suffered [the girls]1436-the girls at last to seize the advantage of an outer door , and then expressing [his]800-the general wish to examine the effect of some recent alterations about [the tea - house]1437-the tea - house , proposed it as no unpleasant extension of [their]1432-them walk , if [Miss Morland]84-miss morland were not tired . “ But where are [you]73-catherine going , [Eleanor]142-eleanor ? Why do [you]73-catherine choose [that cold , damp path to it]3184-that cold , damp path to it ? [Miss Morland]84-miss morland will get wet . [Our]1432-them best way is across [the park]1419-the park . ”[84-miss morland]

“ This is so favourite a walk of mine , ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , “ that [I]90-miss tilney always think it the best and nearest way . But perhaps it may be damp . ”[90-miss tilney]

It was [a narrow winding path through a thick grove of old Scotch firs]1438-a narrow winding path through a thick grove of old scotch firs ; and [Catherine]73-catherine , struck by its gloomy aspect , and eager to enter [it]1437-the tea - house , could not , even by [the General]800-the general ’s disapprobation , be kept from stepping forward . [He]800-the general perceived [her]84-miss morland inclination , and having again urged the plea of health in vain , was too polite to make further opposition . [He]800-the general excused [himself]800-the general , however , from attending [them]1432-them : “ The rays of the sun were not too cheerful for [him]800-the general , and [he]800-the general would meet [them]1432-them by another course . ”[800-the general] [He]800-the general turned away ; and [Catherine]73-catherine was shocked to find how much [her]84-miss morland spirits were relieved by the separation . The shock , however , being less real than the relief , offered it no injury ; and [she]84-miss morland began to talk with easy gaiety of the delightful melancholy which such a grove inspired .

“ [I]569-her companion am particularly fond of [this spot]3186-this spot , ”[569-her companion] said [[her]84-miss morland companion]569-her companion , with a sigh . “ It was [[my]569-her companion mother]2518-my mother ’s favourite walk . ”[569-her companion]

[Catherine]73-catherine had never heard [Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney mentioned in [the family]454-the family before , and the interest excited by this tender remembrance showed itself directly in [her]84-miss morland altered countenance , and in the attentive pause with which [she]84-miss morland waited for something more .

“ [I]142-eleanor used to walk [here]280-here so often with [her]128-mrs. tilney ! ”[142-eleanor] added [Eleanor]142-eleanor ; “ though [I]142-eleanor never loved it then , as [I]142-eleanor have loved it since . At that time indeed [I]142-eleanor used to wonder at [her]128-mrs. tilney choice . But [her]128-mrs. tilney memory endears it now . ”[142-eleanor]

“ And ought it not , ”[73-catherine] reflected [Catherine]73-catherine , “ to endear it to [[her]128-mrs. tilney husband]810-her husband ? Yet [the General]800-the general would not enter it . ”[73-catherine] [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney continuing silent , [she]84-miss morland ventured to say , “ [Her]128-mrs. tilney death must have been a great affliction ! ”[84-miss morland]

“ A great and increasing one , ”[412-the other] replied [the other]412-the other , in a low voice . “ [I]84-miss morland was only thirteen when it happened ; and though [I]84-miss morland felt [my]84-miss morland loss perhaps as strongly as [one so young]3191-one so young could feel it , [I]84-miss morland did not , [I]84-miss morland could not , then know what a loss it was . ”[84-miss morland] [She]84-miss morland stopped for a moment , and then added , with great firmness , “ [I]84-miss morland have [no sister]3192-no sister , [you]3193-you know — and though [Henry]92-henry — though [[my]84-miss morland brothers]3194-my brothers are very affectionate , and [Henry]92-henry is a great deal here , which [I]84-miss morland am most thankful for , it is impossible for [me]84-miss morland not to be often solitary . ”[84-miss morland]

“ To be sure [you]3193-you must miss [him]92-henry very much . ”[84-miss morland]

“ [A mother]2757-a mother would have been always present . [A mother]2757-a mother would have been [a constant friend]3197-a constant friend ; [her]2757-a mother influence would have been beyond all other . ”[84-miss morland]

“ Was [she]2757-a mother [a very charming woman]3198-a very charming woman ? Was [she]2757-a mother handsome ? Was there any picture of [her]2757-a mother in [the abbey]3091-the abbey ? And why had [she]2757-a mother been so partial to [that grove]3200-that grove ? Was it from dejection of spirits?”—were[84-miss morland] questions now eagerly poured forth ; the first three received a ready affirmative , [the two others]691-the two others were passed by ; and [Catherine]73-catherine ’s interest in [the deceased Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney augmented with every question , whether answered or not . Of [her]128-mrs. tilney unhappiness in marriage , [she]128-mrs. tilney felt persuaded . [The General]800-the general certainly had been [an unkind husband]1445-an unkind husband . [He]800-the general did not love [her]128-mrs. tilney walk : could [he]800-the general therefore have loved [her]128-mrs. tilney ? And besides , handsome as [he]800-the general was , there was a something in the turn of [his]800-the general features which spoke [his]800-the general not having behaved well to [her]128-mrs. tilney .

“ [Her]2757-a mother picture , [I]800-the general suppose , ”[800-the general] blushing at the consummate art of [her]128-mrs. tilney own question , “ hangs in [[[your]800-the general father]2706-your father ’s room]3202-your father ’s room ? ”[800-the general]

“ No ; it was intended for [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room ; but [[my]800-the general father]2538-my father was dissatisfied with the painting , and for some time it had no place . Soon after [her]2757-a mother death [I]800-the general obtained it for [my]800-the general own , and hung it in [[my]800-the general bed - chamber]3205-my bed - chamber — where [I]800-the general shall be happy to show it [you]73-catherine ; it is very like . ”[800-the general] Here was another proof . A portrait — very like — of [a departed wife]1446-a departed wife , not valued by [the husband]1447-the husband ! [he]800-the general must have been dreadfully cruel to [her]128-mrs. tilney !

[Catherine]73-catherine attempted no longer to hide from [herself]73-catherine the nature of the feelings which , in spite of all [his]800-the general attentions , [he]800-the general had previously excited ; and what had been terror and dislike before , was now absolute aversion . Yes , aversion ! [his]800-the general cruelty to [such a charming woman]1448-such a charming woman made [him]800-the general odious to [her]128-mrs. tilney . [She]128-mrs. tilney had often read of such characters , characters which [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen had been used to call unnatural and overdrawn ; but here was proof positive of the contrary .

[She]128-mrs. tilney had just settled this point when the end of the path brought [them]1449-them directly upon [the General]800-the general ; and in spite of all [her]128-mrs. tilney virtuous indignation , [she]128-mrs. tilney found [herself]128-mrs. tilney again obliged to walk with [him]800-the general , listen to [him]800-the general , and even to smile when [he]800-the general smiled . Being no longer able , however , to receive pleasure from the surrounding objects , [she]128-mrs. tilney soon began to walk with lassitude ; [the General]800-the general perceived it , and with a concern for [her]128-mrs. tilney health , which seemed to reproach [her]128-mrs. tilney for [her]128-mrs. tilney opinion of [him]800-the general , was most urgent for returning with [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter to [the house]211-the house . [He]800-the general would follow [them]1449-them in a quarter of an hour . Again [they]1449-them parted — but [Eleanor]142-eleanor was called back in half a minute to receive a strict charge against taking [[her]128-mrs. tilney friend]305-her friend round [the abbey]3091-the abbey till [his]800-the general return . This second instance of [his]800-the general anxiety to delay what [she]128-mrs. tilney so much wished for struck [Catherine]73-catherine as very remarkable .

CHAPTER 23

An hour passed away before [the General]800-the general came in , spent , on the part of [[his]800-the general young guest]1457-his young guest , in no very favourable consideration of [his]800-the general character . “ This lengthened absence , these solitary rambles , did not speak a mind at ease , or a conscience void of reproach . ”[800-the general] At length [he]800-the general appeared ; and , whatever might have been the gloom of [his]800-the general meditations , [he]800-the general could still smile with _ [them]1458-them _ . [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , understanding in part [[her]128-mrs. tilney friend]305-her friend ’s curiosity to see [the house]211-the house , soon revived the subject ; and [[her]128-mrs. tilney father]182-her father being , contrary to [Catherine]73-catherine ’s expectations , unprovided with any pretence for further delay , beyond that of stopping five minutes to order refreshments to be in [the room]301-the room by [their]1463-they return , was at last ready to escort [them]1463-they .

[They]1463-they set forward ; and , with a grandeur of air , a dignified step , which caught the eye , but could not shake the doubts of [the well - read Catherine]1464-the well - read catherine , [he]800-the general led the way across [the hall]1292-the hall , through [the common drawing - room]1295-the common drawing - room and [one useless antechamber]1467-one useless antechamber , into [a room magnificent both in size and furniture — [the real drawing - room]1469-the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence]1468-a room magnificent both in size and furniture — the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence . It was very noble — very grand — very charming!—was all that [Catherine]73-catherine had to say , for [her]1464-the well - read catherine indiscriminating eye scarcely discerned the colour of the satin ; and all minuteness of praise , all praise that had much meaning , was supplied by [the General]800-the general : the costliness or elegance of [any room]1471-any room ’s fitting - up could be nothing to [her]1464-the well - read catherine ; [she]1464-the well - read catherine cared for no furniture of a more modern date than the fifteenth century . When [the General]800-the general had satisfied [his]800-the general own curiosity , in a close examination of every well - known ornament , [they]1463-they proceeded into [the library]1473-the library , [an apartment]1474-an apartment , in [its]1473-the library way , of equal magnificence , exhibiting a collection of books , on which [an humble man]1475-an humble man might have looked with pride . [Catherine]73-catherine heard , admired , and wondered with more genuine feeling than before — gathered all that [she]1464-the well - read catherine could from this storehouse of knowledge , by running over the titles of half a shelf , and was ready to proceed . But [suites of apartments]1476-suites of apartments did not spring up with [her]1464-the well - read catherine wishes . Large as was [the building]1283-the building , [she]1464-the well - read catherine had already visited the greatest part ; though , on being told that , with the addition of [the kitchen]1478-the kitchen , [the six or seven rooms]1479-the six or seven rooms [she]1464-the well - read catherine had now seen surrounded three sides of [the court]1480-the court , [she]1464-the well - read catherine could scarcely believe it , or overcome the suspicion of there being [many chambers secreted]1481-many chambers secreted . It was some relief , however , that [they]1463-they were to return to [the rooms]2184-the rooms in common use , by passing through a few of less importance , looking into [the court , which , with occasional passages , not wholly unintricate]1483-the court , which , with occasional passages , not wholly unintricate , connected [the different sides]1484-the different sides ; and [she]1464-the well - read catherine was further soothed in [her]1464-the well - read catherine progress by being told that [she]1464-the well - read catherine was treading what had once been [a cloister]1485-a cloister , having traces of cells pointed out , and observing several doors that were neither opened nor explained to [her]1464-the well - read catherine — by finding [herself]1464-the well - read catherine successively in [a billiard - room]1486-a billiard - room , and in [[the General]800-the general ’s private apartment]1488-the general ’s private apartment , without comprehending [their]1463-they connection , or being able to turn aright when [she]1464-the well - read catherine left [them]1463-they ; and lastly , by passing through [a dark little room]1489-a dark little room , owning [Henry]92-henry ’s authority , and strewed with [his]92-henry litter of books , guns , and greatcoats .

From [the dining - room]1490-the dining - room , of which , though already seen , and always to be seen at five o’clock , [the General]800-the general could not forgo the pleasure of pacing out the length , for the more certain information of [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , as to what [she]84-miss morland neither doubted nor cared for , [they]1492-they proceeded by quick communication to [the kitchen]1478-the kitchen — [the ancient kitchen of [the convent]1495-the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present]1494-the ancient kitchen of the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present . [The General]800-the general ’s improving hand had not loitered [here]280-here : every modern invention to facilitate the labour of [the cooks]1498-the cooks had been adopted within this , [[their]1498-the cooks spacious theatre]1499-their spacious theatre ; and , when the genius of [others]376-others had failed , [his]800-the general own had often produced the perfection wanted . [His]800-the general endowments of this spot alone might at any time have placed [him]800-the general high among [the benefactors of [the convent]1495-the convent]1501-the benefactors of the convent .

With the walls of [the kitchen]1478-the kitchen ended all the antiquity of [the abbey]3091-the abbey ; the fourth side of [the quadrangle]1412-the quadrangle having , on account of [its]3091-the abbey decaying state , been removed by [[the General]800-the general ’s father]1507-the general ’s father , and the present erected in [its]3091-the abbey place . All that was venerable ceased [here]280-here . [The new building]1509-the new building was not only new , but declared itself to be so ; intended only for [offices]1510-offices , and enclosed behind by [stable - yards]1511-stable - yards , no uniformity of architecture had been thought necessary . [Catherine]73-catherine could have raved at the hand which had swept away what must have been beyond the value of all the rest , for the purposes of mere domestic economy ; and would willingly have been spared the mortification of a walk through scenes so fallen , had [the General]800-the general allowed it ; but if [he]800-the general had a vanity , it was in the arrangement of [[his]800-the general offices]1513-his offices ; and as [he]800-the general was convinced that , to a mind like [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s , a view of the accommodations and comforts by which the labours of [[her]84-miss morland inferiors]1514-her inferiors were softened , must always be gratifying , [he]800-the general should make no apology for leading [her]84-miss morland on . [They]1515-they took a slight survey of all ; and [Catherine]73-catherine was impressed , beyond [her]84-miss morland expectation , by [their]1515-they multiplicity and [their]1515-they convenience . The purposes for which a few shapeless pantries and a comfortless scullery were deemed sufficient at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , were here carried on in appropriate divisions , commodious and roomy . The number of [servants]1516-servants continually appearing did not strike [her]84-miss morland less than the number of [[their]1515-they offices]1517-their offices . Wherever [they]1515-they went , [some pattened girl]1518-some pattened girl stopped to curtsy , or [some footman in dishabille]1519-some footman in dishabille sneaked off . Yet this was [an abbey]1157-an abbey ! how inexpressibly different in these domestic arrangements from such as [she]84-miss morland had read about — from [abbeys]1159-abbeys and [castles]1158-castles , in which , though certainly larger than [Northanger]60-northanger , all the dirty work of [the house]211-the house was to be done by [two pair of female hands]1524-two pair of female hands at the utmost . How [they]1515-they could get through it all had often amazed [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen ; and , when [Catherine]73-catherine saw what was necessary [here]280-here , [she]84-miss morland began to be amazed [herself]84-miss morland .

[They]1515-they returned to [the hall]1292-the hall , that the chief staircase might be ascended , and the beauty of [its]1292-the hall wood , and ornaments of rich carving might be pointed out : having gained the top , [they]1515-they turned in an opposite direction from the gallery in which [[her]84-miss morland room]1360-her room lay , and shortly entered one on the same plan , but superior in length and breadth . [She]84-miss morland was here shown successively into [three large bed - chambers]1528-three large bed - chambers , with [[their]1528-three large bed - chambers dressing - rooms]1529-their dressing - rooms , most completely and handsomely fitted up ; everything that money and taste could do , to give comfort and elegance to [apartments]1530-apartments , had been bestowed on these ; and , being furnished within the last five years , [they]1515-they were perfect in all that would be generally pleasing , and wanting in all that could give pleasure to [Catherine]73-catherine . As [they]1515-they were surveying the last , [the General]800-the general , after slightly naming a few of [the distinguished characters by whom [they]1515-they had at times been honoured]1532-the distinguished characters by whom they had at times been honoured , turned with a smiling countenance to [Catherine]73-catherine , and ventured to hope that henceforward [some of [[their]1515-they earliest tenants]1534-their earliest tenants]1533-some of their earliest tenants might be “ [[our]1515-they friends from [Fullerton]3-fullerton]3206-our friends from fullerton . ”[84-miss morland] [She]84-miss morland felt the unexpected compliment , and deeply regretted the impossibility of thinking well of [a man so kindly disposed towards [herself]84-miss morland , and so full of civility to [all [her]84-miss morland family]1536-all her family]1535-a man so kindly disposed towards herself , and so full of civility to all her family .

[The gallery]1367-the gallery was terminated by folding doors , which [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , advancing , had thrown open , and passed through , and seemed on the point of doing the same by the first door to the left , in another long reach of [gallery]1538-gallery , when [the General]800-the general , coming forwards , called [her]84-miss morland hastily , and , as [Catherine]73-catherine thought , rather angrily back , demanding whither [she]84-miss morland were going?—And what was there more to be seen?—Had not [Miss Morland]84-miss morland already seen all that could be worth [her]84-miss morland notice?—And did [she]84-miss morland not suppose [[her]84-miss morland friend]305-her friend might be glad of some refreshment after so much exercise ? [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney drew back directly , and the heavy doors were closed upon [the mortified [Catherine]73-catherine , who , having seen , in a momentary glance beyond [them]1542-them , a narrower passage , more numerous openings , and symptoms of [a winding staircase]1543-a winding staircase]1541-the mortified catherine , who , having seen , in a momentary glance beyond them , a narrower passage , more numerous openings , and symptoms of a winding staircase , believed [herself]73-catherine at last within the reach of something worth [her]84-miss morland notice ; and felt , as [she]84-miss morland unwillingly paced back [the gallery]1367-the gallery , that [she]84-miss morland would rather be allowed to examine that end of [the house]211-the house than see all the finery of all the rest . [The General]800-the general ’s evident desire of preventing such an examination was an additional stimulant . Something was certainly to be concealed ; [her]84-miss morland fancy , though it had trespassed lately once or twice , could not mislead [her]84-miss morland here ; and what that something was , a short sentence of [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s , as [they]1547-they followed [the General]800-the general at some distance [downstairs]693-downstairs , seemed to point out : “ [I]84-miss morland was going to take [you]73-catherine into what was [[[my]84-miss morland mother]2518-my mother ’s room]3208-my mother ’s room — [the room in which [she]2518-my mother died]3209-the room in which she died — ”[84-miss morland] were all [her]84-miss morland words ; but few as they were , they conveyed pages of intelligence to [Catherine]73-catherine . It was no wonder that [the General]800-the general should shrink from the sight of such objects as [that room]1551-that room must contain ; [a room in all probability never entered by [him]800-the general]1552-a room in all probability never entered by him since the dreadful scene had passed , which released [[his]800-the general suffering wife]1553-his suffering wife , and left [him]800-the general to the stings of conscience .

[She]84-miss morland ventured , when next alone with [Eleanor]142-eleanor , to express [her]84-miss morland wish of being permitted to see it , as well as all the rest of [that side of [the house]211-the house]1554-that side of the house ; and [Eleanor]142-eleanor promised to attend [her]84-miss morland [there]2232-there , whenever [they]1557-they should have a convenient hour . [Catherine]73-catherine understood [her]84-miss morland : [the General]800-the general must be watched from [home]2403-home , before [that room]1551-that room could be entered . “ It remains as it was , [I]84-miss morland suppose ? ”[84-miss morland] said [she]84-miss morland , in a tone of feeling .

“ Yes , entirely . ”[84-miss morland]

“ And how long ago may it be that [[your]73-catherine mother]3210-your mother died ? ”[84-miss morland]

“ [She]3210-your mother has been dead these nine years . ”[84-miss morland] And nine years , [Catherine]73-catherine knew , was a trifle of time , compared with what generally elapsed after the death of [an injured wife]1561-an injured wife , before [[her]1561-an injured wife room]1360-her room was put to rights .

“ [You]73-catherine were with [her]3210-your mother , [I]84-miss morland suppose , to the last ? ”[84-miss morland]

“ No , ”[90-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , sighing ; “ [I]90-miss tilney was unfortunately from [home]2403-home . [Her]3210-your mother illness was sudden and short ; and , before [I]90-miss tilney arrived it was all over . ”[90-miss tilney]

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s blood ran cold with the horrid suggestions which naturally sprang from these words . Could it be possible ? Could [[Henry]92-henry ’s father]1093-henry ’s father — ? And yet how many were the examples to justify even the blackest suspicions ! and , when [she]84-miss morland saw [him]1093-henry ’s father in the evening , while [she]84-miss morland worked with [[her]84-miss morland friend]305-her friend , slowly pacing [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room for an hour together in silent thoughtfulness , with downcast eyes and contracted brow , [she]84-miss morland felt secure from all possibility of wronging [him]1093-henry ’s father . It was the air and attitude of [a Montoni]1566-a montoni ! what could more plainly speak the gloomy workings of a mind not wholly dead to every sense of humanity , in its fearful review of past scenes of guilt ? [Unhappy man]1567-unhappy man ! and the anxiousness of [her]84-miss morland spirits directed [her]84-miss morland eyes towards [his]1093-henry ’s father figure so repeatedly , as to catch [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s notice . “ [[My]84-miss morland father]2538-my father , ”[84-miss morland] [she]84-miss morland whispered , “ often walks about [the room]301-the room in this way ; it is nothing unusual . ”[84-miss morland]

“ So much the worse ! ”[73-catherine] thought [Catherine]73-catherine ; such ill - timed exercise was of a piece with the strange unseasonableness of [his]1093-henry ’s father morning walks , and boded nothing good .

After an evening , the little variety and seeming length of which made [her]84-miss morland peculiarly sensible of [Henry]92-henry ’s importance among [them]1568-them , [she]84-miss morland was heartily glad to be dismissed ; though it was a look from [the General]800-the general not designed for [her]84-miss morland observation which sent [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter to the bell . When [the butler]1571-the butler would have lit [[his]1571-the butler master]2464-his master ’s candle , however , [he]1571-the butler was forbidden . [The latter]562-the latter was not going to retire . “ [I]1093-henry ’s father have many pamphlets to finish , ”[1093-henry ’s father] said [he]1093-henry ’s father to [Catherine]73-catherine , “ before [I]1093-henry ’s father can close [my]1093-henry ’s father eyes , and perhaps may be poring over the affairs of [the nation]999-the nation for hours after [you]73-catherine are asleep . Can either of [us]3215-us be more meetly employed ? _ [My]1093-henry ’s father _ eyes will be blinding for the good of [others]376-others , and _ [yours]73-catherine _ preparing by rest for future mischief . ”[1093-henry ’s father]

But neither the business alleged , nor the magnificent compliment , could win [Catherine]73-catherine from thinking that some very different object must occasion so serious a delay of proper repose . To be kept up for hours , after [the family]454-the family were in bed , by stupid pamphlets was not very likely . There must be some deeper cause : something was to be done which could be done only while [the household]1575-the household slept ; and the probability that [Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney yet lived , shut up for causes unknown , and receiving from the pitiless hands of [[her]128-mrs. tilney husband]810-her husband a nightly supply of coarse food , was the conclusion which necessarily followed . Shocking as was the idea , it was at least better than a death unfairly hastened , as , in the natural course of things , [she]128-mrs. tilney must ere long be released . The suddenness of [her]128-mrs. tilney reputed illness , the absence of [[her]128-mrs. tilney daughter]266-her daughter , and probably of [[her]128-mrs. tilney other children]1578-her other children , at the time — all favoured the supposition of [her]128-mrs. tilney imprisonment . Its origin — jealousy perhaps , or wanton cruelty — was yet to be unravelled .

In revolving these matters , while [she]128-mrs. tilney undressed , it suddenly struck [her]128-mrs. tilney as not unlikely that [she]128-mrs. tilney might that morning have passed near [the very spot of [this unfortunate woman]1580-this unfortunate woman ’s confinement]1579-the very spot of this unfortunate woman ’s confinement — might have been within a few paces of [the cell in which [she]128-mrs. tilney languished out [her]128-mrs. tilney days]1581-the cell in which she languished out her days ; for what part of [the abbey]3091-the abbey could be more fitted for the purpose than that which yet bore the traces of monastic division ? In the high - arched passage , paved with stone , which already [she]128-mrs. tilney had trodden with peculiar awe , [she]128-mrs. tilney well remembered the doors of which [the General]800-the general had given no account . To what might not those doors lead ? In support of the plausibility of this conjecture , it further occurred to [her]128-mrs. tilney that [the forbidden gallery , in which lay [the apartments of [the unfortunate Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney]1585-the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney]1584-the forbidden gallery , in which lay the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney , must be , as certainly as [her]128-mrs. tilney memory could guide [her]128-mrs. tilney , exactly over [this suspected range of [cells]1587-cells]1586-this suspected range of cells , and the staircase by the side of [those apartments of which [she]128-mrs. tilney had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with [those cells]1589-those cells]1588-those apartments of which she had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with those cells , might well have favoured the barbarous proceedings of [[her]128-mrs. tilney husband]810-her husband . Down [that staircase]1591-that staircase [she]128-mrs. tilney had perhaps been conveyed in a state of well - prepared insensibility !

[Catherine]73-catherine sometimes started at the boldness of [her]128-mrs. tilney own surmises , and sometimes hoped or feared that [she]128-mrs. tilney had gone too far ; but they were supported by such appearances as made [their]1592-their dismissal impossible .

The side of [the quadrangle]1412-the quadrangle , in which [she]128-mrs. tilney supposed the guilty scene to be acting , being , according to [her]128-mrs. tilney belief , just opposite [her]128-mrs. tilney own , it struck [her]128-mrs. tilney that , if judiciously watched , some rays of light from [the General]800-the general ’s lamp might glimmer through the lower windows , as [he]800-the general passed to [the prison of [[his]800-the general wife]337-his wife]1595-the prison of his wife ; and , twice before [she]128-mrs. tilney stepped into bed , [she]128-mrs. tilney stole gently from [[her]128-mrs. tilney room]1360-her room to the corresponding window in [the gallery]1367-the gallery , to see if it appeared ; but all abroad was dark , and it must yet be too early . The various ascending noises convinced [her]128-mrs. tilney that [the servants]1599-the servants must still be up . Till midnight , [she]128-mrs. tilney supposed it would be in vain to watch ; but then , when the clock had struck twelve , and all was quiet , [she]128-mrs. tilney would , if not quite appalled by darkness , steal out and look once more . The clock struck twelve — and [Catherine]73-catherine had been half an hour asleep .

CHAPTER 24

The next day afforded no opportunity for the proposed examination of [the mysterious apartments]1600-the mysterious apartments . It was Sunday , and the whole time between morning and afternoon service was required by [the General]800-the general in exercise [abroad]1602-abroad or eating cold meat at [home]2403-home ; and great as was [Catherine]73-catherine ’s curiosity , [her]128-mrs. tilney courage was not equal to a wish of exploring [them]1600-the mysterious apartments after dinner , either by the fading light of the sky between six and seven o’clock , or by the yet more partial though stronger illumination of a treacherous lamp . The day was unmarked therefore by anything to interest [her]128-mrs. tilney imagination beyond the sight of a very elegant monument to the memory of [Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney , which immediately fronted the family pew . By that [her]128-mrs. tilney eye was instantly caught and long retained ; and the perusal of the highly strained epitaph , in which every virtue was ascribed to [her]128-mrs. tilney by [the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other [her]128-mrs. tilney destroyer]1604-the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other her destroyer , affected [her]128-mrs. tilney even to tears .

That [the General]800-the general , having erected such a monument , should be able to face it , was not perhaps very strange , and yet that [he]800-the general could sit so boldly collected within [its]1606-its view , maintain so elevated an air , look so fearlessly around , nay , that [he]800-the general should even enter [the church]2868-the church , seemed wonderful to [Catherine]73-catherine . Not , however , that many instances of [beings equally hardened in guilt]1608-beings equally hardened in guilt might not be produced . [She]128-mrs. tilney could remember dozens who had persevered in every possible vice , going on from crime to crime , murdering whomsoever [they]1609-they chose , without any feeling of humanity or remorse ; till a violent death or a religious retirement closed [their]1609-they black career . The erection of the monument itself could not in the smallest degree affect [her]128-mrs. tilney doubts of [Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney ’s actual decease . Were [she]128-mrs. tilney even to descend into [the family vault where [her]128-mrs. tilney ashes were supposed to slumber]1610-the family vault where her ashes were supposed to slumber , were [she]128-mrs. tilney to behold the coffin in which they were said to be enclosed — what could it avail in such a case ? [Catherine]73-catherine had read too much not to be perfectly aware of the ease with which [a waxen figure]1611-a waxen figure might be introduced , and a supposititious funeral carried on .

The succeeding morning promised something better . [The General]800-the general ’s early walk , ill - timed as it was in every other view , was favourable [here]280-here ; and when [she]128-mrs. tilney knew [him]800-the general to be out of [the house]211-the house , [she]128-mrs. tilney directly proposed to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney the accomplishment of [her]128-mrs. tilney promise . [Eleanor]142-eleanor was ready to oblige [her]128-mrs. tilney ; and [Catherine]73-catherine reminding [her]128-mrs. tilney as [they]1615-they went of another promise , [their]1615-they first visit in consequence was to the portrait in [[her]128-mrs. tilney bed - chamber]1616-her bed - chamber . It represented [a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance , justifying , so far , the expectations of its new observer]1617-a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance , justifying , so far , the expectations of its new observer ; but they were not in every respect answered , for [Catherine]73-catherine had depended upon meeting with features , hair , complexion , that should be the very counterpart , the very image , if not of [Henry]92-henry ’s , of [Eleanor’s]167-eleanor’s — the only portraits of which [she]128-mrs. tilney had been in the habit of thinking , bearing always an equal resemblance of [mother]183-mother and [child]1619-child . A face once taken was taken for generations . But here [she]128-mrs. tilney was obliged to look and consider and study for a likeness . [She]128-mrs. tilney contemplated it , however , in spite of this drawback , with much emotion , and , but for a yet stronger interest , would have left it unwillingly .

[Her]128-mrs. tilney agitation as [they]1615-they entered [the great gallery]1620-the great gallery was too much for any endeavour at discourse ; [she]128-mrs. tilney could only look at [[her]128-mrs. tilney companion]569-her companion . [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s countenance was dejected , yet sedate ; and its composure spoke [her]128-mrs. tilney inured to all the gloomy objects to which [they]1615-they were advancing . Again [she]128-mrs. tilney passed through the folding doors , again [her]128-mrs. tilney hand was upon the important lock , and [Catherine]73-catherine , hardly able to breathe , was turning to close the former with fearful caution , when [the figure , the dreaded figure of [the General]800-the general [himself]800-the general at the further end of [the gallery]1367-the gallery]1622-the figure , the dreaded figure of the general himself at the further end of the gallery , stood before [her]128-mrs. tilney ! the name of “ [Eleanor]142-eleanor ”[800-the general] at the same moment , in [his]800-the general loudest tone , resounded through [the building]1283-the building , giving to [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter the first intimation of [his]800-the general presence , and to [Catherine]73-catherine terror upon terror . An attempt at concealment had been [her]128-mrs. tilney first instinctive movement on perceiving [him]800-the general , yet [she]128-mrs. tilney could scarcely hope to have escaped [his]800-the general eye ; and when [[her]128-mrs. tilney friend , who with an apologizing look darted hastily by [her]128-mrs. tilney]1627-her friend , who with an apologizing look darted hastily by her , had joined and disappeared with [him]800-the general , [she]128-mrs. tilney ran for safety to [[her]128-mrs. tilney own room]1628-her own room , and , locking [herself]128-mrs. tilney in , believed that [she]128-mrs. tilney should never have courage to go down again . [She]128-mrs. tilney remained [there]2232-there at least an hour , in the greatest agitation , deeply commiserating the state of [[her]128-mrs. tilney poor friend]1630-her poor friend , and expecting a summons [herself]128-mrs. tilney from [the angry General]1631-the angry general to attend [him]800-the general in [[his]800-the general own apartment]1632-his own apartment . No summons , however , arrived ; and at last , on seeing [a carriage]683-a carriage drive up to [the abbey]3091-the abbey , [she]128-mrs. tilney was emboldened to descend and meet [him]800-the general under the protection of [visitors]1635-visitors . [The breakfast - room]1387-the breakfast - room was gay with [company]2898-company ; and [she]128-mrs. tilney was named to [them]2898-company by [the General]800-the general as [the friend of [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter]1639-the friend of his daughter , in a complimentary style , which so well concealed [his]800-the general resentful ire , as to make [her]128-mrs. tilney feel secure at least of life for the present . And [Eleanor]142-eleanor , with a command of countenance which did honour to [her]128-mrs. tilney concern for [his]800-the general character , taking an early occasion of saying to [her]128-mrs. tilney , “ [[My]128-mrs. tilney father]2538-my father only wanted [me]128-mrs. tilney to answer a note , ”[128-mrs. tilney] [she]128-mrs. tilney began to hope that [she]128-mrs. tilney had either been unseen by [the General]800-the general , or that from some consideration of policy [she]128-mrs. tilney should be allowed to suppose [herself]128-mrs. tilney so . Upon this trust [she]128-mrs. tilney dared still to remain in [his]800-the general presence , after [the company]338-the company left [them]1643-them , and nothing occurred to disturb it .

In the course of this morning ’s reflections , [she]128-mrs. tilney came to a resolution of making [her]128-mrs. tilney next attempt on the forbidden door alone . It would be much better in every respect that [Eleanor]142-eleanor should know nothing of the matter . To involve [her]128-mrs. tilney in the danger of a second detection , to court [her]128-mrs. tilney into [an apartment which must wring [her]128-mrs. tilney heart]1644-an apartment which must wring her heart , could not be [the office of [a friend]446-a friend]1645-the office of a friend . [The General]800-the general ’s utmost anger could not be to [herself]128-mrs. tilney what it might be to [a daughter]1648-a daughter ; and , besides , [she]128-mrs. tilney thought the examination itself would be more satisfactory if made without [any companion]1277-any companion . It would be impossible to explain to [Eleanor]142-eleanor the suspicions , from which [the other]412-the other had , in all likelihood , been hitherto happily exempt ; nor could [she]128-mrs. tilney therefore , in _ [her]128-mrs. tilney _ presence , search for those proofs of [the General]800-the general ’s cruelty , which however [they]1643-them might yet have escaped discovery , [she]128-mrs. tilney felt confident of somewhere drawing forth , in the shape of some fragmented journal , continued to the last gasp . Of the way to [the apartment]945-the apartment [she]128-mrs. tilney was now perfectly mistress ; and as [she]128-mrs. tilney wished to get it over before [Henry]92-henry ’s return , who was expected on the morrow , there was no time to be lost . The day was bright , [her]128-mrs. tilney courage high ; at four o’clock , the sun was now two hours above the horizon , and it would be only [her]128-mrs. tilney retiring to dress half an hour earlier than usual .

It was done ; and [Catherine]73-catherine found [herself]73-catherine alone in [the gallery]1367-the gallery before the clocks had ceased to strike . It was no time for thought ; [she]128-mrs. tilney hurried on , slipped with the least possible noise through the folding doors , and without stopping to look or breathe , rushed forward to the one in question . The lock yielded to [her]128-mrs. tilney hand , and , luckily , with no sullen sound that could alarm [a human being]1654-a human being . On tiptoe [she]128-mrs. tilney entered ; [the room]301-the room was before [her]128-mrs. tilney ; but it was some minutes before [she]128-mrs. tilney could advance another step . [She]128-mrs. tilney beheld what fixed [her]128-mrs. tilney to the spot and agitated every feature . [She]128-mrs. tilney saw [a large , well - proportioned apartment]1656-a large , well - proportioned apartment , [an handsome dimity bed , arranged as unoccupied with [an housemaid]1658-an housemaid ’s care]1657-an handsome dimity bed , arranged as unoccupied with an housemaid ’s care , a bright Bath stove , mahogany wardrobes , and neatly painted chairs , on which the warm beams of a western sun gaily poured through two sash windows ! [Catherine]73-catherine had expected to have [her]128-mrs. tilney feelings worked , and worked they were . Astonishment and doubt first seized them ; and a shortly succeeding ray of common sense added some bitter emotions of shame . [She]128-mrs. tilney could not be mistaken as to [the room]301-the room ; but how grossly mistaken in everything else!—in [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney ’s meaning , in [her]128-mrs. tilney own calculation ! [this apartment , to which [she]128-mrs. tilney had given a date so ancient , a position so awful ,]1660-this apartment , to which she had given a date so ancient , a position so awful , proved to be one end of what [[the General]800-the general ’s father]1507-the general ’s father had built . There were two other doors in [the chamber]1663-the chamber , leading probably into dressing - [closets]1664-closets ; but [she]128-mrs. tilney had no inclination to open either . Would the veil in which [Mrs. Tilney]128-mrs. tilney had last walked , or the volume in which [she]128-mrs. tilney had last read , remain to tell what nothing else was allowed to whisper ? No : whatever might have been [the General]800-the general ’s crimes , [he]800-the general had certainly too much wit to let [them]1666-them sue for detection . [She]128-mrs. tilney was sick of exploring , and desired but to be safe in [[her]128-mrs. tilney own room]1628-her own room , with [her]128-mrs. tilney own heart only privy to its folly ; and [she]128-mrs. tilney was on the point of retreating as softly as [she]128-mrs. tilney had entered , when the sound of footsteps , [she]128-mrs. tilney could hardly tell where , made [her]128-mrs. tilney pause and tremble . To be found there , even by [a servant]685-a servant , would be unpleasant ; but by [the General]800-the general ( and [he]800-the general seemed always at hand when least wanted ) , much worse ! [she]128-mrs. tilney listened — the sound had ceased ; and resolving not to lose a moment , [she]128-mrs. tilney passed through and closed the door . At that instant a door underneath was hastily opened ; [someone]1670-someone seemed with swift steps to ascend the stairs , by the head of which [she]128-mrs. tilney had yet to pass before [she]128-mrs. tilney could gain [the gallery]1367-the gallery . [She]128-mrs. tilney had no power to move . With a feeling of terror not very definable , [she]128-mrs. tilney fixed [her]128-mrs. tilney eyes on the staircase , and in a few moments it gave [Henry]92-henry to [her]128-mrs. tilney view . “ [Mr. Tilney]92-henry ! ”[128-mrs. tilney] [she]128-mrs. tilney exclaimed in a voice of more than common astonishment . [He]92-henry looked astonished too . “ [Good God]127-god ! ”[128-mrs. tilney] [she]128-mrs. tilney continued , not attending to [his]92-henry address . “ How came [you]92-henry [here]280-here ? How came [you]92-henry up that staircase ? ”[128-mrs. tilney]

“ How came [I]92-henry up that staircase ! ”[92-henry] [he]92-henry replied , greatly surprised . “ Because it is [my]92-henry nearest way from [the stable - yard]3219-the stable - yard to [[my]92-henry own chamber]3220-my own chamber ; and why should [I]92-henry not come up it ? ”[92-henry]

[Catherine]73-catherine recollected [herself]73-catherine , blushed deeply , and could say no more . [He]92-henry seemed to be looking in [her]128-mrs. tilney countenance for that explanation which [her]128-mrs. tilney lips did not afford . [She]128-mrs. tilney moved on towards [the gallery]1367-the gallery . “ And may [I]92-henry not , in [my]92-henry turn , ”[92-henry] said [he]92-henry , as [he]92-henry pushed back the folding doors , “ ask how _ [you]128-mrs. tilney _ came [here]280-here ? [This passage]3222-this passage is at least as extraordinary [a road from [the breakfast - parlour]1375-the breakfast - parlour to [[your]128-mrs. tilney apartment]3113-your apartment]3223-a road from the breakfast - parlour to your apartment , as that staircase can be from [the stables]3226-the stables to [mine]92-henry . ”[92-henry]

“ [I]73-catherine have been , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , looking down , “ to see [[[your]128-mrs. tilney mother]3210-your mother ’s room]3228-your mother ’s room . ”[73-catherine]

“ [[[My]92-henry mother]2518-my mother ’s room]3208-my mother ’s room ! is there anything extraordinary to be seen [there]2232-there ? ”[92-henry]

“ No , nothing at all . [I]73-catherine thought [you]128-mrs. tilney did not mean to come back till to - morrow . ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]92-henry did not expect to be able to return sooner , when [I]92-henry went away ; but three hours ago [I]92-henry had the pleasure of finding nothing to detain [me]92-henry . [You]128-mrs. tilney look pale . [I]92-henry am afraid [I]92-henry alarmed [you]128-mrs. tilney by running so fast up those stairs . Perhaps [you]128-mrs. tilney did not know — [you]128-mrs. tilney were not aware of [their]3232-their leading from [the offices in [common use]3234-common use]3233-the offices in common use ? ”[92-henry]

“ No , [I]73-catherine was not . [You]128-mrs. tilney have had a very fine day for [your]128-mrs. tilney ride . ”[73-catherine]

“ Very ; and does [Eleanor]142-eleanor leave [you]128-mrs. tilney to find [your]128-mrs. tilney way into [all the rooms in [the house]211-the house]3235-all the rooms in the house by [yourself]128-mrs. tilney ? ”[92-henry]

“ Oh no ! [she]1673-you showed [me]1673-you over the greatest part on Saturday — and [we]3237-we were coming here to [these rooms]3238-these rooms — but only , ”[1673-you] dropping [her]1673-you voice , “ [[your]128-mrs. tilney father]2706-your father was with [us]3237-we . ”[1673-you]

“ And that prevented [you]1673-you , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , earnestly regarding [her]1673-you . “ Have [you]1673-you looked into all [the rooms in that passage]3240-the rooms in that passage ? ”[92-henry]

“ No , [I]1673-you only wanted to see — Is not it very late ? [I]1673-you must go and dress . ”[1673-you]

“ It is only a quarter past four , ”[92-henry] showing [his]92-henry watch ; “ and [you]1673-you are not now in [Bath]2236-bath . [No theatre]3242-no theatre , [no rooms]3243-no rooms to prepare for . Half an hour at [Northanger]60-northanger must be enough . ”[92-henry]

[She]1673-you could not contradict it , and therefore suffered [herself]1673-you to be detained , though [her]1673-you dread of further questions made [her]1673-you , for the first time in [their]1674-i acquaintance , wish to leave [him]92-henry . [They]1674-i walked slowly up [the gallery]1367-the gallery . “ Have [you]1673-you had any letter from [Bath]5-bath since [I]1674-i saw [you]1673-you ? ”[1674-i]

“ No , and [I]1674-i am very much surprised . [Isabella]101-isabella promised so faithfully to write directly . ”[1674-i]

“ Promised so faithfully ! a faithful promise ! that puzzles [me]1674-i . [I]1674-i have heard of a faithful performance . But a faithful promise — the fidelity of promising ! it is a power little worth knowing , however , since it can deceive and pain [you]3244-you . [[[My]1674-i mother]2518-my mother ’s room]3208-my mother ’s room is very commodious , is it not ? Large and cheerful - looking , and the dressing - closets so well disposed ! It always strikes [me]1674-i as [the most comfortable apartment in [the house]211-the house]3247-the most comfortable apartment in the house , and [I]1674-i rather wonder that [Eleanor]142-eleanor should not take [it]3208-my mother ’s room for [her]101-isabella own . [She]101-isabella sent [you]1676-he to look at [it]3208-my mother ’s room , [I]1674-i suppose ? ”[1674-i]

“ No . ”[1674-i]

“ It has been [your]1676-he own doing entirely ? ”[1674-i] [Catherine]73-catherine said nothing . After a short silence , during which [he]1676-he had closely observed [her]1677-her , [he]1676-he added , “ As there is nothing in [the room]301-the room in [itself]301-the room to raise curiosity , this must have proceeded from a sentiment of respect for [[my]1676-he mother]2518-my mother ’s character , as described by [Eleanor]142-eleanor , which does honour to [her]101-isabella memory . [The world]191-the world , [I]1676-he believe , never saw [a better woman]3252-a better woman . But it is not often that virtue can boast an interest such as this . The domestic , unpretending merits of [a person never known]3253-a person never known do not often create that kind of fervent , venerating tenderness which would prompt a visit like [yours]1676-he . [Eleanor]142-eleanor , [I]1676-he suppose , has talked of [her]101-isabella a great deal ? ”[1676-he]

“ Yes , a great deal . That is — no , not much , but what [she]101-isabella did say was very interesting . [Her]101-isabella dying so suddenly ”[1678-i] ( slowly , and with hesitation it was spoken ) , “ and [you]1679-her — none of [you]1679-her being at [home]2403-home — and [[your]1679-her father]2706-your father , [I]1678-i thought — perhaps had not been very fond of [her]101-isabella . ”[1678-i]

“ And from these circumstances , ”[1678-i] [he]1678-i replied ( [his]1678-i quick eye fixed on [hers]1679-her ) , “ [you]1679-her infer perhaps the probability of some negligence — some”—(involuntarily[1679-her] [she]1679-her shook [her]1679-her head)—“or it may be — of something still less pardonable . ”[1679-her] [She]1679-her raised [her]1679-her eyes towards [him]1678-i more fully than [she]1679-her had ever done before . “ [[My]1678-i mother]2518-my mother ’s illness , ”[1678-i] [he]1678-i continued , “ the seizure which ended in [her]2518-my mother death , _ was _ sudden . The malady itself , one from which [she]2518-my mother had often suffered , a bilious fever — its cause therefore constitutional . On the third day , in short , as soon as [she]2518-my mother could be prevailed on , [a physician]3257-a physician attended [her]2518-my mother , [a very respectable man]186-a very respectable man , and one in whom [she]2518-my mother had always placed great confidence . Upon [his]3257-a physician opinion of [her]2518-my mother danger , [two others]3259-two others were called in the next day , and remained in almost constant attendance for four and twenty hours . On the fifth day [she]1679-her died . During the progress of [her]1679-her disorder , [Frederick]74-captain tilney and [I]1678-i ( _ [we]3260-we _ were both at [home]2403-home ) saw [her]1679-her repeatedly ; and from [our]3260-we own observation can bear witness to [her]1679-her having received every possible attention which could spring from the affection of those about [her]1679-her , or which [her]1679-her situation in life could command . [Poor Eleanor]142-eleanor was absent , and at such a distance as to return only to see [[her]1679-her mother]188-her mother in [her]1679-her coffin . ”[1678-i]

“ But [[your]73-catherine father]2706-your father , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , “ was _ [he]2706-your father _ afflicted ? ”[73-catherine]

“ For a time , greatly so . [You]73-catherine have erred in supposing [him]2706-your father not attached to [her]1679-her . [He]2706-your father loved [her]1679-her , [I]1678-i am persuaded , as well as it was possible for [him]2706-your father to — [we]3260-we have not all , [you]73-catherine know , the same tenderness of disposition — and [I]1678-i will not pretend to say that while [she]1679-her lived , [she]1679-her might not often have had much to bear , but though [his]2706-your father temper injured [her]1679-her , [his]2706-your father judgment never did . [His]2706-your father value of [her]1679-her was sincere ; and , if not permanently , [he]2706-your father was truly afflicted by [her]1679-her death . ”[1678-i]

“ [I]73-catherine am very glad of it , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine ; “ it would have been very shocking ! ”[73-catherine]

“ If [I]1680-i understand [you]73-catherine rightly , [you]73-catherine had formed a surmise of such horror as [I]1680-i have hardly words to — [Dear Miss Morland]84-miss morland , consider the dreadful nature of the suspicions [you]73-catherine have entertained . What have [you]73-catherine been judging from ? Remember [the country]219-the country and the age in which [we]3265-we live . Remember that [we]3265-we are English , that [we]3265-we are [Christians]3266-christians . Consult [your]73-catherine own understanding , [your]73-catherine own sense of the probable , [your]73-catherine own observation of what is passing around [you]73-catherine . Does [our]3265-we education prepare [us]3265-we for such atrocities ? Do [our]3265-we laws connive at [them]3267-them ? Could they be perpetrated without being known , in [a country like this]3268-a country like this , where social and literary intercourse is on such a footing , where [every man]3269-every man is surrounded by [a neighbourhood of voluntary spies]3270-a neighbourhood of voluntary spies , and where [roads and newspapers lay everything]3271-roads and newspapers lay everything open ? [Dearest Miss Morland]84-miss morland , what ideas have [you]84-miss morland been admitting ? ”[1680-i]

[They]1680-i had reached the end of [the gallery]1367-the gallery , and with tears of shame [she]1682-she ran off to [[her]1682-she own room]1628-her own room .

CHAPTER 25

The visions of romance were over . [Catherine]73-catherine was completely awakened . [Henry]92-henry ’s address , short as it had been , had more thoroughly opened [her]1682-she eyes to the extravagance of [her]1682-she late fancies than all [their]1680-i several disappointments had done . Most grievously was [she]1682-she humbled . Most bitterly did [she]1682-she cry . It was not only with [herself]1682-she that [she]1682-she was sunk — but with [Henry]92-henry . [Her]1682-she folly , which now seemed even criminal , was all exposed to [him]92-henry , and [he]92-henry must despise [her]1682-she forever . The liberty which [her]1682-she imagination had dared to take with the character of [[his]92-henry father]881-his father — could [he]92-henry ever forgive it ? The absurdity of [her]1682-she curiosity and [her]1682-she fears — could they ever be forgotten ? [She]1682-she hated [herself]1682-she more than [she]1682-she could express . [He]92-henry had — [she]1682-she thought [he]92-henry had , once or twice before this fatal morning , shown something like affection for [her]1682-she . But now — in short , [she]1682-she made [herself]1682-she as miserable as possible for about half an hour , went down when the clock struck five , with a broken heart , and could scarcely give an intelligible answer to [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s inquiry if [she]1682-she was well . The formidable [Henry]92-henry soon followed [her]1682-she into [the room]301-the room , and the only difference in [his]92-henry behaviour to [her]1682-she was that [he]92-henry paid [her]1682-she rather more attention than usual . [Catherine]73-catherine had never wanted comfort more , and [he]92-henry looked as if [he]92-henry was aware of it .

The evening wore away with no abatement of this soothing politeness ; and [her]1682-she spirits were gradually raised to a modest tranquillity . [She]1682-she did not learn either to forget or defend the past ; but [she]1682-she learned to hope that it would never transpire farther , and that it might not cost [her]1682-she [Henry]92-henry ’s entire regard . [Her]1682-she thoughts being still chiefly fixed on what [she]1682-she had with such causeless terror felt and done , nothing could shortly be clearer than that it had been all a voluntary , self - created delusion , each trifling circumstance receiving importance from an imagination resolved on alarm , and everything forced to bend to one purpose by a mind which , before [she]1682-she entered [the abbey]3091-the abbey , had been craving to be frightened . [She]1682-she remembered with what feelings [she]1682-she had prepared for a knowledge of [Northanger]60-northanger . [She]1682-she saw that the infatuation had been created , the mischief settled , long before [her]1682-she quitting [Bath]5-bath , and it seemed as if the whole might be traced to the influence of that sort of reading which [she]1682-she had there indulged .

Charming as were all [Mrs. Radcliffe]122-mrs. radcliffe ’s works , and charming even as were the works of [all [her]122-mrs. radcliffe imitators]1687-all her imitators , it was not in [them]1687-all her imitators perhaps that human nature , at least in [the Midland counties of [England]2-england]1688-the midland counties of england , was to be looked for . Of [the Alps and Pyrenees]64-the alps and pyrenees , with [their]64-the alps and pyrenees pine forests and [their]64-the alps and pyrenees vices , [they]64-the alps and pyrenees might give a faithful delineation ; and [Italy]50-italy , [Switzerland]65-switzerland , and [the south of [France]48-france]2759-the south of france might be as fruitful in horrors as [they]64-the alps and pyrenees were there represented . [Catherine]73-catherine dared not doubt beyond [[her]1682-she own country]1690-her own country , and even of that , if hard pressed , would have yielded [the northern and western extremities]1691-the northern and western extremities . But in [the central part of [England]2-england]1692-the central part of england there was surely some security for the existence even of [a wife not beloved]1693-a wife not beloved , in the laws of [the land]1694-the land , and the manners of the age . Murder was not tolerated , [servants]1516-servants were not [slaves]1696-slaves , and neither poison nor sleeping potions to be procured , like rhubarb , from [every druggist]1697-every druggist . Among [the Alps]66-the alps and [Pyrenees]67-pyrenees , perhaps , there were [no mixed characters]1698-no mixed characters . There , such as were not as spotless as [an angel]2307-an angel might have the dispositions of [a fiend]1700-a fiend . But in [England]2-england it was not so ; among [the English]168-the english , [she]1682-she believed , in [their]168-the english hearts and habits , there was a general though unequal mixture of good and bad . Upon this conviction , [she]1682-she would not be surprised if even in [Henry]92-henry and [Eleanor Tilney]142-eleanor , some slight imperfection might hereafter appear ; and upon this conviction [she]1682-she need not fear to acknowledge some actual specks in the character of [[their]1701-their father]1091-their father , who , though cleared from the grossly injurious suspicions which [she]1682-she must ever blush to have entertained , [she]1682-she did believe , upon serious consideration , to be not perfectly amiable .

[Her]1682-she mind made up on these several points , and [her]1682-she resolution formed , of always judging and acting in future with the greatest good sense , [she]1682-she had nothing to do but to forgive [herself]1682-she and be happier than ever ; and the lenient hand of time did much for [her]1682-she by insensible gradations in the course of another day . [Henry]92-henry ’s astonishing generosity and nobleness of conduct , in never alluding in the slightest way to what had passed , was of the greatest assistance to [her]1682-she ; and sooner than [she]1682-she could have supposed it possible in the beginning of [her]1682-she distress , [her]1682-she spirits became absolutely comfortable , and capable , as heretofore , of continual improvement by anything [he]92-henry said . There were still some subjects , indeed , under which [she]1682-she believed they must always tremble — the mention of a chest or a cabinet , for instance — and [she]1682-she did not love the sight of japan in any shape : but even _ [she]1682-she _ could allow that an occasional memento of past folly , however painful , might not be without use .

The anxieties of common life began soon to succeed to the alarms of romance . [Her]1682-she desire of hearing from [Isabella]101-isabella grew every day greater . [She]1682-she was quite impatient to know how [the Bath world]1703-the bath world went on , and how [the rooms]2184-the rooms were attended ; and especially was [she]1682-she anxious to be assured of [Isabella]101-isabella ’s having matched some fine netting - cotton , on which [she]1682-she had left [her]1682-she intent ; and of [her]1682-she continuing on the best terms with [James]103-james . [Her]1682-she only dependence for information of any kind was on [Isabella]101-isabella . [James]103-james had protested against writing to [her]101-isabella till [his]103-james return to [Oxford]10-oxford ; and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen had given [her]101-isabella no hopes of a letter till [she]101-isabella had got back to [Fullerton]3-fullerton . But [Isabella]101-isabella had promised and promised again ; and when [she]101-isabella promised a thing , [she]101-isabella was so scrupulous in performing it ! this made it so particularly strange !

For nine successive mornings , [Catherine]73-catherine wondered over the repetition of a disappointment , which each morning became more severe : but , on the tenth , when [she]1682-she entered [the breakfast - room]1387-the breakfast - room , [her]1682-she first object was a letter , held out by [Henry]92-henry ’s willing hand . [She]1682-she thanked [him]103-james as heartily as if [he]103-james had written it [himself]103-james . “ ’ Tis only from [James]103-james , however , ”[1682-she] as [she]1682-she looked at the direction . [She]1682-she opened it ; it was from [Oxford]10-oxford ; and to this purpose :

“ [Dear Catherine]73-catherine , “[1682-she] Though , God knows , with little inclination for writing , [I]0-i think it [my]0-i duty to tell [you]73-catherine that everything is at an end between [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe and [me]0-i . [I]0-i left [her]95-miss thorpe and [Bath]5-bath yesterday , never to see either again . [I]0-i shall not enter into particulars — they would only pain [you]73-catherine more . [You]73-catherine will soon hear enough from another quarter to know where lies the blame ; and [I]0-i hope will acquit [[your]73-catherine brother]2395-your brother of everything but the folly of too easily thinking [his]2395-your brother affection returned . Thank [God]127-god ! [i]0-i am undeceived in time ! but it is a heavy blow ! after [[my]0-i father]2538-my father ’s consent had been so kindly given — but no more of this . [She]95-miss thorpe has made [me]0-i miserable forever ! let [me]0-i soon hear from [you]73-catherine , [dear Catherine]73-catherine ; [you]73-catherine are [[my]0-i only friend]1708-my only friend ; _ [your]73-catherine _ love [I]0-i do build upon . [I]0-i wish [your]73-catherine visit at [Northanger]60-northanger may be over before [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney makes [his]74-captain tilney engagement known , or [you]73-catherine will be uncomfortably circumstanced . [Poor Thorpe]95-miss thorpe is in [town]2354-town : [I]0-i dread the sight of [him]74-captain tilney ; [his]74-captain tilney honest heart would feel so much . [I]0-i have written to [him]74-captain tilney and [[my]0-i father]2538-my father . [Her]1711-her duplicity hurts [me]0-i more than all ; till the very last , if [I]0-i reasoned with [her]1711-her , [she]1711-her declared [herself]1711-her as much attached to [me]0-i as ever , and laughed at [my]0-i fears . [I]0-i am ashamed to think how long [I]0-i bore with it ; but if ever [man]769-man had reason to believe [himself]769-man loved , [I]0-i was [that man]1713-that man . [I]0-i can not understand even now what [she]1711-her would be at , for there could be no need of [my]0-i being played off to make [her]1711-her secure of [Tilney]74-captain tilney . [We]1714-we parted at last by mutual consent — happy for [me]0-i had [we]1714-we never met ! [i]0-i can never expect to know [such another woman]1715-such another woman ! [Dearest Catherine]73-catherine , beware how [you]73-catherine give [your]73-catherine heart .

“ Believe [me]73-catherine , ”[73-catherine] & c.

[Catherine]73-catherine had not read three lines before [her]1711-her sudden change of countenance , and short exclamations of sorrowing wonder , declared [her]1711-her to be receiving unpleasant news ; and [Henry]92-henry , earnestly watching [her]1711-her through the whole letter , saw plainly that it ended no better than it began . [He]92-henry was prevented , however , from even looking [his]92-henry surprise by [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s entrance . [They]1714-we went to breakfast directly ; but [Catherine]73-catherine could hardly eat anything . Tears filled [her]1711-her eyes , and even ran down [her]1711-her cheeks as [she]1711-her sat . The letter was one moment in [her]1711-her hand , then in [her]1711-her lap , and then in [her]1711-her pocket ; and [she]1711-her looked as if [she]1711-her knew not what [she]1711-her did . [The General]800-the general , between [his]800-the general cocoa and [his]800-the general newspaper , had luckily no leisure for noticing [her]1711-her ; but to [the other two]567-the other two [her]1711-her distress was equally visible . As soon as [she]1711-her dared leave the table [she]1711-her hurried away to [[her]1711-her own room]1628-her own room ; but [the housemaids]1720-the housemaids were busy in [it]1628-her own room , and [she]1711-her was obliged to come down again . [She]1711-her turned into [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room for privacy , but [Henry]92-henry and [Eleanor]142-eleanor had likewise retreated thither , and were at that moment deep in consultation about [her]1711-her . [She]1711-her drew back , trying to beg [their]567-the other two pardon , but was , with gentle violence , forced to return ; and [the others]2286-the others withdrew , after [Eleanor]142-eleanor had affectionately expressed a wish of being of use or comfort to [her]1711-her .

After half an hour ’s free indulgence of grief and reflection , [Catherine]73-catherine felt equal to encountering [[her]1711-her friends]809-her friends ; but whether [she]1711-her should make [her]1711-her distress known to [them]809-her friends was another consideration . Perhaps , if particularly questioned , [she]1711-her might just give an idea — just distantly hint at it — but not more . To expose [a friend]446-a friend , [such a friend as [Isabella]101-isabella]1725-such a friend as isabella had been to [her]1711-her — and then [[their]567-the other two own brother]1726-their own brother so closely concerned in it ! [She]1711-her believed [she]1711-her must waive the subject altogether . [Henry]92-henry and [Eleanor]142-eleanor were by [themselves]567-the other two in [the breakfast - room]1387-the breakfast - room ; and [each]1728-each , as [she]1711-her entered [it]1387-the breakfast - room , looked at [her]1711-her anxiously . [Catherine]73-catherine took [her]1711-her place at the table , and , after a short silence , [Eleanor]142-eleanor said , “ No bad news from [Fullerton]3-fullerton , [I]142-eleanor hope ? [Mr.]3272-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland — [[your]73-catherine brothers]3273-your brothers and [sisters]410-sisters — [I]142-eleanor hope [they]567-the other two are none of [them]567-the other two ill ? ”[142-eleanor]

“ No , [I]1711-her thank [you]73-catherine ”[1711-her] ( sighing as [she]1711-her spoke ) ; “ [they]567-the other two are all very well . [My]1711-her letter was from [[my]1711-her brother]2349-my brother at [Oxford]10-oxford . ”[1711-her]

Nothing further was said for a few minutes ; and then speaking through [her]1711-her tears , [she]1711-her added , “ [I]1711-her do not think [I]1711-her shall ever wish for a letter again ! ”[1711-her]

“ [I]92-henry am sorry , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry , closing the book [he]92-henry had just opened ; “ if [I]92-henry had suspected the letter of containing anything unwelcome , [I]92-henry should have given it with very different feelings . ”[92-henry]

“ It contained something worse than [anybody]192-anybody could suppose ! poor [James]103-james is so unhappy ! [you]73-catherine will soon know why . ”[1711-her]

“ To have so kind - hearted , so affectionate [a sister]631-a sister , ”[92-henry] replied [Henry]92-henry warmly , “ must be a comfort to [him]103-james under any distress . ”[92-henry]

“ [I]73-catherine have one favour to beg , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , shortly afterwards , in an agitated manner , “ that , if [[your]92-henry brother]2395-your brother should be coming [here]280-here , [you]92-henry will give [me]73-catherine notice of it , that [I]73-catherine may go away . ”[73-catherine]

“ [[Our]3280-our brother]3281-our brother ! [frederick]74-captain tilney ! ”[92-henry]
