“ Yes ; [I]73-catherine am sure [I]73-catherine should be very sorry to leave [you]92-henry so soon , but something has happened that would make it very dreadful for [me]73-catherine to be in [the same house]3282-the same house with [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney . ”[73-catherine]

[Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s work was suspended while [she]1729-she gazed with increasing astonishment ; but [Henry]92-henry began to suspect the truth , and something , in which [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s name was included , passed [his]92-henry lips .

“ How quick [you]92-henry are ! ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine : “ [you]92-henry have guessed it , [I]73-catherine declare ! And yet , when [we]3280-our talked about it in [Bath]5-bath , [you]92-henry little thought of its ending so . [Isabella]101-isabella — no wonder _ now _ [I]73-catherine have not heard from [her]101-isabella — [Isabella]101-isabella has deserted [[my]73-catherine brother]2349-my brother , and is to marry [yours]92-henry ! could [you]92-henry have believed there had been such inconstancy and fickleness , and everything that is bad in [the world]191-the world ? ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]1731-i hope , so far as concerns [[my]1731-i brother]2349-my brother , [you]92-henry are misinformed . [I]1731-i hope [he]2349-my brother has not had any material share in bringing on [Mr. Morland]103-james ’s disappointment . [His]2349-my brother marrying [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe is not probable . [I]1731-i think [you]92-henry must be deceived so far . [I]1731-i am very sorry for [Mr. Morland]103-james — sorry that anyone [you]92-henry love should be unhappy ; but [my]1731-i surprise would be greater at [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s marrying [her]95-miss thorpe than at any other part of the story . ”[1731-i]

“ It is very true , however ; [you]92-henry shall read [James]103-james ’s letter [yourself]92-henry . Stay — There is one part — ”[73-catherine] recollecting with a blush the last line .

“ Will [you]92-henry take the trouble of reading to [us]3286-us the passages which concern [[my]1731-i brother]2349-my brother ? ”[1731-i]

“ No , read it [yourself]92-henry , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine , whose second thoughts were clearer . “ [I]73-catherine do not know what [I]73-catherine was thinking of ”[73-catherine] ( blushing again that [she]1730-i had blushed before ) ; “ [James]103-james only means to give [me]73-catherine good advice . ”[73-catherine]

[He]1731-i gladly received the letter , and , having read it through , with close attention , returned it saying , “ Well , if it is to be so , [I]1731-i can only say that [I]1731-i am sorry for it . [Frederick]74-captain tilney will not be [the first man who has chosen [a wife]630-a wife with less sense than [[his]74-captain tilney family]429-his family expected]3288-the first man who has chosen a wife with less sense than his family expected . [I]1731-i do not envy [his]74-captain tilney situation , either as [a lover]387-a lover or [a son]3292-a son . ”[1731-i]

[Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , at [Catherine]73-catherine ’s invitation , now read the letter likewise , and , having expressed also [her]1730-i concern and surprise , began to inquire into [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s connections and fortune .

“ [[Her]95-miss thorpe mother]188-her mother is [a very good sort of woman]3294-a very good sort of woman , ”[73-catherine] was [Catherine]73-catherine ’s answer .

“ What was [[her]95-miss thorpe father]182-her father ? ”[1730-i]

“ [A lawyer]3296-a lawyer , [I]1730-i believe . [They]3297-they live at [Putney]56-putney . ”[1730-i]

“ Are [they]3297-they [a wealthy family]3298-a wealthy family ? ”[1730-i]

“ No , not very . [I]1730-i do not believe [Isabella]101-isabella has any fortune at all : but that will not signify in [[your]2908-the brother family]3299-your family . [[Your]2908-the brother father]2706-your father is so very liberal ! [He]2706-your father told [me]1730-i the other day that [he]2706-your father only valued money as it allowed [him]2706-your father to promote the happiness of [[his]2706-your father children]1094-his children . ”[1730-i] [The brother]2908-the brother and [sister]737-sister looked at [each other]330-each other . “ But , ”[142-eleanor] said [Eleanor]142-eleanor , after a short pause , “ would it be to promote [his]2706-your father happiness , to enable [him]2706-your father to marry [such a girl]3302-such a girl ? [She]3302-such a girl must be [an unprincipled one]3303-an unprincipled one , or [she]3302-such a girl could not have used [[your]2908-the brother brother]2395-your brother so . And how strange an infatuation on [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s side ! [a girl who , before [his]2706-your father eyes , is violating an engagement voluntarily entered into with [another man]3052-another man]3305-a girl who , before his eyes , is violating an engagement voluntarily entered into with another man ! is not it inconceivable , [Henry]92-henry ? [Frederick]74-captain tilney too , who always wore [his]74-captain tilney heart so proudly ! who found [no woman good enough to be loved]3307-no woman good enough to be loved ! ”[142-eleanor]

“ That is the most unpromising circumstance , the strongest presumption against [him]74-captain tilney . When [I]1730-i think of [his]74-captain tilney past declarations , [I]1730-i give [him]74-captain tilney up . Moreover , [I]1730-i have too good an opinion of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ’s prudence to suppose that [she]95-miss thorpe would part with [one gentleman]2324-one gentleman before the other was secured . It is all over with [Frederick]74-captain tilney indeed ! [he]74-captain tilney is [a deceased man]3309-a deceased man — defunct in understanding . Prepare for [[your]92-henry sister - in - law]3310-your sister - in - law , [Eleanor]142-eleanor , and [such a sister - in - law]3311-such a sister - in - law as [you]92-henry must delight in ! open , candid , artless , guileless , with affections strong but simple , forming no pretensions , and knowing no disguise . ”[1730-i]

“ [Such a sister - in - law]3311-such a sister - in - law , [Henry]92-henry , [I]142-eleanor should delight in , ”[142-eleanor] said [Eleanor]142-eleanor with a smile .

“ But perhaps , ”[73-catherine] observed [Catherine]73-catherine , “ though [she]95-miss thorpe has behaved so ill by [[our]3313-our family]3314-our family , [she]95-miss thorpe may behave better by [yours]92-henry . Now [she]95-miss thorpe has really got [the man [she]95-miss thorpe likes]3315-the man she likes , [she]95-miss thorpe may be constant . ”[73-catherine]

“ Indeed [I]92-henry am afraid [she]95-miss thorpe will , ”[92-henry] replied [Henry]92-henry ; “ [I]92-henry am afraid [she]95-miss thorpe will be very constant , unless [a baronet]232-a baronet should come in [her]95-miss thorpe way ; that is [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s only chance . [I]92-henry will get the Bath paper , and look over the arrivals . ”[92-henry]

“ [You]92-henry think it is all for ambition , then ? And , upon [my]1730-i word , there are some things that seem very like it . [I]1730-i can not forget that , when [she]95-miss thorpe first knew what [[my]1730-i father]2538-my father would do for [them]3318-them , [she]95-miss thorpe seemed quite disappointed that it was not more . [I]1730-i never was so deceived in [anyone]2932-anyone ’s character in [my]1730-i life before . ”[1730-i]

“ Among all the great variety that [you]92-henry have known and studied . ”[92-henry]

“ [My]1730-i own disappointment and loss in [her]95-miss thorpe is very great ; but , as for poor [James]103-james , [I]1730-i suppose [he]103-james will hardly ever recover it . ”[1730-i]

“ [[Your]92-henry brother]2395-your brother is certainly very much to be pitied at present ; but [we]3321-we must not , in [our]3321-we concern for [his]2395-your brother sufferings , undervalue [yours]92-henry . [You]92-henry feel , [I]92-henry suppose , that in losing [Isabella]101-isabella , [you]92-henry lose half [yourself]92-henry : [you]92-henry feel a void in [your]92-henry heart which nothing else can occupy . [Society]3322-society is becoming irksome ; and as for the amusements in which [you]92-henry were wo nt to share at Bath , the very idea of [them]3323-them without [her]101-isabella is abhorrent . [You]92-henry would not , for instance , now go to a ball for [the world]191-the world . [You]92-henry feel that [you]92-henry have no longer [any friend to whom [you]92-henry can speak with unreserve , on whose regard [you]92-henry can place dependence , or whose counsel , in any difficulty , [you]92-henry could rely on]3325-any friend to whom you can speak with unreserve , on whose regard you can place dependence , or whose counsel , in any difficulty , you could rely on . [You]92-henry feel all this ? ”[92-henry]

“ No , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , after a few moments ’ reflection , “ [I]73-catherine do not — ought [I]73-catherine ? To say the truth , though [I]73-catherine am hurt and grieved , that [I]73-catherine can not still love [her]101-isabella , that [I]73-catherine am never to hear from [her]101-isabella , perhaps never to see [her]101-isabella again , [I]73-catherine do not feel so very , very much afflicted as [one]2201-one would have thought . ”[73-catherine]

“ [You]92-henry feel , as [you]92-henry always do , what is most to the credit of human nature . Such feelings ought to be investigated , that [they]1737-her two young friends may know [themselves]1737-her two young friends . ”[92-henry]

[Catherine]73-catherine , by some chance or other , found [her]1735-her spirits so very much relieved by this conversation that [she]1735-her could not regret [her]1735-her being led on , though so unaccountably , to mention the circumstance which had produced it .

CHAPTER 26

From this time , the subject was frequently canvassed by [the three young people]1736-the three young people ; and [Catherine]73-catherine found , with some surprise , that [[her]1735-her two young friends]1737-her two young friends were perfectly agreed in considering [Isabella]101-isabella ’s want of consequence and fortune as likely to throw great difficulties in the way of [her]101-isabella marrying [[their]1737-her two young friends brother]1738-their brother . [Their]1737-her two young friends persuasion that [the General]800-the general would , upon this ground alone , independent of the objection that might be raised against [her]101-isabella character , oppose the connection , turned [her]101-isabella feelings moreover with some alarm towards [herself]101-isabella . [She]101-isabella was as insignificant , and perhaps as portionless , as [Isabella]101-isabella ; and if [the heir of the Tilney property]1740-the heir of the tilney property had not grandeur and wealth enough in [himself]1740-the heir of the tilney property , at what point of interest were the demands of [[his]1740-the heir of the tilney property younger brother]1741-his younger brother to rest ? The very painful reflections to which this thought led could only be dispersed by a dependence on the effect of that particular partiality , which , as [she]101-isabella was given to understand by [his]800-the general words as well as [his]800-the general actions , [she]101-isabella had from the first been so fortunate as to excite in [the General]800-the general ; and by a recollection of some most generous and disinterested sentiments on the subject of money , which [she]101-isabella had more than once heard [him]800-the general utter , and which tempted [her]101-isabella to think [his]800-the general disposition in such matters misunderstood by [[his]800-the general children]1094-his children .

[They]1744-they were so fully convinced , however , that [[their]1744-they brother]1738-their brother would not have the courage to apply in person for [[his]1738-their brother father]881-his father ’s consent , and so repeatedly assured [her]101-isabella that [he]1738-their brother had never in [his]1738-their brother life been less likely to come to [Northanger]60-northanger than at the present time , that [she]101-isabella suffered [her]101-isabella mind to be at ease as to the necessity of any sudden removal of [her]101-isabella own . But as it was not to be supposed that [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney , whenever [he]74-captain tilney made [his]74-captain tilney application , would give [[his]1738-their brother father]881-his father any just idea of [Isabella]101-isabella ’s conduct , it occurred to [her]101-isabella as highly expedient that [Henry]92-henry should lay the whole business before [him]92-henry as it really was , enabling [the General]800-the general by that means to form a cool and impartial opinion , and prepare [his]800-the general objections on a fairer ground than inequality of situations . [She]101-isabella proposed it to [him]800-the general accordingly ; but [he]800-the general did not catch at the measure so eagerly as [she]101-isabella had expected . “ No , ”[800-the general] said [he]800-the general , “ [[my]800-the general father]2538-my father ’s hands need not be strengthened , and [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s confession of folly need not be forestalled . [He]800-the general must tell [his]800-the general own story . ”[800-the general]

“ But [he]800-the general will tell only half of it . ”[101-isabella]

“ A quarter would be enough . ”[800-the general]

A day or two passed away and brought no tidings of [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney . [[His]800-the general brother]1103-his brother and [sister]737-sister knew not what to think . Sometimes it appeared to [them]1751-them as if [his]800-the general silence would be the natural result of the suspected engagement , and at others that it was wholly incompatible with it . [The General]800-the general , meanwhile , though offended every morning by [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s remissness in writing , was free from any real anxiety about [him]800-the general , and had no more pressing solicitude than that of making [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s time at [Northanger]60-northanger pass pleasantly . [He]800-the general often expressed [his]800-the general uneasiness on this head , feared the sameness of [every day ’s society]1753-every day ’s society and employments would disgust [her]84-miss morland with [the place]2220-the place , wished [the Lady Frasers]169-the lady frasers had been in [the country]219-the country , talked every now and then of having a large party to dinner , and once or twice began even to calculate the number of [young dancing people]1756-young dancing people in [the neighbourhood]231-the neighbourhood . But then it was such a dead time of year , no wild - fowl , no game , and [the Lady Frasers]169-the lady frasers were not in [the country]219-the country . And it all ended , at last , in [his]800-the general telling [Henry]92-henry one morning that when [he]800-the general next went to [Woodston]62-woodston , [they]1759-they would take [him]800-the general by surprise there some day or other , and eat [their]1759-they mutton with [him]800-the general . [Henry]92-henry was greatly honoured and very happy , and [Catherine]73-catherine was quite delighted with the scheme . “ And when do [you]92-henry think , [sir]2221-sir , [I]73-catherine may look forward to this pleasure ? [I]73-catherine must be at [Woodston]62-woodston on Monday to attend the parish meeting , and shall probably be obliged to stay two or three days . ”[73-catherine]

“ Well , well , [we]3329-we will take [our]3329-we chance some one of those days . There is no need to fix . [You]92-henry are not to put [yourself]92-henry at all out of [your]92-henry way . Whatever [you]92-henry may happen to have in [the house]211-the house will be enough . [I]92-henry think [I]92-henry can answer for [the young ladies]559-the young ladies making allowance for [a bachelor]3332-a bachelor ’s table . Let [me]92-henry see ; Monday will be a busy day with [you]92-henry , [we]3329-we will not come on Monday ; and Tuesday will be a busy one with [me]92-henry . [I]92-henry expect [[my]92-henry surveyor]3333-my surveyor from [Brockham]170-brockham with [his]3333-my surveyor report in the morning ; and afterwards [I]92-henry can not in decency fail attending the club . [I]92-henry really could not face [my]92-henry acquaintance if [I]92-henry stayed away now ; for , as [I]92-henry am known to be in [the country]219-the country , it would be taken exceedingly amiss ; and it is a rule with [me]92-henry , [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , never to give offence to [any of [[my]92-henry neighbours]3336-my neighbours]3335-any of my neighbours , if a small sacrifice of time and attention can prevent it . [They]3336-my neighbours are a set of [very worthy men]3337-very worthy men . [They]3336-my neighbours have half a buck from [Northanger]60-northanger twice a year ; and [I]92-henry dine with [them]3336-my neighbours whenever [I]92-henry can . Tuesday , therefore , [we]3338-we may say is out of the question . But on Wednesday , [I]92-henry think , [Henry]92-henry , [you]92-henry may expect [us]3338-we ; and [we]3338-we shall be with [you]92-henry early , that [we]3338-we may have time to look about [us]3338-we . Two hours and three quarters will carry [us]3338-we to [Woodston]62-woodston , [I]92-henry suppose ; [we]3338-we shall be in [the carriage]558-the carriage by ten ; so , about a quarter before one on Wednesday , [you]92-henry may look for [us]3338-we . ”[92-henry]

A ball itself could not have been more welcome to [Catherine]73-catherine than this little excursion , so strong was [her]1760-her desire to be acquainted with [Woodston]62-woodston ; and [her]1760-her heart was still bounding with joy when [Henry]92-henry , about an hour afterwards , came booted and greatcoated into [the room where [she]1760-her and [Eleanor]142-eleanor were sitting]1761-the room where she and eleanor were sitting , and said , “ [I]92-henry am come , [young ladies]262-young ladies , in a very moralizing strain , to observe that [our]3338-we pleasures in [this world]2715-this world are always to be paid for , and that [we]3338-we often purchase them at a great disadvantage , giving ready - monied actual happiness for a draft on the future , that may not be honoured . Witness [myself]92-henry , at this present hour . Because [I]92-henry am to hope for the satisfaction of seeing [you]262-young ladies at [Woodston]62-woodston on Wednesday , which bad weather , or twenty other causes , may prevent , [I]92-henry must go away directly , two days before [I]92-henry intended it . ”[92-henry]

“ Go away ! ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , with a very long face . “ And why ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Why ! how can [you]92-henry ask the question ? Because no time is to be lost in frightening [[my]92-henry old housekeeper]3342-my old housekeeper out of [her]3342-my old housekeeper wits , because [I]92-henry must go and prepare a dinner for [you]262-young ladies , to be sure . ”[92-henry]

“ Oh ! not seriously ! ”[73-catherine]

“ Aye , and sadly too — for [I]92-henry had much rather stay . ”[92-henry]

“ But how can [you]92-henry think of such a thing , after what [the General]800-the general said ? When [he]800-the general so particularly desired [you]92-henry not to give [yourself]92-henry any trouble , because _ anything _ would do . ”[73-catherine]

[Henry]92-henry only smiled . “ [I]92-henry am sure it is quite unnecessary upon [[your]92-henry sister]2261-your sister ’s account and [mine]92-henry . [You]92-henry must know it to be so ; and [the General]800-the general made such a point of [your]92-henry providing nothing extraordinary : besides , if [he]800-the general had not said half so much as [he]800-the general did , [he]800-the general has always such an excellent dinner at [home]2403-home , that sitting down to a middling one for one day could not signify . ”[92-henry]

“ [I]92-henry wish [I]92-henry could reason like [you]92-henry , for [his]800-the general sake and [my]92-henry own . Good - bye . As to - morrow is Sunday , [Eleanor]142-eleanor , [I]92-henry shall not return . ”[92-henry]

[He]92-henry went ; and , it being at any time a much simpler operation to [Catherine]73-catherine to doubt [her]1762-her own judgment than [Henry]92-henry ’s , [she]1762-her was very soon obliged to give [him]92-henry credit for being right , however disagreeable to [her]1762-her [his]92-henry going . But the inexplicability of [the General]800-the general ’s conduct dwelt much on [her]1762-her thoughts . That [he]92-henry was very particular in [his]92-henry eating , [she]1762-her had , by [her]1762-her own unassisted observation , already discovered ; but why [he]92-henry should say one thing so positively , and mean another all the while , was most unaccountable ! how were [people]320-people , at that rate , to be understood ? Who but [Henry]92-henry could have been aware of what [[his]92-henry father]881-his father was at ?

From Saturday to Wednesday , however , [they]1766-they were now to be without [Henry]92-henry . This was the sad finale of every reflection : and [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney ’s letter would certainly come in [his]92-henry absence ; and Wednesday [she]1762-her was very sure would be wet . The past , present , and future were all equally in gloom . [[Her]1762-her brother]2287-her brother so unhappy , and [her]1762-her loss in [Isabella]101-isabella so great ; and [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s spirits always affected by [Henry]92-henry ’s absence ! what was there to interest or amuse [her]1762-her ? [She]1762-her was tired of [the woods]1768-the woods and the shrubberies — always so smooth and so dry ; and [the abbey]3091-the abbey in [itself]3091-the abbey was no more to [her]1762-her now than [any other house]1770-any other house . The painful remembrance of the folly it had helped to nourish and perfect was the only emotion which could spring from a consideration of [the building]1283-the building . What a revolution in [her]1762-her ideas ! [she]1762-her , who had so longed to be in [an abbey]1157-an abbey ! now , there was nothing so charming to [her]1762-her imagination as the unpretending comfort of [a well - connected parsonage]1773-a well - connected parsonage , something like [Fullerton]3-fullerton , but better : [Fullerton]3-fullerton had its faults , but [Woodston]62-woodston probably had none . If Wednesday should ever come !

It did come , and exactly when it might be reasonably looked for . It came — it was fine — and [Catherine]73-catherine trod on air . By ten o’clock , the chaise and four conveyed [the trio]1774-the trio from [the abbey]3091-the abbey ; and , after an agreeable drive of almost twenty miles , [they]1774-the trio entered [Woodston]62-woodston , [a large and populous village]1776-a large and populous village , in a situation not unpleasant . [Catherine]73-catherine was ashamed to say how pretty [she]1762-her thought it , as [the General]800-the general seemed to think an apology necessary for the flatness of [the country]219-the country , and the size of [the village]1779-the village ; but in [her]1762-her heart [she]1762-her preferred [it]1780-it to [any place [she]1762-her had ever been at]1781-any place she had ever been at , and looked with great admiration at [every neat house above the rank of [a cottage]1783-a cottage]1782-every neat house above the rank of a cottage , and at [all [the little chandler]1785-the little chandler ’s shops which [they]1774-the trio passed]1784-all the little chandler ’s shops which they passed . At [the further end of [the village]1779-the village]1786-the further end of the village , and tolerably disengaged from [the rest of [it]1779-the village]1788-the rest of it , stood [the parsonage]1789-the parsonage , [a new - built substantial stone house , with [its]1789-the parsonage semicircular sweep and green gates]1790-a new - built substantial stone house , with its semicircular sweep and green gates ; and , as [they]1774-the trio drove up to the door , [Henry]92-henry , with [the friends of [his]92-henry solitude]1791-the friends of his solitude , [a large Newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers]1792-a large newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers , was ready to receive and make much of them .

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s mind was too full , as [she]1762-her entered [the house]211-the house , for [her]1762-her either to observe or to say a great deal ; and , till called on by [the General]800-the general for [her]1762-her opinion of it , [she]1762-her had very little idea of [the room in which [she]1762-her was sitting]1795-the room in which she was sitting . Upon looking round [it]1795-the room in which she was sitting then , [she]1762-her perceived in a moment that [it]1795-the room in which she was sitting was [the most comfortable room in [the world]191-the world]1796-the most comfortable room in the world ; but [she]1762-her was too guarded to say so , and the coldness of [her]1762-her praise disappointed [him]800-the general .

“ [We]3347-we are not calling it [a good house]3348-a good house , ”[800-the general] said [he]800-the general . “ [We]3347-we are not comparing [it]211-the house with [Fullerton]3-fullerton and [Northanger]60-northanger — [we]3347-we are considering [it]211-the house as [a mere parsonage]3349-a mere parsonage , small and confined , [we]3347-we allow , but decent , perhaps , and habitable ; and altogether not inferior to the generality ; or , in other words , [I]800-the general believe there are [few country parsonages in [England]2-england]3350-few country parsonages in england half so good . It may admit of improvement , however . Far be it from [me]800-the general to say otherwise ; and anything in reason — a bow thrown out , perhaps — though , between [ourselves]3347-we , if there is one thing more than another [my]800-the general aversion , it is a patched - on bow . ”[800-the general]

[Catherine]73-catherine did not hear enough of this speech to understand or be pained by it ; and other subjects being studiously brought forward and supported by [Henry]92-henry , at the same time that a tray full of refreshments was introduced by [[his]92-henry servant]1798-his servant , [the General]800-the general was shortly restored to [his]800-the general complacency , and [Catherine]73-catherine to all [her]1800-she usual ease of spirits .

[The room in question]1801-the room in question was of a commodious , well - proportioned size , and handsomely fitted up as [a dining - parlour]1802-a dining - parlour ; and on [their]1803-their quitting it to walk round [the grounds]1406-the grounds , [she]1800-she was shown , first into [a smaller apartment]1805-a smaller apartment , belonging peculiarly to [the master of [the house]211-the house]1806-the master of the house , and made unusually tidy on the occasion ; and afterwards into what was to be [the drawing - room]445-the drawing - room , with the appearance of which , though unfurnished , [Catherine]73-catherine was delighted enough even to satisfy [the General]800-the general . It was [a prettily shaped room]1810-a prettily shaped room , the windows reaching to the ground , and the view from [them]1811-them pleasant , though only over [green meadows]1812-green meadows ; and [she]1800-she expressed [her]1800-she admiration at the moment with all the honest simplicity with which [she]1800-she felt it . “ Oh ! why do not [you]800-the general fit up [this room]2242-this room , [Mr. Tilney]92-henry ? What a pity not to have [it]2242-this room fitted up ! it is [the prettiest room]3352-the prettiest room [I]1800-she ever saw ; [it]2242-this room is [the prettiest room in [the world]191-the world]3353-the prettiest room in the world ! ”[1800-she]

“ [I]800-the general trust , ”[800-the general] said [the General]800-the general , with a most satisfied smile , “ that [it]2242-this room will very speedily be furnished : [it]2242-this room waits only for [a lady]634-a lady ’s taste ! ”[800-the general]

“ Well , if it was [[my]1800-she house]3356-my house , [I]1800-she should never sit anywhere else . Oh ! what [a sweet little cottage]3357-a sweet little cottage there is among the trees — apple trees , too ! it is [the prettiest cottage]3358-the prettiest cottage ! ”[1800-she]

“ [You]800-the general like [it]2242-this room — [you]800-the general approve it as an object — it is enough . [Henry]92-henry , remember that [Robinson]171-robinson is spoken to about [it]2242-this room . [The cottage]3359-the cottage remains . ”[800-the general]

Such a compliment recalled all [Catherine]73-catherine ’s consciousness , and silenced [her]1814-she directly ; and , though pointedly applied to by [the General]800-the general for [her]1814-she choice of the prevailing colour of the paper and hangings , nothing like an opinion on the subject could be drawn from [her]1814-she . The influence of fresh objects and fresh air , however , was of great use in dissipating these embarrassing associations ; and , having reached the ornamental part of [the premises]3066-the premises , consisting of a walk round two sides of [a meadow]1817-a meadow , on which [[Henry]92-henry ’s genius]1818-henry ’s genius had begun to act about half a year ago , [she]1814-she was sufficiently recovered to think [it]1819-it prettier than [any pleasure - ground [she]1814-she had ever been in before]1820-any pleasure - ground she had ever been in before , though there was not a shrub in [it]1819-it higher than the green bench in the corner .

A saunter into [other meadows]1821-other meadows , and through [part of [the village]1779-the village]1822-part of the village , with a visit to [the stables]3226-the stables to examine some improvements , and a charming game of play with a litter of puppies just able to roll about , brought [them]1825-they to four o’clock , when [Catherine]73-catherine scarcely thought it could be three . At four [they]1825-they were to dine , and at six to set off on [their]1825-they return . Never had any day passed so quickly !

[She]1814-she could not but observe that the abundance of the dinner did not seem to create the smallest astonishment in [the General]800-the general ; nay , that [he]800-the general was even looking at the side - table for cold meat which was not there . [[His]800-the general son]2708-his son and [daughter]937-daughter ’s observations were of a different kind . [They]1825-they had seldom seen [him]800-the general eat so heartily at any table but [his]800-the general own , and never before known [him]800-the general so little disconcerted by the melted butter ’s being oiled .

At six o’clock , [the General]800-the general having taken [his]800-the general coffee , [the carriage]558-the carriage again received them ; and so gratifying had been the tenor of [his]800-the general conduct throughout the whole visit , so well assured was [her]1814-she mind on the subject of [his]800-the general expectations , that , could [she]1814-she have felt equally confident of the wishes of [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son , [Catherine]73-catherine would have quitted [Woodston]62-woodston with little anxiety as to the How or the When [she]1814-she might return to [it]62-woodston .

CHAPTER 27

The next morning brought the following very unexpected letter from [Isabella]101-isabella :

_ [Bath]5-bath , April _

[[My]0-i dearest]2292-my dearest [Catherine]73-catherine , [I]0-i received [your]73-catherine two kind letters with the greatest delight , and have a thousand apologies to make for not answering them sooner . [I]0-i really am quite ashamed of [my]0-i idleness ; but in this horrid place one can find time for nothing . [I]0-i have had [my]0-i pen in [my]0-i hand to begin a letter to [you]73-catherine almost every day since [you]73-catherine left [Bath]5-bath , but have always been prevented by some silly trifler or other . Pray write to [me]0-i soon , and direct to [[my]0-i own home]2605-my own home . Thank [God]127-god , [we]1834-we leave [this vile place]1835-this vile place to - morrow . Since [you]73-catherine went away , [I]0-i have had no pleasure in it — the dust is beyond anything ; and [everybody one]1836-everybody one cares for is gone . [I]0-i believe if [I]0-i could see [you]73-catherine [I]0-i should not mind the rest , for [you]73-catherine are dearer to [me]0-i than [anybody]192-anybody can conceive . [I]0-i am quite uneasy about [[your]73-catherine dear brother]2861-your dear brother , not having heard from [him]2861-your dear brother since [he]2861-your dear brother went to [Oxford]10-oxford ; and am fearful of some misunderstanding . [Your]73-catherine kind offices will set all right : [he]2861-your dear brother is [the only man [I]0-i ever did or could love]1839-the only man i ever did or could love , and [I]0-i trust [you]73-catherine will convince [him]2861-your dear brother of it . The spring fashions are partly down ; and the hats the most frightful [you]73-catherine can imagine . [I]0-i hope [you]73-catherine spend [your]73-catherine time pleasantly , but am afraid [you]73-catherine never think of [me]0-i . [I]0-i will not say all that [I]0-i could of [the family [you]73-catherine are with]1840-the family you are with , because [I]0-i would not be ungenerous , or set [you]73-catherine against [those [you]73-catherine esteem]1841-those you esteem ; but it is very difficult to know whom to trust , and [young men]532-young men never know [their]532-young men minds two days together . [I]0-i rejoice to say that [the young man whom , of all others]1843-the young man whom , of all others , [I]0-i particularly abhor , has left [Bath]5-bath . [You]73-catherine will know , from this description , [I]0-i must mean [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney , who , as [you]73-catherine may remember , was amazingly disposed to follow and tease [me]0-i , before [you]73-catherine went away . Afterwards [he]74-captain tilney got worse , and became quite [my]0-i shadow . [Many girls]1844-many girls might have been taken in , for never were such attentions ; but [I]0-i knew the fickle sex too well . [He]74-captain tilney went away to [[his]74-captain tilney regiment]3082-his regiment two days ago , and [I]0-i trust [I]0-i shall never be plagued with [him]74-captain tilney again . [He]74-captain tilney is [the greatest coxcomb [I]0-i ever saw]1846-the greatest coxcomb i ever saw , and amazingly disagreeable . The last two days [he]74-captain tilney was always by the side of [Charlotte Davis]172-charlotte davis : [I]0-i pitied [his]74-captain tilney taste , but took no notice of [him]74-captain tilney . The last time [we]1847-we met was in [Bath Street]69-bath street , and [I]0-i turned directly into [a shop]1848-a shop that [he]74-captain tilney might not speak to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i would not even look at [him]74-captain tilney . [He]74-captain tilney went into [the pump - room]357-the pump - room afterwards ; but [I]0-i would not have followed [him]74-captain tilney for all [the world]191-the world . Such a contrast between [him]74-captain tilney and [[your]1851-your brother]2395-your brother ! pray send [me]0-i some news of [the latter]562-the latter — [I]0-i am quite unhappy about [him]74-captain tilney ; [he]74-captain tilney seemed so uncomfortable when [he]74-captain tilney went away , with a cold , or something that affected [his]74-captain tilney spirits . [I]0-i would write to [him]74-captain tilney [myself]0-i , but have mislaid [his]74-captain tilney direction ; and , as [I]0-i hinted above , am afraid [he]74-captain tilney took something in [my]0-i conduct amiss . Pray explain everything to [his]74-captain tilney satisfaction ; or , if [he]74-captain tilney still harbours any doubt , a line from [himself]74-captain tilney to [me]0-i , or a call at [Putney]56-putney when next in [town]2354-town , might set all to rights . [I]0-i have not been to the Rooms this age , nor to the play , except going in last night with [the Hodges]1855-the hodges , for a frolic , at half price : [they]1855-the hodges teased [me]0-i into it ; and [I]0-i was determined [they]1855-the hodges should not say [I]0-i shut [myself]0-i up because [Tilney]74-captain tilney was gone . [We]1856-we happened to sit by [the Mitchells]141-the mitchells , and [they]1855-the hodges pretended to be quite surprised to see [me]0-i out . [I]0-i knew [their]1855-the hodges spite : at one time [they]1855-the hodges could not be civil to [me]0-i , but now [they]1855-the hodges are all friendship ; but [I]0-i am not such a fool as to be taken in by [them]1855-the hodges . [You]1857-you know [I]0-i have a pretty good spirit of [my]0-i own . [Anne Mitchell]173-anne mitchell had tried to put on a turban like [mine]0-i , as [I]0-i wore it the week before at the Concert , but made wretched work of it — it happened to become [my]0-i odd face , [I]0-i believe , at least [Tilney]74-captain tilney told [me]0-i so at the time , and said every eye was upon [me]0-i ; but [he]74-captain tilney is [the last man whose word [I]0-i would take]1858-the last man whose word i would take . [I]0-i wear nothing but purple now : [I]0-i know [I]0-i look hideous in it , but no matter — it is [[your]1857-you dear brother]2861-your dear brother ’s favourite colour . Lose no time , [[my]0-i dearest]2292-my dearest , sweetest [Catherine]73-catherine , in writing to [him]2861-your dear brother and to [me]0-i ,

Who ever am , etc .

Such a strain of shallow artifice could not impose even upon [Catherine]73-catherine . Its inconsistencies , contradictions , and falsehood struck [her]2292-my dearest from the very first . [She]2292-my dearest was ashamed of [Isabella]101-isabella , and ashamed of having ever loved [her]101-isabella . [Her]2292-my dearest professions of attachment were now as disgusting as [her]2292-my dearest excuses were empty , and [her]2292-my dearest demands impudent . “ Write to [James]103-james on [her]101-isabella behalf ! no , [James]103-james should never hear [Isabella]101-isabella ’s name mentioned by [her]101-isabella again . ”[2292-my dearest]

On [Henry]92-henry ’s arrival from [Woodston]62-woodston , [she]2292-my dearest made known to [him]92-henry and [Eleanor]142-eleanor [[their]1861-their brother]1738-their brother ’s safety , congratulating [them]1861-their with sincerity on it , and reading aloud the most material passages of [her]2292-my dearest letter with strong indignation . When [she]2292-my dearest had finished it—“So much for [Isabella]101-isabella , ”[2292-my dearest] [she]2292-my dearest cried , “ and for all [our]3360-our intimacy ! [she]2292-my dearest must think [me]2292-my dearest [an idiot]3361-an idiot , or [she]2292-my dearest could not have written so ; but perhaps this has served to make [her]2292-my dearest character better known to [me]2292-my dearest than [mine]2292-my dearest is to [her]2292-my dearest . [I]2292-my dearest see what [she]2292-my dearest has been about . [She]2292-my dearest is [a vain coquette]3362-a vain coquette , and [her]2292-my dearest tricks have not answered . [I]2292-my dearest do not believe [she]2292-my dearest had ever any regard either for [James]103-james or for [me]2292-my dearest , and [I]2292-my dearest wish [I]2292-my dearest had never known [her]2292-my dearest . ”[2292-my dearest]

“ It will soon be as if [you]92-henry never had , ”[92-henry] said [Henry]92-henry .

“ There is but one thing that [I]2292-my dearest can not understand . [I]2292-my dearest see that [she]2292-my dearest has had designs on [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney , which have not succeeded ; but [I]2292-my dearest do not understand what [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney has been about all this time . Why should [he]74-captain tilney pay [her]2292-my dearest such attentions as to make [her]2292-my dearest quarrel with [[my]2292-my dearest brother]2349-my brother , and then fly off [himself]74-captain tilney ? ”[2292-my dearest]

“ [I]2292-my dearest have very little to say for [Frederick]74-captain tilney ’s motives , such as [I]2292-my dearest believe them to have been . [He]74-captain tilney has [his]74-captain tilney vanities as well as [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe , and the chief difference is , that , having a stronger head , [they]3364-they have not yet injured [himself]74-captain tilney . If the _ effect _ of [his]74-captain tilney behaviour does not justify [him]74-captain tilney with [you]92-henry , [we]3365-we had better not seek after the cause . ”[2292-my dearest]

“ Then [you]92-henry do not suppose [he]74-captain tilney ever really cared about [her]2292-my dearest ? ”[2292-my dearest]

“ [I]2292-my dearest am persuaded that [he]74-captain tilney never did . ”[2292-my dearest]

“ And only made believe to do so for mischief ’s sake ? ”[2292-my dearest]

[Henry]92-henry bowed [his]92-henry assent .

“ Well , then , [I]2292-my dearest must say that [I]2292-my dearest do not like [him]74-captain tilney at all . Though it has turned out so well for [us]3365-we , [I]2292-my dearest do not like [him]74-captain tilney at all . As it happens , there is no great harm done , because [I]2292-my dearest do not think [Isabella]101-isabella has any heart to lose . But , suppose [he]74-captain tilney had made [her]101-isabella very much in love with [him]74-captain tilney ? ”[2292-my dearest]

“ But [we]3365-we must first suppose [Isabella]101-isabella to have had a heart to lose — consequently to have been [a very different creature]3366-a very different creature ; and , in that case , [she]101-isabella would have met with very different treatment . ”[2292-my dearest]

“ It is very right that [you]2292-my dearest should stand by [[your]2292-my dearest brother]2395-your brother . ”[2292-my dearest]

“ And if [you]73-catherine would stand by _ [yours]73-catherine _ , [you]73-catherine would not be much distressed by the disappointment of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe . But [your]73-catherine mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity , and therefore not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality , or a desire of revenge . ”[2292-my dearest]

[Catherine]73-catherine was complimented out of further bitterness . [Frederick]74-captain tilney could not be unpardonably guilty , while [Henry]92-henry made [himself]92-henry so agreeable . [She]1863-she resolved on not answering [Isabella]101-isabella ’s letter , and tried to think no more of it .

CHAPTER 28

Soon after this , [the General]800-the general found [himself]800-the general obliged to go to [London]11-london for a week ; and [he]800-the general left [Northanger]60-northanger earnestly regretting that any necessity should rob [him]800-the general even for an hour of [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s company , and anxiously recommending the study of [her]84-miss morland comfort and amusement to [[his]800-the general children]1094-his children as [their]1094-his children chief object in [his]800-the general absence . [His]800-the general departure gave [Catherine]73-catherine the first experimental conviction that a loss may be sometimes a gain . The happiness with which [their]1866-their time now passed , every employment voluntary , every laugh indulged , every meal a scene of ease and good humour , walking where [they]1866-their liked and when [they]1866-their liked , [their]1866-their hours , pleasures , and fatigues at [their]1866-their own command , made [her]1867-her thoroughly sensible of the restraint which [the General]800-the general ’s presence had imposed , and most thankfully feel [their]1866-their present release from it . Such ease and such delights made [her]1867-her love [the place]2220-the place and [the people]1870-the people more and more every day ; and had it not been for a dread of [its]1871-its soon becoming expedient to leave [the one]1872-the one , and an apprehension of not being equally beloved by the other , [she]1867-her would at each moment of each day have been perfectly happy ; but [she]1867-her was now in the fourth week of [her]1867-her visit ; before [the General]800-the general came [home]2403-home , the fourth week would be turned , and perhaps it might seem an intrusion if [she]1867-her stayed much longer . This was a painful consideration whenever it occurred ; and eager to get rid of such a weight on [her]1867-her mind , [she]1867-her very soon resolved to speak to [Eleanor]142-eleanor about it at once , propose going away , and be guided in [her]1867-her conduct by the manner in which [her]1867-her proposal might be taken .

Aware that if [she]1867-her gave [herself]1867-her much time , [she]1867-her might feel it difficult to bring forward so unpleasant a subject , [she]1867-her took the first opportunity of being suddenly alone with [Eleanor]142-eleanor , and of [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s being in the middle of a speech about something very different , to start forth [her]1867-her obligation of going away very soon . [Eleanor]142-eleanor looked and declared [herself]142-eleanor much concerned . [She]1867-her had “ hoped for the pleasure of [her]1867-her company for a much longer time — had been misled ( perhaps by [her]1867-her wishes ) to suppose that a much longer visit had been promised — and could not but think that if [Mr.]3368-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland were aware of the pleasure it was to [her]1867-her to have [her]1867-her [there]2232-there , [they]3370-they would be too generous to hasten [her]1867-her return . ”[73-catherine] [Catherine]73-catherine explained : “ Oh ! as to _ that _ , [Papa]136-papa and [Mamma]137-mamma were in no hurry at all . As long as [she]1867-her was happy , [they]3370-they would always be satisfied . ”[73-catherine]

“ Then why , might [she]1867-her ask , in such a hurry [herself]1867-her to leave [them]3370-they ? ”[73-catherine]

“ Oh ! because [she]1867-her had been [there]2232-there so long . ”[73-catherine]

“ Nay , if [you]1875-her can use such a word , [I]73-catherine can urge [you]1875-her no farther . If [you]1875-her think it long — ”[73-catherine]

“ Oh ! no , [I]73-catherine do not indeed . For [my]73-catherine own pleasure , [I]73-catherine could stay with [you]1875-her as long again . ”[73-catherine] And it was directly settled that , till [she]1875-her had , [her]1875-her leaving [them]1876-them was not even to be thought of . In having this cause of uneasiness so pleasantly removed , the force of the other was likewise weakened . The kindness , the earnestness of [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s manner in pressing [her]1875-her to stay , and [Henry]92-henry ’s gratified look on being told that [her]1875-her stay was determined , were such sweet proofs of [her]1875-her importance with [them]1876-them , as left [her]1875-her only just so much solicitude as [the human mind]1877-the human mind can never do comfortably without . [She]1875-her did — almost always — believe that [Henry]92-henry loved [her]1875-her , and quite always that [[his]92-henry father]881-his father and sister loved and even wished [her]1875-her to belong to [them]1876-them ; and believing so far , [her]1875-her doubts and anxieties were merely sportive irritations .

[Henry]92-henry was not able to obey [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s injunction of remaining wholly at [Northanger]60-northanger in attendance on [the ladies]312-the ladies , during [his]92-henry absence in [London]11-london , the engagements of [[his]92-henry curate at [Woodston]62-woodston]1881-his curate at woodston obliging [him]92-henry to leave [them]1876-them on Saturday for a couple of nights . [His]92-henry loss was not now what it had been while [the General]800-the general was at [home]2403-home ; it lessened [their]1876-them gaiety , but did not ruin [their]1876-them comfort ; and [the two girls]1884-the two girls agreeing in occupation , and improving in intimacy , found [themselves]1884-the two girls so well sufficient for the time to [themselves]1884-the two girls , that it was eleven o’clock , rather a late hour at [the abbey]3091-the abbey , before [they]1884-the two girls quitted [the supper - room]1886-the supper - room on the day of [Henry]92-henry ’s departure . [They]1884-the two girls had just reached the head of the stairs when it seemed , as far as the thickness of the walls would allow [them]1884-the two girls to judge , that [a carriage]683-a carriage was driving up to the door , and the next moment confirmed the idea by the loud noise of the house - bell . After the first perturbation of surprise had passed away , in a “ Good heaven ! what can be the matter ? ”[142-eleanor] it was quickly decided by [Eleanor]142-eleanor to be [[her]1888-her eldest brother]426-her eldest brother , whose arrival was often as sudden , if not quite so unseasonable , and accordingly [she]1888-her hurried down to welcome [him]426-her eldest brother .

[Catherine]73-catherine walked on to [[her]1888-her chamber]1890-her chamber , making up [her]1888-her mind as well as [she]1888-her could , to a further acquaintance with [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney , and comforting [herself]1888-her under the unpleasant impression [his]74-captain tilney conduct had given [her]1888-her , and the persuasion of [his]74-captain tilney being by far too fine a gentleman to approve of [her]1888-her , that at least [they]1884-the two girls should not meet under such circumstances as would make [their]1884-the two girls meeting materially painful . [She]1888-her trusted [he]74-captain tilney would never speak of [Miss Thorpe]95-miss thorpe ; and indeed , as [he]74-captain tilney must by this time be ashamed of the part [he]74-captain tilney had acted , there could be no danger of it ; and as long as all mention of Bath scenes were avoided , [she]1888-her thought [she]1888-her could behave to [him]74-captain tilney very civilly . In such considerations time passed away , and it was certainly in [his]74-captain tilney favour that [Eleanor]142-eleanor should be so glad to see [him]74-captain tilney , and have so much to say , for half an hour was almost gone since [his]74-captain tilney arrival , and [Eleanor]142-eleanor did not come up .

At that moment [Catherine]73-catherine thought [she]1888-her heard [her]1888-her step in [the gallery]1367-the gallery , and listened for its continuance ; but all was silent . Scarcely , however , had [she]1888-her convicted [her]1888-her fancy of error , when the noise of something moving close to [her]1888-her door made [her]1888-her start ; it seemed as if [someone]1670-someone was touching the very doorway — and in another moment a slight motion of the lock proved that some hand must be on it . [She]1888-her trembled a little at the idea of [anyone]2932-anyone ’s approaching so cautiously ; but resolving not to be again overcome by trivial appearances of alarm , or misled by a raised imagination , [she]1888-her stepped quietly forward , and opened the door . [Eleanor]142-eleanor , and only [Eleanor]142-eleanor , stood there . [Catherine]73-catherine ’s spirits , however , were tranquillized but for an instant , for [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s cheeks were pale , and [her]1888-her manner greatly agitated . Though evidently intending to come in , it seemed an effort to enter [the room]301-the room , and a still greater to speak when there . [Catherine]73-catherine , supposing some uneasiness on [Captain Tilney]74-captain tilney ’s account , could only express [her]1888-her concern by silent attention , obliged [her]1888-her to be seated , rubbed [her]1888-her temples with lavender water , and hung over [her]1888-her with affectionate solicitude . “ [[My]73-catherine dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , [you]73-catherine must not — [you]73-catherine must not indeed — ”[73-catherine] were [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s first connected words . “ [I]73-catherine am quite well . This kindness distracts [me]73-catherine — [I]73-catherine can not bear it — [I]73-catherine come to [you]73-catherine on such an errand ! ”[73-catherine]

“ Errand ! to [me]1888-her ! ”[1888-her]

“ How shall [I]73-catherine tell [you]73-catherine ! oh ! how shall [I]73-catherine tell [you]73-catherine ! ”[73-catherine]

A new idea now darted into [Catherine]73-catherine ’s mind , and turning as pale as [[her]1888-her friend]305-her friend , [she]1888-her exclaimed , “ ’ Tis [a messenger from [Woodston]62-woodston]3373-a messenger from woodston ! ”[1888-her]

“ [You]73-catherine are mistaken , indeed , ”[142-eleanor] returned [Eleanor]142-eleanor , looking at [her]1888-her most compassionately ; “ it is [no one from [Woodston]62-woodston]3374-no one from woodston . It is [[my]142-eleanor father]2538-my father [himself]305-her friend . ”[142-eleanor] [Her]1888-her voice faltered , and [her]1888-her eyes were turned to the ground as [she]1888-her mentioned [his]305-her friend name . [His]305-her friend unlooked - for return was enough in itself to make [Catherine]73-catherine ’s heart sink , and for a few moments [she]1888-her hardly supposed there were anything worse to be told . [She]1888-her said nothing ; and [Eleanor]142-eleanor , endeavouring to collect [herself]142-eleanor and speak with firmness , but with eyes still cast down , soon went on . “ [You]73-catherine are too good , [I]142-eleanor am sure , to think the worse of [me]142-eleanor for the part [I]142-eleanor am obliged to perform . [I]142-eleanor am indeed [a most unwilling messenger]3376-a most unwilling messenger . After what has so lately passed , so lately been settled between [us]3377-we — how joyfully , how thankfully on [my]142-eleanor side!—as to [your]73-catherine continuing here as [I]142-eleanor hoped for many , many weeks longer , how can [I]142-eleanor tell [you]73-catherine that [your]73-catherine kindness is not to be accepted — and that the happiness [[your]73-catherine company]3378-your company has hitherto given [us]3377-we is to be repaid by — But [I]142-eleanor must not trust [myself]142-eleanor with words . [[My]142-eleanor dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , [we]3377-we are to part . [[My]142-eleanor father]2538-my father has recollected an engagement that takes [[our]3377-we whole family]3381-our whole family away on Monday . [We]3377-we are going to [Lord Longtown]174-lord longtown ’s , near [Hereford]70-hereford , for a fortnight . Explanation and apology are equally impossible . [I]142-eleanor can not attempt either . ”[142-eleanor]

“ [[My]73-catherine dear]2185-my dear [Eleanor]142-eleanor , ”[73-catherine] cried [Catherine]73-catherine , suppressing [her]1896-i feelings as well as [she]1896-i could , “ do not be so distressed . A second engagement must give way to a first . [I]73-catherine am very , very sorry [we]3377-we are to part — so soon , and so suddenly too ; but [I]73-catherine am not offended , indeed [I]73-catherine am not . [I]73-catherine can finish [my]73-catherine visit here , [you]142-eleanor know , at any time ; or [I]73-catherine hope [you]142-eleanor will come to [me]73-catherine . Can [you]142-eleanor , when [you]142-eleanor return from [this lord]3383-this lord ’s , come to [Fullerton]3-fullerton ? ”[73-catherine]

“ It will not be in [my]142-eleanor power , [Catherine]73-catherine . ”[142-eleanor]

“ Come when [you]73-catherine can , then . ”[73-catherine]

[Eleanor]142-eleanor made no answer ; and [Catherine]73-catherine ’s thoughts recurring to something more directly interesting , [she]1896-i added , thinking aloud , “ Monday — so soon as Monday ; and [you]142-eleanor _ all _ go . Well , [I]1896-i am certain of — [I]1896-i shall be able to take leave , however . [I]1896-i need not go till just before [you]142-eleanor do , [you]142-eleanor know . Do not be distressed , [Eleanor]142-eleanor , [I]1896-i can go on Monday very well . [[My]1896-i father]2538-my father and [mother]183-mother ’s having no notice of it is of very little consequence . [The General]800-the general will send [a servant]685-a servant with [me]1896-i , [I]1896-i dare say , half the way — and then [I]1896-i shall soon be at [Salisbury]8-salisbury , and then [I]1896-i am only nine miles from [home]2403-home . ”[1896-i]

“ Ah , [Catherine]73-catherine ! were it settled so , it would be somewhat less intolerable , though in such common attentions [you]73-catherine would have received but half what [you]73-catherine ought . But — how can [I]142-eleanor tell [you?—to]3389-you?—to - morrow morning is fixed for [your]73-catherine leaving [us]3390-us , and not even the hour is left to [your]73-catherine choice ; [the very carriage]3391-the very carriage is ordered , and will be here at seven o’clock , and [no servant]3392-no servant will be offered [you]73-catherine . ”[142-eleanor]

[Catherine]73-catherine sat down , breathless and speechless . “ [I]73-catherine could hardly believe [my]73-catherine senses , when [I]73-catherine heard it ; and no displeasure , no resentment that [you]73-catherine can feel at this moment , however justly great , can be more than [I]73-catherine [myself]73-catherine — but [I]73-catherine must not talk of what [I]73-catherine felt . Oh ! that [I]73-catherine could suggest anything in extenuation ! good God ! what will [[your]73-catherine father]2706-your father and [mother]183-mother say ! after courting [you]73-catherine from the protection of [real friends]3395-real friends to this — almost double distance from [[your]73-catherine home]3396-your home , to have [you]73-catherine driven out of [the house]211-the house , without the considerations even of decent civility ! dear , dear [Catherine]73-catherine , in being [the bearer of such a message]3398-the bearer of such a message , [I]73-catherine seem guilty [myself]73-catherine of all its insult ; yet , [I]73-catherine trust [you]73-catherine will acquit [me]73-catherine , for [you]73-catherine must have been long enough in [this house]3399-this house to see that [I]73-catherine am but [a nominal mistress of it]3400-a nominal mistress of it , that [my]73-catherine real power is nothing . ”[73-catherine]

“ Have [I]73-catherine offended [the General]800-the general ? ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine in a faltering voice .

“ Alas ! for [my]142-eleanor feelings as [a daughter]1648-a daughter , all that [I]142-eleanor know , all that [I]142-eleanor answer for , is that [you]73-catherine can have given [him]800-the general no just cause of offence . [He]800-the general certainly is greatly , very greatly discomposed ; [I]142-eleanor have seldom seen [him]800-the general more so . [His]800-the general temper is not happy , and something has now occurred to ruffle it in an uncommon degree ; some disappointment , some vexation , which just at this moment seems important , but which [I]142-eleanor can hardly suppose [you]73-catherine to have any concern in , for how is it possible ? ”[142-eleanor]

It was with pain that [Catherine]73-catherine could speak at all ; and it was only for [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s sake that [she]1897-i attempted it . “ [I]1897-i am sure , ”[1897-i] said [she]1897-i , “ [I]1897-i am very sorry if [I]1897-i have offended [him]800-the general . It was the last thing [I]1897-i would willingly have done . But do not be unhappy , [Eleanor]142-eleanor . An engagement , [you]73-catherine know , must be kept . [I]1897-i am only sorry it was not recollected sooner , that [I]1897-i might have written [home]2403-home . But it is of very little consequence . ”[1897-i]

“ [I]142-eleanor hope , [I]142-eleanor earnestly hope , that to [your]73-catherine real safety it will be of none ; but to everything else it is of the greatest consequence : to comfort , appearance , propriety , to [[your]73-catherine family]3299-your family , to [the world]191-the world . Were [[your]73-catherine friends]3406-your friends , [the Allens]104-the allens , still in [Bath]5-bath , [you]73-catherine might go to [them]3406-your friends with comparative ease ; a few hours would take [you]73-catherine [there]2232-there ; but a journey of seventy miles , to be taken post by [you]73-catherine , at [your]73-catherine age , alone , unattended ! ”[142-eleanor]

“ Oh , the journey is nothing . Do not think about that . And if [we]1899-they are to part , a few hours sooner or later , [you]73-catherine know , makes no difference . [I]142-eleanor can be ready by seven . Let [me]142-eleanor be called in time . ”[142-eleanor] [Eleanor]142-eleanor saw that [she]1898-her wished to be alone ; and believing it better for each that [they]1899-they should avoid any further conversation , now left [her]1898-her with , “ [I]1898-her shall see [you]73-catherine in the morning . ”[1898-her]

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s swelling heart needed relief . In [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s presence friendship and pride had equally restrained [her]1898-her tears , but no sooner was [she]1898-her gone than they burst forth in torrents . Turned from [the house]211-the house , and in such a way ! without any reason that could justify , any apology that could atone for the abruptness , the rudeness , nay , the insolence of it . [Henry]92-henry at a distance — not able even to bid [him]92-henry farewell . Every hope , every expectation from [him]92-henry suspended , at least , and who could say how long ? Who could say when [they]1899-they might meet again ? And all this by [such a man as [General Tilney]138-general tilney , so polite , so well bred , and heretofore so particularly fond of [her]1898-her]1901-such a man as general tilney , so polite , so well bred , and heretofore so particularly fond of her ! it was as incomprehensible as it was mortifying and grievous . From what it could arise , and where it would end , were considerations of equal perplexity and alarm . The manner in which it was done so grossly uncivil , hurrying [her]1898-her away without any reference to [her]1898-her own convenience , or allowing [her]1898-her even the appearance of choice as to the time or mode of [her]1898-her travelling ; of two days , the earliest fixed on , and of that almost the earliest hour , as if resolved to have [her]1898-her gone before [he]92-henry was stirring in the morning , that [he]92-henry might not be obliged even to see [her]1898-her . What could all this mean but an intentional affront ? By some means or other [she]1898-her must have had the misfortune to offend [him]92-henry . [Eleanor]142-eleanor had wished to spare [her]1898-her from so painful a notion , but [Catherine]73-catherine could not believe it possible that any injury or any misfortune could provoke such ill will against [a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it]1902-a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it .

Heavily passed the night . Sleep , or repose that deserved the name of sleep , was out of the question . [That room]1551-that room , in which [her]1898-her disturbed imagination had tormented [her]1898-her on [her]1898-her first arrival , was again the scene of agitated spirits and unquiet slumbers . Yet how different now the source of [her]1898-her inquietude from what it had been then — how mournfully superior in reality and substance ! [her]1898-her anxiety had foundation in fact , [her]1898-her fears in probability ; and with a mind so occupied in the contemplation of actual and natural evil , the solitude of [her]1898-her situation , the darkness of [[her]1898-her chamber]1890-her chamber , the antiquity of [the building]1283-the building , were felt and considered without the smallest emotion ; and though the wind was high , and often produced strange and sudden noises throughout [the house]211-the house , [she]1898-her heard it all as [she]1898-her lay awake , hour after hour , without curiosity or terror .

Soon after six [Eleanor]142-eleanor entered [[her]1898-her room]1360-her room , eager to show attention or give assistance where it was possible ; but very little remained to be done . [Catherine]73-catherine had not loitered ; [she]1898-her was almost dressed , and [her]1898-her packing almost finished . The possibility of some conciliatory message from [the General]800-the general occurred to [her]1898-her as [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter appeared . What so natural , as that anger should pass away and repentance succeed it ? And [she]1898-her only wanted to know how far , after what had passed , an apology might properly be received by [her]1898-her . But the knowledge would have been useless here ; it was not called for ; neither clemency nor dignity was put to the trial — [Eleanor]142-eleanor brought no message . Very little passed between [them]1910-they on meeting ; [each]1728-each found [her]1728-each greatest safety in silence , and few and trivial were the sentences exchanged while [they]1910-they remained [upstairs]443-upstairs , [Catherine]73-catherine in busy agitation completing [her]1898-her dress , and [Eleanor]142-eleanor with more goodwill than experience intent upon filling the trunk . When everything was done [they]1910-they left [the room]301-the room , [Catherine]73-catherine lingering only half a minute behind [[her]1898-her friend]305-her friend to throw a parting glance on [every well - known , cherished object]1915-every well - known , cherished object , and went down to [the breakfast - parlour]1375-the breakfast - parlour , where breakfast was prepared . [She]1898-her tried to eat , as well to save [herself]1898-her from the pain of being urged as to make [[her]1898-her friend]305-her friend comfortable ; but [she]1898-her had no appetite , and could not swallow many mouthfuls . The contrast between this and [her]1898-her last breakfast in [that room]1551-that room gave [her]1898-her fresh misery , and strengthened [her]1898-her distaste for everything before [her]1898-her . It was not four and twenty hours ago since [they]1910-they had met [there]2232-there to the same repast , but in circumstances how different ! with what cheerful ease , what happy , though false , security , had [she]1898-her then looked around [her]1898-her , enjoying everything present , and fearing little in future , beyond [Henry]92-henry ’s going to [Woodston]62-woodston for a day ! happy , happy breakfast ! for [Henry]92-henry had been [there]2232-there ; [Henry]92-henry had sat by [her]1898-her and helped [her]1898-her . These reflections were long indulged undisturbed by any address from [[her]1898-her companion]569-her companion , who sat as deep in thought as [herself]1898-her ; and the appearance of [the carriage]558-the carriage was the first thing to startle and recall them to the present moment . [Catherine]73-catherine ’s colour rose at the sight of it ; and the indignity with which [she]1898-her was treated , striking at that instant on [her]1898-her mind with peculiar force , made [her]1898-her for a short time sensible only of resentment . [Eleanor]142-eleanor seemed now impelled into resolution and speech .

“ [You]73-catherine _ must _ write to [me]1923-i , [Catherine]73-catherine , ”[1923-i] [she]1923-i cried ; “ [you]73-catherine _ must _ let [me]1923-i hear from [you]73-catherine as soon as possible . Till [I]1923-i know [you]73-catherine to be safe at [home]2403-home , [I]1923-i shall not have an hour ’s comfort . For _ one _ letter , at all risks , all hazards , [I]1923-i must entreat . Let [me]1923-i have the satisfaction of knowing that [you]73-catherine are safe at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , and have found [[your]73-catherine family]3299-your family well , and then , till [I]1923-i can ask for [your]73-catherine correspondence as [I]1923-i ought to do , [I]1923-i will not expect more . Direct to [me]1923-i at [[Lord Longtown]174-lord longtown ’s]3410-lord longtown ’s , and , [I]1923-i must ask it , under cover to [Alice]175-alice . ”[1923-i]

“ No , [Eleanor]142-eleanor , if [you]142-eleanor are not allowed to receive a letter from [me]142-eleanor , [I]142-eleanor am sure [I]142-eleanor had better not write . There can be no doubt of [my]142-eleanor getting [home]2403-home safe . ”[142-eleanor]

[Eleanor]142-eleanor only replied , “ [I]142-eleanor can not wonder at [your]142-eleanor feelings . [I]142-eleanor will not importune [you]142-eleanor . [I]142-eleanor will trust to [your]142-eleanor own kindness of heart when [I]142-eleanor am at a distance from [you]142-eleanor . ”[142-eleanor] But this , with the look of sorrow accompanying it , was enough to melt [Catherine]73-catherine ’s pride in a moment , and [she]1924-her instantly said , “ Oh , [Eleanor]142-eleanor , [I]1924-her _ will _ write to [you]142-eleanor indeed . ”[1924-her]

There was yet another point which [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney was anxious to settle , though somewhat embarrassed in speaking of . It had occurred to [her]1924-her that after so long an absence from [home]2403-home , [Catherine]73-catherine might not be provided with money enough for the expenses of [her]1924-her journey , and , upon suggesting it to [her]1924-her with most affectionate offers of accommodation , it proved to be exactly the case . [Catherine]73-catherine had never thought on the subject till that moment , but , upon examining [her]1924-her purse , was convinced that but for this kindness of [[her]1924-her friend]305-her friend , [she]1924-her might have been turned from [the house]211-the house without even the means of getting [home]2403-home ; and the distress in which [she]1924-her must have been thereby involved filling the minds of [both]1929-both , scarcely another word was said by either during the time of [their]1929-both remaining together . Short , however , was that time . [The carriage]558-the carriage was soon announced to be ready ; and [Catherine]73-catherine , instantly rising , a long and affectionate embrace supplied the place of language in bidding [each other]330-each other adieu ; and , as [they]1929-both entered [the hall]1292-the hall , unable to leave [the house]211-the house without some mention of [one whose name had not yet been spoken by either]1934-one whose name had not yet been spoken by either , [she]1924-her paused a moment , and with quivering lips just made it intelligible that [she]1924-her left “ [her]1924-her kind remembrance for [[her]1924-her absent friend]3412-her absent friend . ”[1924-her] But with this approach to [his]305-her friend name ended all possibility of restraining [her]1924-her feelings ; and , hiding [her]1924-her face as well as [she]1924-her could with [her]1924-her handkerchief , [she]1924-her darted across [the hall]1292-the hall , jumped into the chaise , and in a moment was driven from the door .

CHAPTER 29

[Catherine]73-catherine was too wretched to be fearful . The journey in itself had no terrors for [her]1924-her ; and [she]1924-her began it without either dreading its length or feeling its solitariness . Leaning back in one corner of [the carriage]558-the carriage , in a violent burst of tears , [she]1924-her was conveyed some miles beyond the walls of [the abbey]3091-the abbey before [she]1924-her raised [her]1924-her head ; and [the highest point of ground within [the park]1419-the park]1938-the highest point of ground within the park was almost closed from [her]1924-her view before [she]1924-her was capable of turning [her]1924-her eyes towards [it]1938-the highest point of ground within the park . Unfortunately , [the road [she]1924-her now travelled]1940-the road she now travelled was the same which only ten days ago [she]1924-her had so happily passed along in going to and from [Woodston]62-woodston ; and , for fourteen miles , every bitter feeling was rendered more severe by the review of objects on which [she]1924-her had first looked under impressions so different . Every mile , as it brought [her]1924-her nearer [Woodston]62-woodston , added to [her]1924-her sufferings , and when within the distance of five , [she]1924-her passed the turning which led to it , and thought of [Henry]92-henry , so near , yet so unconscious , [her]1924-her grief and agitation were excessive .

The day which [she]1924-her had spent at [that place]1941-that place had been one of the happiest of [her]1924-her life . It was there , it was on that day , that [the General]800-the general had made use of such expressions with regard to [Henry]92-henry and [herself]1924-her , had so spoken and so looked as to give [her]1924-her the most positive conviction of [his]92-henry actually wishing [their]1943-their marriage . Yes , only ten days ago had [he]92-henry elated [her]1924-her by [his]92-henry pointed regard — had [he]92-henry even confused [her]1924-her by [his]92-henry too significant reference ! and now — what had [she]1924-her done , or what had [she]1924-her omitted to do , to merit such a change ?

The only offence against [him]92-henry of which [she]1924-her could accuse [herself]1924-her had been such as was scarcely possible to reach [his]92-henry knowledge . [Henry]92-henry and [her]1924-her own heart only were privy to the shocking suspicions which [she]1924-her had so idly entertained ; and equally safe did [she]1924-her believe [her]1924-her secret with each . Designedly , at least , [Henry]92-henry could not have betrayed [her]1924-her . If , indeed , by any strange mischance [[his]92-henry father]881-his father should have gained intelligence of what [she]1924-her had dared to think and look for , of [her]1924-her causeless fancies and injurious examinations , [she]1924-her could not wonder at any degree of [his]92-henry indignation . If aware of [her]1924-her having viewed [him]92-henry as [a murderer]1945-a murderer , [she]1924-her could not wonder at [his]92-henry even turning [her]1924-her from [[his]92-henry house]1946-his house . But a justification so full of torture to [herself]1924-her , [she]1924-her trusted , would not be in [his]92-henry power .

Anxious as were all [her]1924-her conjectures on this point , it was not , however , the one on which [she]1924-her dwelt most . There was a thought yet nearer , a more prevailing , more impetuous concern . How [Henry]92-henry would think , and feel , and look , when [he]92-henry returned on the morrow to [Northanger]60-northanger and heard of [her]1924-her being gone , was a question of force and interest to rise over every other , to be never ceasing , alternately irritating and soothing ; it sometimes suggested the dread of [his]92-henry calm acquiescence , and at others was answered by the sweetest confidence in [his]92-henry regret and resentment . To [the General]800-the general , of course , [he]92-henry would not dare to speak ; but to [Eleanor]142-eleanor — what might [he]92-henry not say to [Eleanor]142-eleanor about [her]1924-her ?

In this unceasing recurrence of doubts and inquiries , on any one article of which [her]1924-her mind was incapable of more than momentary repose , the hours passed away , and [her]1924-her journey advanced much faster than [she]1924-her looked for . The pressing anxieties of thought , which prevented [her]1924-her from noticing anything before [her]1924-her , when once beyond [the neighbourhood of [Woodston]62-woodston]1948-the neighbourhood of woodston , saved [her]1924-her at the same time from watching [her]1924-her progress ; and though no object on [the road]2554-the road could engage a moment ’s attention , [she]1924-her found no stage of it tedious . From this , [she]1924-her was preserved too by another cause , by feeling no eagerness for [her]1924-her journey ’s conclusion ; for to return in such a manner to [Fullerton]3-fullerton was almost to destroy the pleasure of a meeting with those [she]1924-her loved best , even after an absence such as [hers]1924-her — an eleven weeks ’ absence . What had [she]1924-her to say that would not humble [herself]1924-her and pain [[her]1924-her family]272-her family , that would not increase [her]1924-her own grief by the confession of it , extend an useless resentment , and perhaps involve [the innocent]1951-the innocent with the guilty in undistinguishing ill will ? [She]1924-her could never do justice to [Henry]92-henry and [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s merit ; [she]1924-her felt it too strongly for expression ; and should a dislike be taken against [them]1952-them , should [they]1952-them be thought of unfavourably , on [[their]1952-them father]1091-their father ’s account , it would cut [her]1924-her to the heart .

With these feelings , [she]1924-her rather dreaded than sought for the first view of that well - known spire which would announce [her]1924-her within twenty miles of [home]2403-home . Salisbury [she]1924-her had known to be [her]1924-her point on leaving [Northanger]60-northanger ; but after the first stage [she]1924-her had been indebted to [the post - masters]1955-the post - masters for the names of the places which were then to conduct [her]1924-her to [it]1956-it ; so great had been [her]1924-her ignorance of [her]1924-her route . [She]1924-her met with nothing , however , to distress or frighten [her]1924-her . [Her]1924-her youth , civil manners , and liberal pay procured [her]1924-her all the attention that [a traveller]1957-a traveller like [herself]1924-her could require ; and stopping only to change horses , [she]1924-her travelled on for about eleven hours without accident or alarm , and between six and seven o’clock in the evening found [herself]1924-her entering [Fullerton]3-fullerton .

[A heroine]221-a heroine returning , at the close of [her]221-a heroine career , to [[her]221-a heroine native village]1959-her native village , in all the triumph of recovered reputation , and all the dignity of [a countess]1960-a countess , with a long train of noble relations in [their]1961-their several phaetons , and [three waiting - maids]1962-three waiting - maids in [a travelling chaise]1963-a travelling chaise and four , behind [her]221-a heroine , is an event on which the pen of [the contriver]1964-the contriver may well delight to dwell ; it gives credit to every conclusion , and [the author]2811-the author must share in the glory [she]2811-the author so liberally bestows . But [my]0-i affair is widely different ; [I]0-i bring back [[my]0-i heroine]779-my heroine to [[her]779-my heroine home]1967-her home in solitude and disgrace ; and no sweet elation of spirits can lead [me]0-i into minuteness . [A heroine in a hack post - chaise]1968-a heroine in a hack post - chaise is such a blow upon sentiment , as no attempt at grandeur or pathos can withstand . Swiftly therefore shall [[her]221-a heroine post - boy]1969-her post - boy drive through [the village]1779-the village , amid the gaze of [Sunday groups]1971-sunday groups , and speedy shall be [her]221-a heroine descent from [it]1972-it .

But , whatever might be the distress of [Catherine]73-catherine ’s mind , as [she]221-a heroine thus advanced towards [the parsonage]1789-the parsonage , and whatever the humiliation of [[her]221-a heroine biographer]1974-her biographer in relating it , [she]221-a heroine was preparing enjoyment of no everyday nature for those to whom [she]221-a heroine went ; first , in the appearance of [[her]221-a heroine carriage]1975-her carriage — and secondly , in [herself]221-a heroine . The chaise of [a traveller]1957-a traveller being a rare sight in [Fullerton]3-fullerton , [the whole family]1977-the whole family were immediately at the window ; and to have [it]1978-it stop at the sweep - gate was a pleasure to brighten every eye and occupy every fancy — a pleasure quite unlooked for by all but [the two youngest children]1979-the two youngest children , [a boy]1980-a boy and [girl of six and four years old]1981-girl of six and four years old , who expected [a brother]767-a brother or sister in [every carriage]1983-every carriage .
