Happy the glance that first distinguished [Catherine]73-catherine ! happy the voice that proclaimed the discovery ! but whether such happiness were the lawful property of [George]89-george or [Harriet]176-harriet could never be exactly understood .

[[Her]221-a heroine father]182-her father , [mother]183-mother , [Sarah]76-sarah , [George]89-george , and [Harriet]176-harriet , all assembled at the door to welcome [her]221-a heroine with affectionate eagerness , was a sight to awaken the best feelings of [Catherine]73-catherine ’s heart ; and in the embrace of each , as [she]221-a heroine stepped from [the carriage]558-the carriage , [she]221-a heroine found [herself]221-a heroine soothed beyond anything that [she]221-a heroine had believed possible . So surrounded , so caressed , [she]221-a heroine was even happy ! in the joyfulness of family love everything for a short time was subdued , and the pleasure of seeing [her]221-a heroine , leaving [them]1987-they at first little leisure for calm curiosity , [they]1987-they were all seated round the tea - table , which [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland had hurried for the comfort of [the poor traveller , whose pale and jaded looks]1988-the poor traveller , whose pale and jaded looks soon caught [her]78-mrs. morland notice , before any inquiry so direct as to demand a positive answer was addressed to [her]221-a heroine .

Reluctantly , and with much hesitation , did [she]221-a heroine then begin what might perhaps , at the end of half an hour , be termed , by the courtesy of [[her]221-a heroine hearers]1989-her hearers , an explanation ; but scarcely , within that time , could [they]1987-they at all discover the cause , or collect the particulars , of [her]221-a heroine sudden return . [They]1987-they were far from being [an irritable race]1990-an irritable race ; far from any quickness in catching , or bitterness in resenting , affronts : but here , when the whole was unfolded , was an insult not to be overlooked , nor , for the first half hour , to be easily pardoned . Without suffering any romantic alarm , in the consideration of [[their]1987-they daughter]1149-their daughter ’s long and lonely journey , [Mr.]1992-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland could not but feel that it might have been productive of much unpleasantness to [her]221-a heroine ; that it was what [they]1987-they could never have voluntarily suffered ; and that , in forcing [her]221-a heroine on such a measure , [General Tilney]138-general tilney had acted neither honourably nor feelingly — neither as [a gentleman]384-a gentleman nor as [a parent]1994-a parent . Why [he]138-general tilney had done it , what could have provoked [him]138-general tilney to such a breach of hospitality , and so suddenly turned all [his]138-general tilney partial regard for [[their]1987-they daughter]1149-their daughter into actual ill will , was a matter which [they]1987-they were at least as far from divining as [Catherine]73-catherine [herself]73-catherine ; but it did not oppress [them]1987-they by any means so long ; and , after a due course of useless conjecture , that “ it was a strange business , and that [he]138-general tilney must be [a very strange man]3413-a very strange man , ”[188-her mother] grew enough for all [their]1987-they indignation and wonder ; though [Sarah]76-sarah indeed still indulged in the sweets of incomprehensibility , exclaiming and conjecturing with youthful ardour . “ [[My]188-her mother dear]2185-my dear , [you]2185-my dear give [yourself]2185-my dear a great deal of needless trouble , ”[188-her mother] said [[her]1149-their daughter mother]188-her mother at last ; “ depend upon it , it is something not at all worth understanding . ”[188-her mother]

“ [I]76-sarah can allow for [his]138-general tilney wishing [Catherine]73-catherine away , when [he]138-general tilney recollected this engagement , ”[76-sarah] said [Sarah]76-sarah , “ but why not do it civilly ? ”[76-sarah]

“ [I]78-mrs. morland am sorry for [the young people]1081-the young people , ”[78-mrs. morland] returned [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland ; “ [they]1081-the young people must have a sad time of it ; but as for anything else , it is no matter now ; [Catherine]73-catherine is safe at [home]2403-home , and [our]3417-our comfort does not depend upon [General Tilney]138-general tilney . ”[73-catherine] [Catherine]73-catherine sighed . “ Well , ”[73-catherine] continued [[her]1149-their daughter philosophic mother]1997-her philosophic mother , “ [I]73-catherine am glad [I]73-catherine did not know of [your]73-catherine journey at the time ; but now it is all over , perhaps there is no great harm done . It is always good for [young people]2399-young people to be put upon exerting [themselves]2399-young people ; and [you]73-catherine know , [[my]73-catherine dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , [you]73-catherine always were [a sad little scatter - brained creature]3420-a sad little scatter - brained creature ; but now [you]73-catherine must have been forced to have [your]73-catherine wits about [you]73-catherine , with so much changing of chaises and so forth ; and [I]73-catherine hope it will appear that [you]73-catherine have not left anything behind [you]73-catherine in any of the pockets . ”[73-catherine]

[Catherine]73-catherine hoped so too , and tried to feel an interest in [her]1149-their daughter own amendment , but [her]1149-their daughter spirits were quite worn down ; and , to be silent and alone becoming soon [her]1149-their daughter only wish , [she]1149-their daughter readily agreed to [[her]1149-their daughter mother]188-her mother ’s next counsel of going early to bed . [[Her]1149-their daughter parents]1999-her parents , seeing nothing in [her]1149-their daughter ill looks and agitation but the natural consequence of mortified feelings , and of the unusual exertion and fatigue of such a journey , parted from [her]1149-their daughter without any doubt of [their]1999-her parents being soon slept away ; and though , when [they]1999-her parents all met the next morning , [her]1149-their daughter recovery was not equal to [their]1999-her parents hopes , [they]1999-her parents were still perfectly unsuspicious of there being any deeper evil . [They]1999-her parents never once thought of [her]1149-their daughter heart , which , for [the parents of [a young lady of seventeen]2001-a young lady of seventeen , just returned from [her]2001-a young lady of seventeen first excursion from [home]2403-home]2000-the parents of a young lady of seventeen , just returned from her first excursion from home , was odd enough !

As soon as breakfast was over , [she]1149-their daughter sat down to fulfil [her]1149-their daughter promise to [Miss Tilney]90-miss tilney , whose trust in the effect of time and distance on [[her]1149-their daughter friend]305-her friend ’s disposition was already justified , for already did [Catherine]73-catherine reproach [herself]73-catherine with having parted from [Eleanor]142-eleanor coldly , with having never enough valued [her]1149-their daughter merits or kindness , and never enough commiserated [her]1149-their daughter for what [she]1149-their daughter had been yesterday left to endure . The strength of these feelings , however , was far from assisting [her]1149-their daughter pen ; and never had it been harder for [her]1149-their daughter to write than in addressing [Eleanor Tilney]142-eleanor . To compose a letter which might at once do justice to [her]1149-their daughter sentiments and [her]1149-their daughter situation , convey gratitude without servile regret , be guarded without coldness , and honest without resentment — a letter which [Eleanor]142-eleanor might not be pained by the perusal of — and , above all , which [she]1149-their daughter might not blush [herself]1149-their daughter , if [Henry]92-henry should chance to see , was an undertaking to frighten away all [her]1149-their daughter powers of performance ; and , after long thought and much perplexity , to be very brief was all that [she]1149-their daughter could determine on with any confidence of safety . The money therefore which [Eleanor]142-eleanor had advanced was enclosed with little more than grateful thanks , and the thousand good wishes of [a most affectionate heart]2004-a most affectionate heart .

“ This has been a strange acquaintance , ”[78-mrs. morland] observed [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland , as the letter was finished ; “ soon made and soon ended . [I]78-mrs. morland am sorry it happens so , for [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen thought [them]3421-them very pretty kind of [young people]2399-young people ; and [you]142-eleanor were sadly out of luck too in [your]142-eleanor [Isabella]101-isabella . Ah ! [poor James]103-james ! well , [we]3423-we must live and learn ; and the next new friends [you]142-eleanor make [I]78-mrs. morland hope will be better worth keeping . ”[78-mrs. morland]

[Catherine]73-catherine coloured as [she]1149-their daughter warmly answered , “ [No friend]3424-no friend can be better worth keeping than [Eleanor]142-eleanor . ”[1149-their daughter]

“ If so , [[my]78-mrs. morland dear]2185-my dear , [I]78-mrs. morland dare say [you]142-eleanor will meet again some time or other ; do not be uneasy . It is ten to one but [you]142-eleanor are thrown together again in the course of a few years ; and then what a pleasure it will be ! ”[78-mrs. morland]

[Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland was not happy in [her]78-mrs. morland attempt at consolation . The hope of meeting again in the course of a few years could only put into [Catherine]73-catherine ’s head what might happen within that time to make a meeting dreadful to [her]1149-their daughter . [She]1149-their daughter could never forget [Henry Tilney]92-henry , or think of [him]92-henry with less tenderness than [she]1149-their daughter did at that moment ; but [he]92-henry might forget [her]1149-their daughter ; and in that case , to meet — ! [her]1149-their daughter eyes filled with tears as [she]1149-their daughter pictured [her]1149-their daughter acquaintance so renewed ; and [[her]1149-their daughter mother]188-her mother , perceiving [her]188-her mother comfortable suggestions to have had no good effect , proposed , as another expedient for restoring [her]188-her mother spirits , that [they]2006-we should call on [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen .

[The two houses]2007-the two houses were only a quarter of a mile apart ; and , as [they]2006-we walked , [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland quickly dispatched all that [she]78-mrs. morland felt on the score of [James]103-james ’s disappointment . “ [We]2006-we are sorry for [him]103-james , ”[78-mrs. morland] said [she]78-mrs. morland ; “ but otherwise there is no harm done in the match going off ; for it could not be a desirable thing to have [him]103-james engaged to [a girl whom [we]2006-we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune]3426-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune ; and now , after such behaviour , [we]2006-we can not think at all well of [her]3426-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune . Just at present it comes hard to [poor James]103-james ; but that will not last forever ; and [I]78-mrs. morland dare say [he]103-james will be [a discreeter man]3427-a discreeter man all [his]103-james life , for the foolishness of [his]103-james first choice . ”[78-mrs. morland]

This was just such a summary view of the affair as [Catherine]73-catherine could listen to ; another sentence might have endangered [her]78-mrs. morland complaisance , and made [her]78-mrs. morland reply less rational ; for soon were all [her]78-mrs. morland thinking powers swallowed up in the reflection of [her]78-mrs. morland own change of feelings and spirits since last [she]78-mrs. morland had trodden that well - known road . It was not three months ago since , wild with joyful expectation , [she]78-mrs. morland had there run backwards and forwards some ten times a day , with an heart light , gay , and independent ; looking forward to pleasures untasted and unalloyed , and free from the apprehension of evil as from the knowledge of it . Three months ago had seen [her]78-mrs. morland all this ; and now , how altered [a being]2008-a being did [she]78-mrs. morland return !

[She]78-mrs. morland was received by [the Allens]104-the allens with all the kindness which [her]78-mrs. morland unlooked - for appearance , acting on a steady affection , would naturally call forth ; and great was [their]104-the allens surprise , and warm [their]104-the allens displeasure , on hearing how [she]78-mrs. morland had been treated — though [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland ’s account of it was no inflated representation , no studied appeal to [their]104-the allens passions . “ [Catherine]73-catherine took [us]104-the allens quite by surprise yesterday evening , ”[78-mrs. morland] said [she]78-mrs. morland . “ [She]78-mrs. morland travelled all the way post by [herself]78-mrs. morland , and knew nothing of coming till Saturday night ; for [General Tilney]138-general tilney , from some odd fancy or other , all of a sudden grew tired of having [her]78-mrs. morland [there]2232-there , and almost turned [her]78-mrs. morland out of [the house]211-the house . Very unfriendly , certainly ; and [he]138-general tilney must be [a very odd man]3430-a very odd man ; but [we]104-the allens are so glad to have [her]78-mrs. morland amongst [us]104-the allens again ! and it is a great comfort to find that [she]78-mrs. morland is not a poor helpless creature , but can shift very well for [herself]78-mrs. morland . ”[78-mrs. morland]

[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen expressed [himself]83-mr. allen on the occasion with the reasonable resentment of [a sensible friend]2009-a sensible friend ; and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen thought [his]83-mr. allen expressions quite good enough to be immediately made use of again by [herself]86-mrs. allen . [His]83-mr. allen wonder , [his]83-mr. allen conjectures , and [his]83-mr. allen explanations became in succession [hers]86-mrs. allen , with the addition of this single remark—“I really have not patience with [the General”—to]3431-the general”—to[86-mrs. allen] fill up every accidental pause . And , “ [I]2011-i really have not patience with [the General]800-the general , ”[2011-i] was uttered twice after [Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen left [the room]301-the room , without any relaxation of anger , or any material digression of thought . A more considerable degree of wandering attended the third repetition ; and , after completing the fourth , [she]2011-i immediately added , “ Only think , [[my]2011-i dear]2185-my dear , of [my]2011-i having got that frightful great rent in [my]2011-i best Mechlin so charmingly mended , before [I]2011-i left [Bath]2236-bath , that [one]2201-one can hardly see where it was . [I]2011-i must show it [you]2185-my dear some day or other . [Bath]2236-bath is [a nice place]3437-a nice place , [Catherine]73-catherine , after all . [I]2011-i assure [you]2185-my dear [I]2011-i did not above half like coming away . [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe ’s being there was such a comfort to [us]3438-us , was not it ? [You]2185-my dear know , [you]2185-my dear and [I]2011-i were quite forlorn at first . ”[2011-i]

“ Yes , but _ that _ did not last long , ”[73-catherine] said [Catherine]73-catherine , [her]2012-her eyes brightening at the recollection of what had first given spirit to [her]2012-her existence there .

“ Very true : [we]3438-us soon met with [Mrs. Thorpe]96-mrs. thorpe , and then [we]3438-us wanted for nothing . [[My]2011-i dear]2185-my dear , do not [you]2185-my dear think these silk gloves wear very well ? [I]2011-i put them on new the first time of [our]3438-us going to [the Lower Rooms]362-the lower rooms , [you]2185-my dear know , and [I]2011-i have worn them a great deal since . Do [you]2185-my dear remember that evening ? ”[2011-i]

“ Do [I]2012-her ! oh ! perfectly . ”[2012-her]

“ It was very agreeable , was not it ? [Mr. Tilney]92-henry drank tea with [us]3438-us , and [I]2011-i always thought [him]92-henry a great addition , [he]92-henry is so very agreeable . [I]2011-i have a notion [you]2185-my dear danced with [him]92-henry , but am not quite sure . [I]2011-i remember [I]2011-i had [my]2011-i favourite gown on . ”[2011-i]

[Catherine]73-catherine could not answer ; and , after a short trial of other subjects , [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen again returned to—“I really have not patience with [the General]800-the general ! such [an agreeable , worthy man]3442-an agreeable , worthy man as [he]92-henry seemed to be ! [i]2011-i do not suppose , [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland , [you]2185-my dear ever saw [a better - bred man in [your]2185-my dear life]3443-a better - bred man in your life . [[His]3443-a better - bred man in your life lodgings]3444-his lodgings were taken the very day after [he]3443-a better - bred man in your life left [them]3444-his lodgings , [Catherine]73-catherine . But no wonder ; [Milsom Street]14-milsom street , [you]2185-my dear know . ”[2011-i]

As [they]2013-they walked [home]2403-home again , [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland endeavoured to impress on [[her]78-mrs. morland daughter]266-her daughter ’s mind the happiness of having [such steady well - wishers as [Mr.]2017-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen]2016-such steady well - wishers as mr. and mrs. allen , and the very little consideration which the neglect or unkindness of slight acquaintance like [the Tilneys]132-the tilneys ought to have with [her]266-her daughter , while [she]266-her daughter could preserve the good opinion and affection of [[her]266-her daughter earliest friends]2018-her earliest friends . There was a great deal of good sense in all this ; but there are some situations of the human mind in which good sense has very little power ; and [Catherine]73-catherine ’s feelings contradicted almost every position [[her]266-her daughter mother]188-her mother advanced . It was upon the behaviour of [these very slight acquaintance]2020-these very slight acquaintance that all [her]266-her daughter present happiness depended ; and while [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland was successfully confirming [her]78-mrs. morland own opinions by the justness of [her]78-mrs. morland own representations , [Catherine]73-catherine was silently reflecting that _ now _ [Henry]92-henry must have arrived at [Northanger]60-northanger ; _ now _ [he]92-henry must have heard of [her]266-her daughter departure ; and _ now _ , perhaps , [they]2021-they were all setting off for [Hereford]70-hereford .

CHAPTER 30

[Catherine]73-catherine ’s disposition was not naturally sedentary , nor had [her]266-her daughter habits been ever very industrious ; but whatever might hitherto have been [her]266-her daughter defects of that sort , [[her]266-her daughter mother]188-her mother could not but perceive them now to be greatly increased . [She]266-her daughter could neither sit still nor employ [herself]266-her daughter for ten minutes together , walking round [the garden]3180-the garden and [orchard]1423-orchard again and again , as if nothing but motion was voluntary ; and it seemed as if [she]266-her daughter could even walk about [the house]211-the house rather than remain fixed for any time in [the parlour]1015-the parlour . [Her]266-her daughter loss of spirits was a yet greater alteration . In [her]266-her daughter rambling and [her]266-her daughter idleness [she]266-her daughter might only be a caricature of [herself]266-her daughter ; but in [her]266-her daughter silence and sadness [she]266-her daughter was the very reverse of all that [she]266-her daughter had been before .

For two days [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland allowed it to pass even without a hint ; but when a third night ’s rest had neither restored [her]266-her daughter cheerfulness , improved [her]266-her daughter in useful activity , nor given [her]266-her daughter a greater inclination for needlework , [she]266-her daughter could no longer refrain from the gentle reproof of , “ [[My]266-her daughter dear]2185-my dear [Catherine]73-catherine , [I]266-her daughter am afraid [you]73-catherine are growing quite [a fine lady]3446-a fine lady . [I]266-her daughter do not know when poor [Richard]74-captain tilney ’s cravats would be done , if [he]74-captain tilney had [no friend]3424-no friend but [you]73-catherine . [Your]73-catherine head runs too much upon Bath ; but there is a time for everything — a time for balls and plays , and a time for work . [You]73-catherine have had a long run of amusement , and now [you]73-catherine must try to be useful . ”[266-her daughter]

[Catherine]73-catherine took up [her]266-her daughter work directly , saying , in a dejected voice , that “ [her]266-her daughter head did not run upon Bath — much . ”[73-catherine]

“ Then [you]73-catherine are fretting about [General Tilney]138-general tilney , and that is very simple of [you]73-catherine ; for ten to one whether [you]73-catherine ever see [him]138-general tilney again . [You]73-catherine should never fret about trifles . ”[73-catherine] After a short silence—“I hope , [[my]73-catherine Catherine]2859-my catherine , [you]73-catherine are not getting out of humour with [home]2403-home because it is not so grand as [Northanger]60-northanger . That would be turning [your]73-catherine visit into an evil indeed . Wherever [you]73-catherine are [you]73-catherine should always be contented , but especially at [home]2403-home , because there [you]73-catherine must spend the most of [your]73-catherine time . [I]73-catherine did not quite like , at breakfast , to hear [you]73-catherine talk so much about the French bread at [Northanger]60-northanger . ”[73-catherine]

“ [I]73-catherine am sure [I]73-catherine do not care about the bread . It is all the same to [me]73-catherine what [I]73-catherine eat . ”[73-catherine]

“ There is a very clever essay in one of the books [upstairs]443-upstairs upon much such a subject , about [young girls that have been spoilt for [home]2403-home by great acquaintance]3452-young girls that have been spoilt for home by great acquaintance — The Mirror , [I]73-catherine think . [I]73-catherine will look it out for [you]73-catherine some day or other , because [I]73-catherine am sure it will do [you]73-catherine good . ”[73-catherine]

[Catherine]73-catherine said no more , and , with an endeavour to do right , applied to [her]2027-she work ; but , after a few minutes , sunk again , without knowing it [herself]2027-she , into languor and listlessness , moving [herself]2027-she in [her]2027-she chair , from the irritation of weariness , much oftener than [she]2027-she moved [her]2027-she needle . [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland watched the progress of this relapse ; and seeing , in [[her]78-mrs. morland daughter]266-her daughter ’s absent and dissatisfied look , the full proof of that repining spirit to which [she]2027-she had now begun to attribute [her]2027-she want of cheerfulness , hastily left [the room]301-the room to fetch the book in question , anxious to lose no time in attacking so dreadful a malady . It was some time before [she]2027-she could find what [she]2027-she looked for ; and other family matters occurring to detain [her]2027-she , a quarter of an hour had elapsed ere [she]2027-she returned [downstairs]693-downstairs with the volume from which so much was hoped . [Her]2027-she avocations above having shut out all noise but what [she]2027-she created [herself]2027-she , [she]2027-she knew not that [a visitor]1233-a visitor had arrived within the last few minutes , till , on entering [the room]301-the room , the first object [she]2027-she beheld was [a young man whom [she]2027-she had never seen before]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before . With a look of much respect , [he]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before immediately rose , and being introduced to [her]2027-she by [[her]2027-she conscious daughter]2034-her conscious daughter as “ [Mr. Henry Tilney]92-henry , ”[2033-a young man whom she had never seen before] with the embarrassment of real sensibility began to apologize for [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before appearance [there]2232-there , acknowledging that after what had passed [he]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before had little right to expect a welcome at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , and stating [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before impatience to be assured of [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s having reached [[her]84-miss morland home]1967-her home in safety , as the cause of [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before intrusion . [He]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before did not address [himself]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before to [an uncandid judge or a resentful heart]2037-an uncandid judge or a resentful heart . Far from comprehending [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before or [[his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before sister]2288-his sister in [[their]2039-their father]1091-their father ’s misconduct , [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland had been always kindly disposed towards [each]1728-each , and instantly , pleased by [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before appearance , received [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before with the simple professions of unaffected benevolence ; thanking [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before for such an attention to [[her]78-mrs. morland daughter]266-her daughter , assuring [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before that [the friends of [[her]78-mrs. morland children]216-her children]2043-the friends of her children were always welcome [there]2232-there , and entreating [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before to say not another word of the past .

[He]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before was not ill - inclined to obey this request , for , though [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before heart was greatly relieved by such unlooked - for mildness , it was not just at that moment in [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before power to say anything to the purpose . Returning in silence to [his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before seat , therefore , [he]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before remained for some minutes most civilly answering all [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland ’s common remarks about the weather and [roads]2046-roads . [Catherine]73-catherine meanwhile — [the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish Catherine]2047-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine — said not a word ; but [her]2047-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine glowing cheek and brightened eye made [[her]2047-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine mother]188-her mother trust that this good - natured visit would at least set [her]188-her mother heart at ease for a time , and gladly therefore did [she]188-her mother lay aside the first volume of The Mirror for a future hour .

Desirous of [Mr. Morland]103-james ’s assistance , as well in giving encouragement , as in finding conversation for [[her]78-mrs. morland guest]2907-her guest , whose embarrassment on [[his]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before father]881-his father ’s account [she]78-mrs. morland earnestly pitied , [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland had very early dispatched [one of [the children]2052-the children]2051-one of the children to summon [him]2033-a young man whom she had never seen before ; but [Mr. Morland]103-james was from [home]2403-home — and being thus without any support , at the end of a quarter of an hour [she]78-mrs. morland had nothing to say . After a couple of minutes ’ unbroken silence , [Henry]92-henry , turning to [Catherine]73-catherine for the first time since [[her]2047-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine mother]188-her mother ’s entrance , asked [her]188-her mother , with sudden alacrity , if [Mr.]2055-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen were now at [Fullerton]3-fullerton ? And on developing , from amidst all [her]188-her mother perplexity of words in reply , the meaning , which one short syllable would have given , immediately expressed [his]92-henry intention of paying [his]92-henry respects to [them]2052-the children , and , with a rising colour , asked [her]188-her mother if [she]188-her mother would have the goodness to show [him]92-henry the way . “ [You]92-henry may see [the house]211-the house from this window , [sir]2221-sir , ”[188-her mother] was information on [Sarah]76-sarah ’s side , which produced only a bow of acknowledgment from [the gentleman]382-the gentleman , and a silencing nod from [[her]2047-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine mother]188-her mother ; for [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland , thinking it probable , as a secondary consideration in [his]92-henry wish of waiting on [[their]2052-the children worthy neighbours]2058-their worthy neighbours , that [he]92-henry might have some explanation to give of [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s behaviour , which it must be more pleasant for [him]92-henry to communicate only to [Catherine]73-catherine , would not on any account prevent [her]188-her mother accompanying [him]92-henry . [They]2052-the children began [their]2052-the children walk , and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland was not entirely mistaken in [his]92-henry object in wishing it . Some explanation on [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s account [he]92-henry had to give ; but [his]92-henry first purpose was to explain [himself]92-henry , and before [they]2052-the children reached [[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s grounds]2061-mr. allen ’s grounds [he]92-henry had done it so well that [Catherine]73-catherine did not think it could ever be repeated too often . [She]188-her mother was assured of [his]92-henry affection ; and that heart in return was solicited , which , perhaps , [they]2052-the children pretty equally knew was already entirely [his]92-henry own ; for , though [Henry]92-henry was now sincerely attached to [her]188-her mother , though [he]92-henry felt and delighted in all the excellencies of [her]188-her mother character and truly loved [[her]188-her mother society]2062-her society , [I]0-i must confess that [his]92-henry affection originated in nothing better than gratitude , or , in other words , that a persuasion of [her]188-her mother partiality for [him]92-henry had been the only cause of giving [her]188-her mother a serious thought . It is a new circumstance in romance , [I]0-i acknowledge , and dreadfully derogatory of [an heroine]181-an heroine ’s dignity ; but if it be as new in common life , the credit of a wild imagination will at least be all [my]0-i own .

A very short visit to [Mrs. Allen]86-mrs. allen , in which [Henry]92-henry talked at random , without sense or connection , and [Catherine]73-catherine , wrapt in the contemplation of [her]188-her mother own unutterable happiness , scarcely opened [her]188-her mother lips , dismissed them to the ecstasies of another tête - à - tête ; and before it was suffered to close , [she]188-her mother was enabled to judge how far [he]92-henry was sanctioned by parental authority in [his]92-henry present application . On [his]92-henry return from [Woodston]62-woodston , two days before , [he]92-henry had been met near [the abbey]3091-the abbey by [[his]92-henry impatient father]2065-his impatient father , hastily informed in angry terms of [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s departure , and ordered to think of [her]84-miss morland no more .

Such was the permission upon which [he]92-henry had now offered [her]188-her mother [his]92-henry hand . [The affrighted Catherine]73-catherine , amidst all the terrors of expectation , as [she]188-her mother listened to this account , could not but rejoice in the kind caution with which [Henry]92-henry had saved [her]188-her mother from the necessity of a conscientious rejection , by engaging [her]188-her mother faith before [he]92-henry mentioned the subject ; and as [he]92-henry proceeded to give the particulars , and explain the motives of [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s conduct , [her]188-her mother feelings soon hardened into even a triumphant delight . [The General]800-the general had had nothing to accuse [her]188-her mother of , nothing to lay to [her]188-her mother charge , but [her]188-her mother being the involuntary , unconscious object of a deception which [his]92-henry pride could not pardon , and which [a better pride]2068-a better pride would have been ashamed to own . [She]188-her mother was guilty only of being less rich than [he]92-henry had supposed [her]188-her mother to be . Under a mistaken persuasion of [her]188-her mother possessions and claims , [he]92-henry had courted [her]188-her mother acquaintance in [Bath]5-bath , solicited [her]188-her mother company at [Northanger]60-northanger , and designed [her]188-her mother for [[his]92-henry daughter - in - law]2069-his daughter - in - law . On discovering [his]92-henry error , to turn [her]188-her mother from [the house]211-the house seemed the best , though to [his]92-henry feelings an inadequate proof of [his]92-henry resentment towards [herself]188-her mother , and [his]92-henry contempt of [[her]188-her mother family]272-her family .

[John Thorpe]97-john had first misled [him]92-henry . [The General]800-the general , perceiving [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son one night at [the theatre]2218-the theatre to be paying considerable attention to [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , had accidentally inquired of [Thorpe]97-john if [he]92-henry knew more of [her]188-her mother than [her]188-her mother name . [Thorpe]97-john , most happy to be on speaking terms with [a man of [General Tilney]138-general tilney ’s importance]2075-a man of general tilney ’s importance , had been joyfully and proudly communicative ; and being at that time not only in daily expectation of [Morland]84-miss morland ’s engaging [Isabella]101-isabella , but likewise pretty well resolved upon marrying [Catherine]73-catherine [himself]92-henry , [his]92-henry vanity induced [him]92-henry to represent [the family]454-the family as yet more wealthy than [his]92-henry vanity and avarice had made [him]92-henry believe [them]2077-them . With whomsoever [he]92-henry was , or was likely to be connected , [his]92-henry own consequence always required that [theirs]2078-theirs should be great , and as [his]92-henry intimacy with [any acquaintance]2079-any acquaintance grew , so regularly grew [their]2078-theirs fortune . The expectations of [[his]92-henry friend]556-his friend [Morland]73-catherine , therefore , from the first overrated , had ever since [his]92-henry introduction to [Isabella]101-isabella been gradually increasing ; and by merely adding twice as much for the grandeur of the moment , by doubling what [he]92-henry chose to think the amount of [Mr. Morland]103-james ’s preferment , trebling [his]92-henry private fortune , bestowing [a rich aunt]2081-a rich aunt , and sinking half [the children]2052-the children , [he]92-henry was able to represent [the whole family]1977-the whole family to [the General]800-the general in a most respectable light . For [Catherine]73-catherine , however , the peculiar object of [the General]800-the general ’s curiosity , and [his]800-the general own speculations , [he]800-the general had yet something more in reserve , and the ten or fifteen thousand pounds which [[her]101-isabella father]182-her father could give [her]101-isabella would be a pretty addition to [[Mr. Allen]83-mr. allen ’s estate]2087-mr. allen ’s estate . [Her]101-isabella intimacy there had made [him]800-the general seriously determine on [her]101-isabella being handsomely legacied hereafter ; and to speak of [her]101-isabella therefore as [the almost acknowledged future heiress of [Fullerton]3-fullerton]2088-the almost acknowledged future heiress of fullerton naturally followed . Upon such intelligence [the General]800-the general had proceeded ; for never had it occurred to [him]800-the general to doubt [its]2090-its authority . [Thorpe]101-isabella ’s interest in [the family]454-the family , by [[his]800-the general sister]2288-his sister ’s approaching connection with one of [[its]454-the family members]2093-its members , and [his]800-the general own views on another ( circumstances of which [he]800-the general boasted with almost equal openness ) , seemed sufficient vouchers for [his]800-the general truth ; and to these were added the absolute facts of [the Allens]104-the allens being wealthy and childless , of [Miss Morland]84-miss morland ’s being under [their]104-the allens care , and — as soon as [his]800-the general acquaintance allowed [him]800-the general to judge — of [their]104-the allens treating [her]84-miss morland with parental kindness . [His]800-the general resolution was soon formed . Already had [he]800-the general discerned a liking towards [Miss Morland]84-miss morland in the countenance of [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son ; and thankful for [Mr. Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ’s communication , [he]800-the general almost instantly determined to spare no pains in weakening [his]800-the general boasted interest and ruining [his]800-the general dearest hopes . [Catherine]73-catherine [herself]73-catherine could not be more ignorant at the time of all this , than [[his]800-the general own children]2095-his own children . [Henry]92-henry and [Eleanor]142-eleanor , perceiving nothing in [her]84-miss morland situation likely to engage [[their]104-the allens father]1091-their father ’s particular respect , had seen with astonishment the suddenness , continuance , and extent of [his]800-the general attention ; and though latterly , from some hints which had accompanied an almost positive command to [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son of doing everything in [his]800-the general power to attach [her]84-miss morland , [Henry]92-henry was convinced of [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s believing it to be an advantageous connection , it was not till the late explanation at [Northanger]60-northanger that [they]104-the allens had the smallest idea of the false calculations which had hurried [him]800-the general on . That they were false , [the General]800-the general had learnt from [the very person who had suggested [them]104-the allens]2100-the very person who had suggested them , from [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe [himself]119-mr. thorpe , whom [he]119-mr. thorpe had chanced to meet again in [town]2354-town , and who , under the influence of exactly opposite feelings , irritated by [Catherine]73-catherine ’s refusal , and yet more by the failure of a very recent endeavour to accomplish a reconciliation between [Morland]73-catherine and [Isabella]101-isabella , convinced that [they]104-the allens were separated forever , and spurning a friendship which could be no longer serviceable , hastened to contradict all that [he]800-the general had said before to the advantage of [the Morlands]75-the morlands — confessed [himself]800-the general to have been totally mistaken in [his]800-the general opinion of [their]104-the allens circumstances and character , misled by the rhodomontade of [[his]800-the general friend]556-his friend to believe [[his]800-the general father]881-his father [a man of substance and credit]2104-a man of substance and credit , whereas the transactions of the two or three last weeks proved [him]800-the general to be neither ; for after coming eagerly forward on the first overture of a marriage between [the families]2105-the families , with the most liberal proposals , [he]800-the general had , on being brought to the point by the shrewdness of [the relator]2106-the relator , been constrained to acknowledge [himself]800-the general incapable of giving [the young people]1081-the young people even a decent support . [They]1081-the young people were , in fact , [a necessitous family]2108-a necessitous family ; numerous , too , almost beyond example ; by no means respected in [[their]1081-the young people own neighbourhood]2109-their own neighbourhood , as [he]800-the general had lately had particular opportunities of discovering ; aiming at a style of life which [their]1081-the young people fortune could not warrant ; seeking to better [themselves]1081-the young people by wealthy connections ; [a forward , bragging , scheming race]2110-a forward , bragging , scheming race .

[The terrified General]2111-the terrified general pronounced the name of [Allen]83-mr. allen with an inquiring look ; and here too [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe had learnt [his]119-mr. thorpe error . [The Allens]104-the allens , [he]800-the general believed , had lived near [them]104-the allens too long , and [he]800-the general knew [the young man on whom [the Fullerton estate]2113-the fullerton estate]2112-the young man on whom the fullerton estate must devolve . [The General]800-the general needed no more . Enraged with [almost everybody in [the world]191-the world]2115-almost everybody in the world but [himself]800-the general , [he]800-the general set out the next day for [the abbey]3091-the abbey , where [his]800-the general performances have been seen .

[I]0-i leave it to [[my]0-i reader]2118-my reader ’s sagacity to determine how much of all this it was possible for [Henry]92-henry to communicate at this time to [Catherine]73-catherine , how much of it [he]92-henry could have learnt from [[his]92-henry father]881-his father , in what points [his]92-henry own conjectures might assist [him]92-henry , and what portion must yet remain to be told in a letter from [James]103-james . [I]0-i have united for [their]2120-their ease what [they]2120-their must divide for mine . [Catherine]73-catherine , at any rate , heard enough to feel that in suspecting [General Tilney]138-general tilney of either murdering or shutting up [[his]138-general tilney wife]337-his wife , [she]337-his wife had scarcely sinned against [his]138-general tilney character , or magnified [his]138-general tilney cruelty .

[Henry]92-henry , in having such things to relate of [[his]92-henry father]881-his father , was almost as pitiable as in [their]2120-their first avowal to [himself]92-henry . [He]92-henry blushed for the narrow - minded counsel which [he]92-henry was obliged to expose . The conversation between [them]2120-their at [Northanger]60-northanger had been of the most unfriendly kind . [Henry]92-henry ’s indignation on hearing how [Catherine]73-catherine had been treated , on comprehending [[his]92-henry father]881-his father ’s views , and being ordered to acquiesce in them , had been open and bold . [The General]800-the general , accustomed on every ordinary occasion to give the law in [[his]800-the general family]429-his family , prepared for no reluctance but of feeling , no opposing desire that should dare to clothe itself in words , could ill brook the opposition of [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son , steady as the sanction of reason and the dictate of conscience could make it . But , in such a cause , [his]800-the general anger , though it must shock , could not intimidate [Henry]92-henry , who was sustained in [his]92-henry purpose by a conviction of its justice . [He]92-henry felt [himself]92-henry bound as much in honour as in affection to [Miss Morland]84-miss morland , and believing that heart to be [his]92-henry own which [he]92-henry had been directed to gain , no unworthy retraction of a tacit consent , no reversing decree of unjustifiable anger , could shake [his]92-henry fidelity , or influence the resolutions it prompted .

[He]92-henry steadily refused to accompany [[his]92-henry father]881-his father into [Herefordshire]71-herefordshire , an engagement formed almost at the moment to promote the dismissal of [Catherine]73-catherine , and as steadily declared [his]92-henry intention of offering [her]84-miss morland [his]92-henry hand . [The General]800-the general was furious in [his]800-the general anger , and [they]2129-they parted in dreadful disagreement . [Henry]92-henry , in an agitation of mind which many solitary hours were required to compose , had returned almost instantly to [Woodston]62-woodston , and , on the afternoon of the following day , had begun [his]92-henry journey to [Fullerton]3-fullerton .

CHAPTER 31

[Mr.]2130-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland ’s surprise on being applied to by [Mr. Tilney]92-henry for [their]2129-they consent to [his]92-henry marrying [[their]2129-they daughter]1149-their daughter was , for a few minutes , considerable , it having never entered [their]2129-they heads to suspect an attachment on either side ; but as nothing , after all , could be more natural than [Catherine]73-catherine ’s being beloved , [they]2129-they soon learnt to consider it with only the happy agitation of gratified pride , and , as far as [they]2129-they alone were concerned , had not a single objection to start . [His]92-henry pleasing manners and good sense were self - evident recommendations ; and having never heard evil of [him]92-henry , it was not [their]2129-they way to suppose any evil could be told . [Goodwill]177-goodwill supplying the place of experience , [his]92-henry character needed no attestation . “ [Catherine]73-catherine would make [a sad , heedless young housekeeper]3456-a sad , heedless young housekeeper to be sure , ”[188-her mother] was [[her]1149-their daughter mother]188-her mother ’s foreboding remark ; but quick was the consolation of there being nothing like practice .

There was but one obstacle , in short , to be mentioned ; but till that one was removed , it must be impossible for [them]2129-they to sanction the engagement . [Their]2129-they tempers were mild , but [their]2129-they principles were steady , and while [[his]92-henry parent]2133-his parent so expressly forbade the connection , [they]2129-they could not allow [themselves]2129-they to encourage it . That [the General]800-the general should come forward to solicit the alliance , or that [he]800-the general should even very heartily approve it , [they]2129-they were not refined enough to make any parading stipulation ; but the decent appearance of consent must be yielded , and that once obtained — and [their]2129-they own hearts made [them]2129-they trust that it could not be very long denied — [their]2129-they willing approbation was instantly to follow . [His]92-henry _ consent _ was all that [they]2129-they wished for . [They]2129-they were no more inclined than entitled to demand [his]92-henry _ money _ . Of a very considerable fortune , [[his]92-henry son]2708-his son was , by marriage settlements , eventually secure ; [his]2708-his son present income was an income of independence and comfort , and under every pecuniary view , it was a match beyond the claims of [[their]2129-they daughter]1149-their daughter .

[The young people]1081-the young people could not be surprised at a decision like this . [They]2129-they felt and [they]2129-they deplored — but [they]2129-they could not resent it ; and [they]2129-they parted , endeavouring to hope that such a change in [the General]800-the general , as [each]1728-each believed almost impossible , might speedily take place , to unite [them]2129-they again in the fulness of privileged affection . [Henry]92-henry returned to what was now [[his]92-henry only home]2140-his only home , to watch over [[his]92-henry young plantations]2141-his young plantations , and extend [his]92-henry improvements for [her]1149-their daughter sake , to whose share in them [he]92-henry looked anxiously forward ; and [Catherine]73-catherine remained at [Fullerton]3-fullerton to cry . Whether the torments of absence were softened by a clandestine correspondence , let [us]2142-us not inquire . [Mr.]2143-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]78-mrs. morland never did — [they]2129-they had been too kind to exact any promise ; and whenever [Catherine]73-catherine received a letter , as , at that time , happened pretty often , [they]2129-they always looked another way .

The anxiety , which in this state of [their]2129-they attachment must be the portion of [Henry]92-henry and [Catherine]73-catherine , and of [all who loved either , as to its final event]2144-all who loved either , as to its final event , can hardly extend , [I]0-i fear , to the bosom of [[my]0-i readers]2145-my readers , who will see in the tell - tale compression of the pages before [them]2145-my readers , that [we]2142-us are all hastening together to perfect felicity . The means by which [their]2129-they early marriage was effected can be the only doubt : what probable circumstance could work upon a temper like [the General]800-the general ’s ? The circumstance which chiefly availed was the marriage of [[his]92-henry daughter]2509-his daughter with [a man of fortune and consequence , which took place in the course of the summer]2148-a man of fortune and consequence , which took place in the course of the summer — an accession of dignity that threw [him]92-henry into a fit of good humour , from which [he]92-henry did not recover till after [Eleanor]142-eleanor had obtained [his]142-eleanor forgiveness of [Henry]92-henry , and [his]142-eleanor permission for [him]92-henry “ to be [a fool]2682-a fool if [he]92-henry liked it ! ”[142-eleanor]

The marriage of [Eleanor Tilney]142-eleanor , [her]2149-her removal from all the evils of [such a home as [Northanger]60-northanger]2150-such a home as northanger had been made by [Henry]92-henry ’s banishment , to [the home of [her]2149-her choice]2151-the home of her choice and [the man of [her]2149-her choice]2152-the man of her choice , is an event which [I]0-i expect to give general satisfaction among all [her]2149-her acquaintance . [My]0-i own joy on the occasion is very sincere . [I]0-i know [no one more entitled , by unpretending merit , or better prepared by habitual suffering]2153-no one more entitled , by unpretending merit , or better prepared by habitual suffering , to receive and enjoy felicity . [Her]2149-her partiality for [this gentleman]2154-this gentleman was not of recent origin ; and [he]2154-this gentleman had been long withheld only by inferiority of situation from addressing [her]2149-her . [His]2154-this gentleman unexpected accession to title and fortune had removed all [his]2154-this gentleman difficulties ; and never had [the General]800-the general loved [[his]800-the general daughter]2509-his daughter so well in all [her]2509-his daughter hours of companionship , utility , and patient endurance as when [he]800-the general first hailed [her]2509-his daughter “ [[Your]2509-his daughter Ladyship]3458-your ladyship ! ”[800-the general] [[Her]2149-her husband]810-her husband was really deserving of [her]2149-her ; independent of [his]2154-this gentleman peerage , [his]2154-this gentleman wealth , and [his]2154-this gentleman attachment , being to a precision [the most charming young man in [the world]191-the world]2158-the most charming young man in the world . Any further definition of [his]2154-this gentleman merits must be unnecessary ; [the most charming young man in [the world]191-the world]2158-the most charming young man in the world is instantly before the imagination of [us]2162-us all . Concerning [the one in question]2163-the one in question , therefore , [I]0-i have only to add — aware that the rules of composition forbid the introduction of [a character not connected with [my]0-i fable]2164-a character not connected with my fable — that this was [the very gentleman whose negligent servant left behind [him]2154-this gentleman that collection of washing - bills , resulting from a long visit at [Northanger]60-northanger , by which [[my]0-i heroine]779-my heroine was involved in one of [her]779-my heroine most alarming adventures]2165-the very gentleman whose negligent servant left behind him that collection of washing - bills , resulting from a long visit at northanger , by which my heroine was involved in one of her most alarming adventures .

The influence of [the Viscount]2167-the viscount and [Viscountess]178-viscountess in [[their]2168-their brother]1738-their brother ’s behalf was assisted by that right understanding of [Mr. Morland]103-james ’s circumstances which , as soon as [the General]800-the general would allow [himself]800-the general to be informed , [they]2168-their were qualified to give . It taught [him]800-the general that [he]800-the general had been scarcely more misled by [Thorpe]119-mr. thorpe ’s first boast of the family wealth than by [his]800-the general subsequent malicious overthrow of it ; that in no sense of the word were [they]2168-their necessitous or poor , and that [Catherine]73-catherine would have three thousand pounds . This was so material an amendment of [his]800-the general late expectations that it greatly contributed to smooth the descent of [his]800-the general pride ; and by no means without its effect was the private intelligence , which [he]800-the general was at some pains to procure , that [the Fullerton estate]2113-the fullerton estate , being entirely at the disposal of [its present proprietor]2172-its present proprietor , was consequently open to every greedy speculation .

On the strength of this , [the General]800-the general , soon after [Eleanor]142-eleanor ’s marriage , permitted [[his]800-the general son]2708-his son to return to [Northanger]60-northanger , and thence made [him]2708-his son the bearer of [his]800-the general consent , very courteously worded in a page full of empty professions to [Mr. Morland]103-james . The event which it authorized soon followed : [Henry]92-henry and [Catherine]73-catherine were married , the bells rang , and [everybody]318-everybody smiled ; and , as this took place within a twelvemonth from the first day of [their]2168-their meeting , it will not appear , after all the dreadful delays occasioned by [the General]800-the general ’s cruelty , that [they]2168-their were essentially hurt by it . To begin perfect happiness at the respective ages of twenty - six and eighteen is to do pretty well ; and professing [myself]0-i moreover convinced that [the General]800-the general ’s unjust interference , so far from being really injurious to [their]2168-their felicity , was perhaps rather conducive to it , by improving [their]2168-their knowledge of each other , and adding strength to [their]2168-their attachment , [I]0-i leave it to be settled , by whomsoever it may concern , whether the tendency of this work be altogether to recommend parental tyranny , or reward filial disobedience .
